author: Michael N.
text:
A big thank you to Mona Lisa in North Beach for the delicious food, we ate it in their car out in front. It was so romantic and a lot of people were walking by taking pictures. We sang some songs to them while we ate. It was so much fun.

The owner Maurizio is a really sweet guy, he's been so kind to us since we started going there 3 years ago. We had never dined in the car, but he convinced us and we didn't regret it! We got a pizza, a pasta and a salad. Just the right balance. And Maurizio was teaching us some Italian while we were in the car. So fun!!!

It's definitely something every San Franciscan or tourist should do at least once is their life! You won't regret it!!!

Sincerely,
@michaelniktaris
CEO @aquarius3e LLC

author: Meredith P.
text:
Mona Lisa is a very fun/lively restaurant with really good food! The menu is vast and ranges from pasta and pizza to seafood that looked (and smelled) amazing. 

We had feasted at lunch, so unfortunately we were not starving when we got to dinner, but we ordered bruschetta and a salad to start with and both were delicious and a large helping. The bruschetta was nice and crispy and full of flavor. We got a salad with the italian dressing and while it was good, there was just a tad too much dressing on the salad for our liking. 

I ordered the penne arrabbiata and it was huge and delicious. My husband ordered the Mona Lisa pizza and it was loaded with the toppings and the crust was good. The table behind us got a huge bowl of what looked like mussels and they looked amazing - next trip, definitely will come back for these. 

The service was good/hand's off which was nice - they didn't seem to be rushing us out the door even though there was a wait to get in. Will be back next trip to SF and recommend for a good, relatively priced meal in North Beach.

author: scott h.
text:
A solid four stars. 

The fried calamari was excellent. it was perfectly seasoned, and ultra tender. And it was obviously it's very fresh.

Margherita pizza met expectations, but nothing special.

I dined outside on the sidewalk. The weather is nice, this is the only way to go. 

At times I got the feeling the staff was more interested in collecting customers off the sidewalk than attending to the ones they had.

author: Julie K.
text:
Mona Lisa's pasta is amazing! There's a wide range of items on the menu and I got the spaghetti carbonara and it was delicious 
pros: 
-pasta is very fresh
-sauce isn't too greasy or too thick but just the right amount of seasoning 
-i can tell the pasta is really good quality and the chefs took a lot of time to craft each dish 
-it tasted like authentic italian food and is worth coming again
cons: 
-we had a reservation but had to wait an additional 30 minutes 
-the pasta took about an hour to come out
-the pasta was delicious but the long wait made me take off a star

author: Lilly K.
text:
STOP READING RIGHT NOW AND JUST GO! 

But if you must read let me tell you, this place is hands down A-MAZING. I used to work in North Beach and would often pass Mona Lisa on my commute, they typically have this adorable little Fiat parked out front. (How can you miss it when you're on Columbus Ave!) 

Fast forward to this weekend, it was my boyfriend's birthday and he's new to San Francisco. I wanted to do something extra special for him and the first thing that popped into my head was the little car outside of Mona Lisa! I called the restaurant and set up a reservation for 8pm. 

THIS is where the impeccable service started. From the owner Mauricio seating us in the little car, setting up the table and taking our pictures, to our server going above and beyond to make sure we had an incredible experience. 

For this dinner we ordered: 

Family Style Antipasti - A gorgeous display of bruschetta, meats, cheeses, and olives, SO GOOD.
Bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon Kith and Kin - Excellent choice with pasta
Spinach ravioli with a bolognese sauce - DELICIOUS. The sauce is so rich and flavored so well.
Linguine with clams - My boyfriend said it was amazing.

Topped off with a birthday Tiramisu that was to die for! 

Seriously, if you made it this far without closing the Yelp page and heading straight to the restaurant, then you really didn't want pasta that bad.

author: Carly C.
text:
Food was amazing and came in very large portions. The seafood pasta was loaded with shrimp, mussels, clams and calamari and of course extra parmesan ;) The calamari in the pasta was slightly undercooked, but overall the dish was great. Atmosphere is fun and great for a weekend dinner spot! They have murals on the ceiling, lots of pictures and sculptures throughout the inside. 

FYI this restaurant does not honor reservations for some reason. We booked our reservation on Yelp for 8:15 pm, but when we arrived we were added to the same list that walk-in customers were added to. We ended up waiting 40 minutes to be seated, which was quite unfortunate because it was our anniversary dinner! 

On a whole, great food and restaurant, but don't expect timely seating/service.

author: Charles B.
text:
MUST HAVE bruschetta and their coffee!! This is my second time there and every time I go I am blown away by the freshness and quality of their food! It's warm and inviting, and the owner is there commanding everything from the floor, which lets me know he takes extreme pride in his restaurant!
Will definitely go back!

author: Laneisha T.
text:
Came to Mona Lisa this past weekend for my 30th birthday (June 2019). This happened to be the weekend of the north beach festival so the restaurant was pretty busy all day, we walked by earlier in the day seemed like a steady flow of people. We had a reservation and we were seated pretty quickly. We were seated by the kitchen and were able to watch the chefs in action as they prepared different orders it was awesome!! 

We ordered some Bruschetta which I thought was verryyy tasty some in my group (party of 5) thought it was too much tomato but I think that's just personal preference! To me it was perfect and had a wonderful flavor!! I also ordered the calamari which was cooked very nicely not chewy and was light and crisp and the marina to go with it! YUM! I almost ate the whole order by myself! For dinner I got the Aldon Smith pasta which I thought was rather tasty! So good! My bf got the pizza and my other guests got chicken dishes and lasagna and everyone really enjoyed their food!! It was sooo good! My only regret is we were too full for dessert so I'll definitely be back!!!

author: Rohit K.
text:
One word: roaches. 
We had just finished the bread and a roach appeared just as our food was being served. We requested to move to another table. To our disappointment, we found a roach on that table too! What was worse was that it was climbing all over an open olive oil bottle. Despite this, instead of apologizing, the manager actually told us " not to create too much of a scene" or " I'll seat you outside".
After this, getting to the food was the last thing on our mind.
Strongly recommend an avoid on this one.

author: Alice L.
text:
The owner here has a lot of spunk. He even has a large B&W portrait of himself when he was younger. You can play "ispy" for it amongst all his other photos while you wait for a table. 

I made reservations for dinner on the day of. I was seated about 10 minutes after my reservation time, so not too bad. 

They serve complementary bread before the meal. It was cold bread, but hey it's free, right? The servers here may take some time to get to you, but I went during peak hour. 

Cioppino-- So effing delicious! The tomato sauce had so much flavor in it, especially shellfish. The bread is amazing for mopping up this sauce. This dish will set you back like $50, but it's meant to be shared.

Ravioli-- My boyfriend didn't really like this. 

Squid ink risotto-- This dish was very one-dimensional. Would not recommend. 

Pasta with white wine and shellfish-- Seafood was very fresh on this dish, however the pasta was under-salted. There were sun-dried tomatoes on this dish (I believe) and they were loaded with salt. It's like you sometimes get a bite of bland or a bite of salty. 

Bottom line-- Just go with the cioppino.

author: A.v. N.
text:
Oooh, found ourselves a new go-to spot in the City! We go to Chinatown semi-regularly but don't often venture along Columbus Ave. I wanted to see the National Shrine of St. Francis of Assisi and explore some Italian places along the way. It's right across the street from the Shrine.

I was in a carbonara mood, the wife was in a seafood mood, and the Boy was in an indecisive mood. The waiter Gian Carlo was so friendly and engaging with our Boy, gave him a choice of a couple pastas, a choice of sauce, meat or no meat, and what to drink. Excellent service.

My carbonara was delicious, and I shared some with my Boy who wished I had saved him more. He should've listened to me the first time when I told him to get the carbonara. Kids, listen to your parents. Unless they're vegan. In which case, insist on the carbonara. Trust me.

The wife's seafood pasta was also excellent. She let me try some/finish it off. I would have tried dessert too if I hadn't finished off their plates because I didn't feel like carrying around a to-go bag. I cleaned up all the sauces with the bread too because, hello, Italian restaurant. It would be rude if I didn't.

We'll definitely be back and will make a point to leave room for dessert.

Also, if you can, sit by the window because it's brighter; inside was a bit dim. Outside looked nice too, and you're in the shade by the late lunch hour.

author: Emily A.
text:
Cute little restaurant on the corner of Columbus St. 
The servers and owners are OG Italians.. great service.
We decided to opt in for some pizzas. We got the Mona Lisa and the Piemonte. Both delicious and fresh. Highly recommend the Piemonte if you like truffle. The red wine (Cabernet) was imported from Italy, also delicious. I would definitely come back and I highly recommend if you're craving some good ole fashion carbs!

author: Susanne R.
text:
As Nat King Cole sang, "Mona Lisa, Mona Lisa, men have loved you..." and I love you too!!

We'd made early reservations here after a matinee show.   Walked in and were warmly greeted.   They were not busy so we could pick where we wanted to sit.  I choose the back half of the house as it was darker and my friend was fighting a migraine.    

After being seated with menus, water and bread soon followed.    It took us awhile to make food decisions as the menu is very extensive.  We decided on appetizers and  drinks , then ordered our mains.   The waiter Antonio was fantastic.   Showed up when we needed and checked back at appropriate times.

Appetizers 
Burrata Fresca-  perfect combination of fresh burrata with prosciutto, arugula and Parmesan 
Aglio Siciliano Caramellato- sautéed garlic cloves in wine and Parmesan..  DELICIOUS 

Mains- 3/4 were fantastic, the last dish was just ok.
Spaghetti alle Vongole 
Spaghetti allo Scoglio
Chicken Parmesan 
Salmone con Gamberoni alla Crema

Desserts -  these were amazing!!  Fresh, lovely flavor combinations.  The parfait is a must...
Panna cotta
Lemon sorbet 
Cream de limoncello parfait 

Service was efficient and friendly.  Everything was wonderful.  We throughly enjoyed our time and will be back.

author: Lindsay P.
text: If you ever find yourself in the area this is a MUST!!!! We stumbled upon this gem! We walked up and right away I noticed the one of a kind car out front and wanted to sit there. They said sure give us 10 minutes! Sure enough before we knew it we were given the best seat in the house! The service and food were phenomenal! I'm a sucker for Italian food and this was probably one of the best! The owner treated us like family and was the kindest man! We will definitely be back!

author: David N.
text:
DELICIOUS! The Mona Lisa has an amazing menu, all done very well and very authentic! I have been here a hand full of times and every time is a treat. I really can't pick a favorite dish but you have to try the antipasto tower. The wait staff is extremely accommodating and the host makes you feel like your the most important person in the world. Highly recommend the Mona Lisa if your looking for an all arround great experience. Amazing food, wine, and italian hospitality. Perfect for a romantic date but with a more relaxed atmosphere.

**Edit
Ok I had to come back here and edit this because I think I found my new favorite dish bistecca Al porcini, I normally go for the more traditional dishes but I was craving a steak.. and WOW! cooked perfectly, flavors were out of this world!

author: Brian P.
text: Schmaltzy atmosphere, fun. Good service. Food ok, but not special. There are better choices in the area. Trattorria Contadina for onen

author: Craig T.
text:
Really cool, relaxed, old school Italian place. Went here with a group of friends who were in from out of town and had a great time. 

The food was all solid and I really like the atmosphere here...perfect place to enjoy a long, relaxed meal over a couple bottles of wine. 

We split the bruschetta and prosciutto-wrapped cantaloupe. Both were good. For mains, we split multiple of the pasta dishes. I enjoyed them all but the tortellini was probably my favorite. Would recommend!

author: Chaheti B.
text:
Transported into Italy!! Don't let the super touristy location of the restaurant deter you from coming in, the food is authentic and the menu is extensive. It is a bit tight and we were seated in a corner by the window on a table too small for our food and wine, but we still loved the atmosphere. 

Make sure you make reservations because it's usually packed with a line of people waiting outside!

My boyfriend is gluten free and it's usually rare for an Italian restaurant to have homemade GF pasta, let alone GF RAVIOLI. You couldn't even tell the difference. The sauce was extremely garlic-y but we loved it. 

The lobster ravioli was delicious and creamy as well.

We also ordered a plate of the chicken cioppino with risotto but we had 2 bites of it because our ravioli dishes were a lot larger than what we were expecting. The risotto had lots of veggies, however the only flavor that was coming across the dish was salt and the super salty olives. We ended up packing it up and giving it to a homeless person because we didn't enjoy it enough to even have at home. 

Oh and their bread is incredible, crunchy, and warm!

author: Jazzy L.
text:
This is the best place to have authentic italian food
come here all the time with my husband for a getaway.
owner Mauricio is super nice and will mke you feel like your VIP. My favorite is the fetucini leonrdo but every thing I tried here has been great.

author: Neloffer E.
text:
My husband and I were craving Italian after so long and saw the great reviews here on Yelp. We then finally decided to give this place a try for date night and glad that we did. It's such a cute and romantic place to have dinner! 

The service is great here! All the employees here are very friendly and truly make you feel welcomed! 

The food was delicious!!!  The menu had so many options that it took me a while to decide what I wanted. I couldn't decide if I wanted pasta, lasagna, pizza, or the other delicious items they had on the menu. I ended up ordering a cheesy pasty and my god was it cheese heaven. I added a bit pepper to give it a kick and it hit the spot! My husband ordered the margarita cheese pizza and he loved it. I had a slice of his pizza and I was tempted to order another one. The crust, the sauce, the cheese, the basil, the roasted tomatoes on top was exquisite. 


My husband had traveled to Italy not too long ago and he mentioned that the penza(pizza) has the same authentic taste as it does in Italy! 

I highly recommend this cute and cozy restaurant.

author: Cristian S.
text: I was here last weekend, having dinner with some friends. Great Italian food and service. Location is quite exquisite. Feels like you're in Italy. I do recommend it for a nice Italian dish, I've had lasagna. The owner is there all the time, really nice and funny guy. Good prices!!!

author: Lynne P.
text:
Some of the best Penne Arrabiata and pizza in North Beach!  Very cozy romantic place with great people watching.  Perfect location.  Order delivery from here frequently and it is always delicious.  Highly recommend.
Thank you for listening to my first review!  Have ordered a few times since and everything was perfect!

author: Mario A.
text: My girl friend and I thought everything was fabulous the food was absolutely delicious the servers was very courteous ambience was very cool Beautiful place

author: Jcee l.
text: Very good food. I ordered the pumpkin ravioli and my friend salmon with asparagus in a white wine sauce. The atmosphere felt Italian and my friend and I liked the strobe lights. The service was quick and the waiter was nice giving us suggestions. I would recommend this place.

author: Clarissa C.
text:
Yum! Great Italian food in North Beach!

Mona Lisa is one of the many restaurants in North Beach I just found out you can count on for good Italian food. From the tourists coming in just from foot traffic, as well as regulars, I would say it's definitely wise to make a reservation ahead of time. 

The atmosphere is lively and bustling, with waiters and tons of people trying to squeeze and get by with food. Fun paintings/photos and marble busts in police officer hats also line the restaurant walls, giving you something to look at as you wait for your table or dinner. 

One of the highlights if you want to try all the appetizers and turn heads is their grand Family Style Antipasti ($31.95). It's a crazy, multi-tiered vessel that barely fits on the table and is awesome if you like calamari and proscuitto! They say it feeds two, but honestly could feed 4 (especially with their large pasta entrees).

I got the Rigatoni all Borrelli ($25.95) and it was definitely delicious. It came on a hot dish with plenty of tomato sauce, melted cheese, eggplant, and rich/slightly spicy sausage mixed throughout. The Garlic Bread we ordered on the side was also great--super garlicky and toasty! With all that food, you better believe I had a hearty full meal of takeout for the next day. 

Overall, I thought all the food here was super spot-on. The Italian manager and owner is super funny (and hunting for some good Yelp Reviews lol), and the service was pretty great given how packed it was for a Friday night. I would say the prices are definitely on the more expensive side for Italian food here, but I guess it comes with the location in SF. Would definitely come back if I was going for a nice Italian dinner and trying to wow some SF visitors!

author: Marc B.
text: I took friends from Australia to dinner expecting a fine meal based on reviews.  We were extremely disappointed.  It took an hour to serve us unacceptable meals.  The tiny portion of veal was smothered with sauce to hide the lack of veal.  Both the server and manager were rude throughout the meal.  Over priced and poor food quality.  Go elsewhere

author: Kathy T.
text: Buena sera, ragazzi! This place could easily be in Sicily---homeland of the hospitable owner. Had a very reasonably priced Chianti ( when in Rome) and chose the fettuccine Mona  Lisa (had to) which had a creamy white sauce with olives and ham. Delicioso . Service was perfect  and the desserts, no words. In SF? Love Italian? It's a no brainer . Got to go. Andiamo!

author: Ashley W.
text: Last time I visited the place I couldn't get enough of that pasta, just because of the pasta we did the reservation again and visited the place. I wasn't impressed this time, the pasta was bland, lacked flavor and taste, it was not very tempting. Moreover the Scolio spaghetti wasn't of the quality as I would have expected. The service and staff was good though, place is good not sure why the quality isn't constant.

author: Jennifer O.
text:
Other than Sam's Grill, there's no other restaurant in San Francisco that can greet you as an old friend and immediately make you feel welcome and at ease. 

Mona Lisa is special, they just try harder and everything is made with love. I wanted a dish they no longer had on the menu (been gone too long) and they made it up for me, off menu, including a generous shaving of truffles and truffle oil.

The menu is enormous but nicely broken down by pastas with meat, fish, vegetarian making it easier to narrow your choices. 

The fried calamari appetizer was solid and they crafted a deluxe plate of bruschetta with mortadella, caprese salad and kalamata olives for our table all because (I suspect) I told a man perusing the menu outside, "Go! I'm a local and I love this place!"

My child's carbonara was sinful and delicious with a generous amount of pancetta; my friend's son devoured his pasta arrabiata, fragrant with basil, and I enjoyed my specially prepared dish.

Sure, I could nitpick that the tomatoes on the Caprese could've been juicier and I would've liked a bread plate and freshly ground pepper but as I wended my way through the cozy dining room with its busy and eclectic decor, I said thank you and goodnight to the owner, a man I felt I'd known forever. 

It was as if we just had a wonderful meal at a friend's home.

It's more than good food that fills your soul and having dinner at Mona Lisa was a comforting and joyful experience. 

Tutti a tavola a mangiare!

author: Adam T.
text:
Mediocre pizza, for the area and traditional appearance I expected better.
I am supposed to write more to make this a legit review.

author: Jing F.
text:
First time here.  We chose this place on a Superbowl Sunday lunch because it seems like a lot of North Beach restaurants were closed that day.  We are here to celebrate my sisters and my cousin's bdays. 

The place is pretty cool.  Sculptures, sculptures with hats (SFPD hats, etc) on, and Italian art.  This place is great for big groups too.

We ordered different Italian dishes.  But first we had this all kinds of appetizers (calamari, bruschetta, etc) on a tiered platter.  The appetizer is delicious.  The individual meals we ordered all looks good and delicious.  I especially like the chicken that my cousin ordered.  I ordered pasta with pesto sauce (the veggie menu) I figured we got the appetizers with meat and seafood already so I want to  be healthy LOL.
Like I said they are all delicious.   The service did not disappoint too!!  The staff were all pleasant and made us feel welcome!  We were there for at least 2 hours and they didn't mind.  They sang happy birthday and their cake was awesome!

author: Lulu Y.
text: It's a cozy Italian restaurant on Columbus Vallejo. The interior looked Byzantine and I have had dessert and wine here. I would not call it super fancy dining but the food was of fairly good quality. The store owner has a vintage car in front of the store, looking cute

author: Roma M.
text: Found this place on yelp. Its the italian district of SF. We could secure a reservation on Friday evening over the phone. They mentioned that its run and operated by Women only, but the menu card stated that a couple owns it, so it was little confusing. Anyway, the food options were good and the decor was unique and enjoyable. We ordered a bottle of wine, a pasta and a pizza, all were pretty good, above average.

author: Hongruo Y.
text:
Just want to leave an honest review about their food. We came here because of the yelp rating and left the restaurant with disappointment. The seafood Cioppino tastes bland and the fish/shellfish was not fresh even for frozen food standard. On the contrary, the price they charges on this dish was actually a little bit higher than the other good restaurants in the same neighborhood. 

I can't understand how this place got such a high rating? Nothing personal about this place but the food was over truly overrated and I will never recommend friends to here for the sake of my own foodie reputation 

(I started to read reviews when exploring new places since my visit here, felt you can no longer trust the yelp rating stuff anymore...)

author: Mike R.
text:
Beautiful decor - Very clean!

Friendly staff and food and wine menu looks amazing!

Prices were reasonable.  Food was amazing, as was the wine.

Enjoyable visit!

author: Chinsin S.
text:
This place was amazing. The decor is super cute with all the photos. It's a tad bit small, so definitely be prepared to get comfy. 

We made a reservation, but unfortunately due to technical issues, there was a tad bit of confusion and we were delayed a few minutes.

And guess what? The owner (or manager) on duty was super chill and down to Earth about this entire hiccup. Since this was a surprise birthday, we were on a clock and he somehow made magic happened. I was literally impressed.

I ordered the Spaghetti Allo Scoglio, which had huge portions of calamari, clams, mussels and prawns. It was solid. I wish the sauce was a tad bit thicker, but overall, the dish was a delight. You could really taste the authentic seafood (or ocean flavor) with each bite. The noodles were perfectly cooked at al dente. 

We also ordered the Mona Lisa pizza and the calamari appetizers too, which were delicious as well.

Was it the best Italian food I have ever had? No. But what really separates Mona Lisa from every other restaurant is their unique and five-star dining experience. The staff and restaurant management team really went up and beyond to make our group of 11+ guests feel special.

Mona Lisa, I'm a total fan and would come here again in a heartbeat.

author: Beth L.
text: We were transported to Italy last night, and it was sublime! Service was impeccable! Everyone was friendly and warm. Food was delicious. We ordered carpaccio and seafood risotto. Both were perfection. The only teeny problem was that the risotto portion was humongous. Well, not really a problem because I took it home and ate it for breakfast. It was THAT GOOD! We will be back any time we want an authentic Italian experience with excellent food.

author: Lauren S.
text:
After a long day of roaming the streets of Dan Francisco with our dog, we decided to find a dog friendly place to sit down and fill our belly.  We stopped at this place because it was the first place with outdoor seating.  We were not disappointed.

We ordered a veal with capers to share, kids pepperoni pizza, and spaghetti meatballs for kids.

Veal was delicious and not over powered by the capers.  It was lightly salted and not greasy. We cleared our plates.  My younger son loved the pizza and said it was cheesy and.plenty of pepperoni to pick at.  He said he could eat at this place again.  My older boy enjoyed his spaghetti and meatballs and thought it was meaty with a sweet balance of the sauce.

Wine by the glass was reasonable and good pour. 

Lastly,  service was excellent and couldn't ask for more attentive service,  especially since we were far removed from the hustle and bustle of the core restaurant seatings inside.  My husband said we should get discount for advertising outside with the yummy food to passerbys.

I totally recommend this place and return again. Thumbs up!

P.S. my little puppy dog was happy to receive a break from the long day of walking.  Great finish to a nice.day put.

author: Anthony G.
text: Once again Mona Lisa proves FANTASTIC...no visit to SFO is complete without a visit here, this time I bring a party of 7.  It's always nice when your dining partners praise your choice, tonight, I created 6 new fans who are all ready to return tomorrow.  You cannot make a bad menu choice here, everything is delicious. Until I return.  Bon apetito

author: Gabi M.
text: We can't stop thinking about the Penne Salsa Rosa so this is our third time here. Amazing service and such a great experience every time. We ate in the car and it was one for the books!

author: Elda M.
text:
I loved Mona Lisa during my short stay in San Francisco! 

After trying another Italian restaurant nearby that wouldn't seat me at a table (I was traveling solo, and they wanted me to sit at the bar, instead of take up an entire small table meant for two or more. Their right, but I didn't want a bar experience.) I decided to stop in Mona Lisa after having walked by more than a few times over the weekend. 

Monday night and it wasn't too crowded. The staff were super friendly and very professional. 

I started with the excellent bruschetta and a glass of Chianti Classico (also excellent). For an entree, I had the veal ravioli and it was it amazingly good! I love ravioli, it's one of my favorite foods, and Mona Lisa's version was one of the best I've had in a restaurant in the US.

I loved the entire experience! I can't wait to return next time I'm in San Francisco!

Elda Eats XO

author: Pratiksha S.
text:
The Penne with pink sauce was good. The pasta was nice and saucy 

Spaghetti with pesto was okay, with a decent amount of pesto in it 

The dessert menu looked good, but we were so full from the main course, we couldn't try any :( 

Definitely going back to try some of those

author: Megan M.
text: A little bit of a wait but we were a party of 7! This is a cozy (think chair to chair) space but that gives it a family feel. Decor was busy and very Italian but the linen table cloths were nice.  Most seating offers a fun view of the chefs at work. They offer many in house made pasta options & my gnocchi was tasty (though overpriced, but I think that's just San Fran). Our server was quite friendly and even brought my sister's baby a dessert, on the house. If you're looking for authentic Italian, I recommend.

author: Sophie G.
text: Ordered the pesto penne with chicken.   Pesto was fresh and a little salty, but nonetheless it was still really good.  I regretted adding Parmesan cheese because that made it saltier.   Service was good.  I would recommend sitting near the window to get a view of the street otherwise the place is dark and a little crowded.

author: NoName X.
text:
Man I don't know if any of these reviewers have had decent Italian food before or not. Went in after reading the rave reviews and what a disappointment. 

Pizza - bland. No flavor
Spinach and cheese ravioli - tangy tomato sauce. Odd taste. 
Pasta with pink sauce for kids - a bad version of penne a la vodka 
Fettuccini with Alfredo sauce for kids - a heavy butter after taste. And not in a good way. 

Over priced and a disappointment. Was in the neighborhood visiting so dropped in. Won't make that mistake again.

author: Ranelle S.
text: Ever go out to eat and end up dining out of an antique car?  Of course not because you aren't me.  But you can work your way up to it by coming to this place.  Great food, amazing dessert, sociable staff and the best seat not in the house if you're lucky.

author: Esther H.
text: Came in on a busy Friday night without any reservations. Got a nice table outside since it was a beautiful and rare, warm, S.F. night. Their pasta tasted very fresh and their service was very attentive. Had a pleasant night and enjoyed the creamy fettuccine pescatore.

author: Tinyee H.
text:
If you want traditional Italian-American food, look no further. The leather-bound menu had many choices. We ordered the calamari fritti, buffalo fresca on greens, spaghetti with meatballs and rigatoni osillio. The fried calamari was a bit under seasoned, i.e. not enough salt. The buffalo mozzarella was creamy and soft, and went well with the prosciutto and arugula. The kids likes the meatball. The rigatoni osillio had a fresh-tasting basil pesto with grilled chicken. This was my favorite out of all dishes, and also one of the best I've had. It was not too oily from the pesto and the chicken was perfectly cooked and moist.

Our waiter, Luca, was charming and pleasant. The restaurant still had holiday decorations and was a bit tacky. I don't get the air force theme with captains hats on busts. Clearly the restaurant has been visited by famous people as portraits line up all around the dining area.

author: Mary K.
text:
After a longest day of work, I was in a needed for a comfort food, more specifically an Italian food and I searched for a restaurant that is open this late. Most restaurants in SF tend to close after 9pm and would shoo new patrons away upon their closing hours.
Behold, it is Mona Lisa's restaurant that I found, which happens to be the perfect Italian spot in SF that does stay open until 11pm. 
It is cozy and their interior designs are beautiful too. It
I had truly enjoyed observing & checking out these ancient pictures on their wall.

Their extensive menu offers so many & "looks delicious" food options and it took me a good while to decide on which one to try. I finally settle for Burrata Fresca: Fresh italian farm burrata mozzarella with prosciutto crudo di parma, arugula, and shaved parmigiano, it's an appetizer by the way! 
and main course- Lasagna: Homemade lasagna with fresh mozzarella in a ground pork, beef, and tomato meat sauce. 

All were very tasti-licious along with the fresh breads! 

The owner and the waiter were excellent with their services toward me. Had a great conversation with the owner, he is a warm-heart man & he will also fill you in on his family's heritage background. 
Mona Lisa feels like a home to me. Great place to eat at and I will come back again.

Thank you!
Jennie H.

author: G M.
text:
We were wandering around North Beach for Memorial Day today and decided to try Mona Lisa because the Yelp reviews were strong.  It certainly had the risk of being a tourist trap being on Columbus so close to Broadway, but I don't want to be one of those San Franciscans who's lived here forever but still hasn't done what many tourists have.

I had the Pinsa, Napoli style.  It's an oval-shaped pizza with special blend of all non-GMO soy, wheat, and rice flour.  I thought the crust was the best I've had in SF.  Nice and crispy, but still light.  It's not like true Neapolitan pizza, which is wet and has to be eaten with knife and fork, but these days I like the way Mona Lisa does it better.

This is not a cheap place (with many entrees in the $30+), but the portions are huge, so it's not so bad if you end up taking a bunch home like we did.  

Glad we dropped by.

author: Karen L.
text: We love, love, love Mona Lisa and it's now one of our favorite North Beach Italian eateries! We had dinner here tonight and everything was amazing! Bread is chewy and fresh but we left room for dinner! We had the four cheese pizza which is hands down one of the best pizzas I've  ever had! The flavor of the cheeses are outstanding and you can taste each one! Crust is crisp and light. We also had the Chicken Milanese with garlicky spinach. Chicken was perfectly cooked and very good. We had the linguini and clams which was flavorful and plentiful. The Caico e Pepe pasta was also outstanding. Service was friendly and very efficient. We can't wait to go back! Don't miss this!

author: Rick H.
text: Amazing food! Been going to Mona Lisa's for fifteen years. Not only amazing Food! Amazing service! It is an SF landmark! Mauricio is an amazing host too! Fresh pasta and sauce makes this place a one of a kind experience! Great deserts, wine and pizza too!

author: Kristin H.
text:
The food was delicious! 10 entrees, 4 appetizers, and 3 desserts came out to $525 + tip 

Service could be better faster even though I had a reservation for 10.

author: Heather D.
text: One of the best chicken Alfredo I've had in a long time! Cute little restaurant with great food

author: Candice Y.
text: Looking for a place in North Beach and found Mona Lisa on Yelp. Carbonara was great! Worth a look if you're in NB.

author: Tiffany A.
text: This restaurant is soooooo good! I had Paccheri Calabresi (pasta meat dish) on a new menu and my husband had linguini with Alfredo and salmon. The service was spectacular, authentic Food, and great customer service. Food was quick to get. Highly recommend!

author: Martha F.
text: The food was excellent and the waiter was super nice! I had the eggplant with potatoes and spinach. It also had a very great atmosphere.

author: Gail B.
text: We had reservations but arrived a little early.  We were greeted immediately and we were able to choose our table near the window.   The food and service were superb. Our waiter was Antonio and we asked for recommendations on wine and food and were not disappointed.  Our portions were more than sufficient for the salad, homemade pasta and sauces chosen.  Highly recommended.

author: Hannah P.
text: This place is awesome! We got to dine in the car. The food is great and the service is efficient.

author: Kristin H.
text: Great food, Great service, Great ambiance!! We were craving Italian on our special birthday trip to SF & found this incredible establishment.  I wanted clams & linguini & didn't see it on the menu outside, but the owner beckoned us in & had it made especially for me!!! My hubby had the home made beef ravioli.  Both were exceptional.  My dinner had more juicy, tender clams than I've ever had. They have an extensive wine list, too.  I enjoyed the house chianti, very flavorful.  And to our surprise, they brought a complementary crème brule with a candle for my hubby's 70th birthday!  I cannot believe we had never found this exceptional restaurant before as it has been around for decades. Can't wait for our next trip to The City so we may enjoy another fabulous meal.

author: Malek B.
text:
Great italian experience.  Food is excellent and the service makes you feel like in italy.
Been served by the owner Maurizio that took care of everything like I was his best friend. 
The ambient is like being in a museum,  worth eating here just for how much sculptures and painting are inside.
Absolutely reccomend this restaurant.

author: Hafsah K.
text: I bookmarked this restaurant and finally had the chance to go last night. I was a little hesitant, but the reviews were too good! I made a reservation for 11:30 PM, we got there around 11:15 and the guy seemed a little hesitant to take us until I told him I had a reservation. One thing I love about the menus are that it shows you what dishes they have for vegetarians, meat options, and seafood (etc) which is awesome and way less confusing. We ordered a cheesy penne pasta, ravioli, bruschetta, salad, and desert. The food was hot and made fresh which was perfect. The tiramisu and other deserts were mouth watering. This was my first time coming here and definitely not the last. I highly recommend Mona Lisa!

author: Raquel H.
text: This place was really cute. Would say it's a good diner date night place. I'm not sure how I felt about the TVs but that not anything that would change my opinion on the service or food. I did notice that no females work at this place, not sure if that's just because of a night thing or if I just missed them walking by. The food was good, I had the penne pasta with spicy sauce which was vegan approved. No cheese, had mushrooms and eggplant. The plates look small but they are deep so it is actually a lot of food. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only thing is that they didn't bring out my appetizer but also wasn't charged for it. Overall it was a pleasant experience

author: Chad M.
text:
Mona Lisa's was great, the food was awesome, the atmosphere was amazing and service was spectacular.
- thanks again.

author: Joma T.
text: When we chose to eat here, we didn't expect anything else because we heard the food was great. What was definitely the best experience here is the people around you are very friendly! Even the owner will entertain you like a server does, and the server did an amazing job with our order. The food itself is really really great, probably the most authentic italian food i have tried. Overall we had an amazing time here and we will go back on our next visit.

author: Lisa V.
text: I was pleasantly surprised to have found such a good Italian restaurant in San Fransisco. I spent two weeks in Italy last year and one of my favorite dishes was Cacio e pepe in Rome. The dish at this restaurant is the best version I've had in the U.S! The atmosphere was a little chaotic but, the food and wine were excellent. While I didn't get to walk around the area it appeared to be in a nice part of the city.

author: Lily T.
text:
The owner Mauricio is very hospitable and makes you feel like you are guests at his home. 
The food is amazing.  Everything is delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant in Little Italy. 
Looking forward to coming here again.

author: T M.
text: Very pleasant restaurant with a vast menu, but everything seemed very good. The waiters don't rush and I felt like I could have had the table all night if I wanted. Prices are very very reasonable compared to everything else in the neighborhood.

author: Ryan D.
text: Customer service and seating are on point!! Food unfortunately lacked flavor, ordered angel hair bolognese and received bland spaghetti bolognese.

author: Christopher L.
text: Simply amazing the Decour inside is out of this world. If you're feeling like some good Italian food definitely don't miss Mona Lisa. Spaghetti and spicy sausage is to die for.

author: Erika P.
text: Best customer service, amazing wine, and delicious Mona Lisa Fettuccini pasta! The owner Mauricio is super sweet and willing to please until you are satisfied with your meal.

author: Joe M.
text:
"Jalisco and Italia" 
Best Italian place in San Francisco. The food was amazing and the atmosphere was nice. The service was exceptional and If you want to go an authentic Italian restaurant where they make you feel like family, this is the place!!

author: Ellen H.
text:
It was Valentine's Day and every restaurant was full of couples looking lovely into each other's eyes. We needed a late night dinner spot  without having made a reservation beforehand, yikes. What seemed like an impossible task was made very easy by Yelp Reservations. We did a quick search, were able to make a reservation around 10pm and were seated immediately upon arrival in a still busy restaurant. 

The staff was very courteous and friendly, which was very surprising after what must have been one of the busiest evenings of the year. Two minutes after being seated, we had already received yummy bread and our orders had already been taken.

We were a party of 4 and we each ordered different dishes, from eggplant parmigiana to pizza to pasta. EVERY single dish was amazing! While we are spoiled with good Italian restaurants in this area, Mona Lisa very much impressed me. They serve exactly the type of cheesy, homey, hearty food that I want when stepping into an Italian restaurant. It does not get better than this.

author: Alex M.
text:
Great food but shitty service. They are crowded (even on Sunday) and didn't honor the reservation time (took 30 extra mins so why even reserve). The manager/guy at the front was rude and unable to handle the high volume of clients he had, he needs a chill pill ;) 

The food is good but I'd recommend one of the other many choices for Italian on the same street if you want reliable service.

author: Gianluca P.
text:
Below average Italian food. Pizza was not great, calamari starter soggy.
Service very good

author: Andrea L.
text: If you ever find yourself in North Beach and your hungry stop here. We enjoyed dinner in the cutest dining car. The food was fantastic and the hospitality even better.

author: Reggie R.
text:
We had a confirmed reservation for 7:15 pm. We arrived at approximately 7:20 pm and we were rudely greeted by a disgruntled older male  manager/owner and told the reservation was for 7:00 pm. He informed us there would be a 10-15 minute wait and stringed us along till 8:05 pm. We decided not to dine here and went to another Italian restaurant @ the corner of Columbus and Stockton which had EXCELLENT SERVICE AND GREAT TASTING FOOD!  

I can just imagine what the rest of our dining experience would have been like if we decided to dine @ Mona Lisa.  Do yourself a favor and skip this establishment since there are many other better service oriented restaurants in the area. 

If you want to learn how to discourage potential customers from patronizing your business please visit Mona Lisa to get the real "experience."

author: Michelle C.
text:
In one word I would have to say... disappointing. Our fellow Yelpers let us down with this one. We are having a hard time understanding why anyone would describe this restaurant as romantic and cozy. In my opinion it's loud and garish, which is fine if that's what you're looking for.  Loud Italian rock covers.  My husband described it as 80s music covered in Italian. 

I will say we were sat rather quickly (it was also a Tuesday night)

The bread was just ok.  My next clue that we were not in for what we were hoping for was the wine.  It was way over priced. I opted for a glass of the Cabernet that had no name on the menu.  It tasted like it was watered down.  I would have been better off with two buck chuck.  

Service was slow. My food was delivered at least 10 minutes before my husband's, which was odd since it was just the 2 of us. 

I got the lasagna which was salty and bland.  I ate half and left the rest behind, which I never do.  Lasagna is best the next day but there was no redeeming this lasagna.  

My husband got the gnocchi, which was horribly undercooked and had a gummy texture.  

Our waiter was nice enough and apologized for the wait but he never really checked to see if we needed anything.

author: Michelle B.
text:
Nothing was appealing. Nothing was tasty! 
Decided to eat with my friends on a Monday evening. We so happen to be in the area, and we were intrigued to come here because of the reviews and ratings on Yelp! 
Honestly my SF Yelpers let me down on this one! 
Service was ok. Once we're arrived we were friendly greeted and sat down immediately. The restaurant was not busy whatsoever, there were around 3-5 tables at most, which does not consider a restaurant to be busy, but yet our service took a while! At first we thought they forgotten about us, we were new to the restaurant, so this means we took a while to decide what to get. Not once did our server come to check on us if we had any questions. Disappointing. 
Finally! When our server came. The first think I asked was, what's a popular dish you guys serve here? He immediately said the Lasagna. I trusted him. And ordered it!  My friends ordered pizza. 
OUR FOOD! 
Nothing was appealing. Nothing was tasty! 
I promise you people, I love my savory food. But my Lasagna was full of salt! It was soggy. It had not taste what's so ever. A frozen lasagna from Costco probably tastes better than this Lasagna. 
Nonetheless, my friends pizza taste like in quote tastes "like I bit into a piece of pure garlic" but "the crust is nice" 
Truly disappointing. I am so sorry Mona Lisa, but you deserve 1 Start for at least trying. 
Overall, if a Italian place butchers the pizza, you know it will not be worth your time and money.

author: Vanessa R.
text:
Just amazing 
All my friends loved it. 
I couldn't get over the mona lisa ties the servers wear

author: Pablo N M.
text:
This was the most amazing Italian.  That I have even been to.  The owner was incredible!  The food was spectacular!!!!! Oh and the desert... oh the desert :)


This is my new to go place in San Francisco .

author: Tony L.
text: I have been coming here, for many years. I have brought at least thirty new customers here as the years went by. In EVERY case, they have completely cleaned their plates, while making yummy noises. It is always my first stop when I pull into town.

author: Anuj T.
text: They gave us a free bottle of wine for my birthday - the service and owner was so nice and fun! The gorgonzola sauce, arrabiata sauce (spicy!), and the margarita pizza were especially good!

author: Peter M.
text:
As you drive around Chinatown, you end up seeing small Italian Flags painted on street lights.  The smell of Chinatown waffs away and replaced by pizza and bakeries.

As things go, Little Italy is predominantly eateries and cafe's.  Living the Dolce Vita!

Where to go for dinner.  Choppino is pretty San Fran iconic - like their sourdough clam chowder.  There are plenty of places that make Choppino and prices vary but expect to spend around $50.  The seafood varies too.

Mona Lisa is pretty lively.  Plenty of people dining and enjoying their meals.  Might as well go in and see what it's like.  The place is a little dark for my liking but ambience chirps up as you look around at all the celeb pix and memorabilia.

Ordered the Choppino and the Diavolo Pizza.  Pizza was good.  The crust was delicious - I'm not a crust guy...just a crusty guy!  :)

The Choppino could have been better.  Many other places use crabs or lobster to enrich the flavour.  Not here.  Up to you if you want to spend the $50 for it.

Service was great, food was good, wine was fine.  

Cheers!

author: LeftCoast Y.
text:
We've been eating here for 10+ years.  Know most of the team and always enjoy amazing service, fresh, tasty food, and classic North Beach atmosphere.  Love checking out all the famous signed pics on the wall along with chatting it up with the owner and head waiter.  

Can't imagine you'd be let down.  We've had just about every dish on the extensive menu and they accommodate all types of diets/restrictions.  

We also hosted our business holiday dinner here with 20+.  As always, smooth service and everyone left full and happy.

author: Kristy G.
text:
Wow just had early dinner and was not disappointed. Sooo good sooo authentic from wine to dessert. I can't say enough. Service was excellent too!!!
Five stars !!!!

author: Luis C.
text:
Nice Italian restaurant in Little Italy that had a nice quiet atmosphere. We came on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't crazy packed or busy. The service was decent and the food was good.
 I had the Fettucine Leonardo and thought it was rich in flavor. The sauce was just right. 
I had a hard time picking out what to eat because the menu was full of options.
I recommend this reataurant and will be returning.

author: Kenneth B.
text:
2018
It has been truly amazing to get to celebrate our anniversary each year at Mona Lisa Restaurant.  I brought my wife to this little piece of Italian Heaven almost 20 years ago and it continues to be our favorite place to eat in San Francisco.  Delicious food paired with phenomenal service. You do feel like you are treated like family by Maurizio and his entire staff.  We started off with some mouth watering Bruschetta and topped of the dinner with an Italian rum cake that definitely didn't disappoint.
Thanks again for a wonderful evening! See you again very soon

2019
Had another amazing Anniversary dinner at our favorite slice of Italy.  This year marks 20 years of tradition having brought my wife to Mona Lisa #3 on our first date.  Our server, Antonio, treated us like family as we started off with a prosciutto and fresh mozzarella dish that delicious.
An incredible dinner topped of with an amazing Tiramisu for desert.  We look forward to seeing Maurizio and family every year.  Thank you for celebrating with us!!

author: Teri D.
text:
Yummy Italian lunch.

Truth:  We came for the deli next door but it was closed.  I yelped (yes, I just turned that in to a verb) Mona Lisa and saw the stars so we walked next door.  We are delighted we did.  After a brief wait, we were seated.  We ordered kid's cheese pizza, kid's spaghetti with meatballs, porcini ravioli, and penne with meat.  Our food was amazing.  You are also served bread.  Our service was... good but not great.  We could have all used water refills and we had to wait to make our order as well as get our bill.  It was still good service though.  

Great family friendly restaurant.

author: Renee D.
text: Amazing food and service we love u Mona Lisa!! We have been coming here for years the owner is very welcoming we love the delicious Italian food and beautiful decor!!

author: Nicki A.
text: Got the Risotto allo Scoglio, which was risotto in white wine sauce with clams, calamari, prawns and mussels. It's no wonder this place has been around forever! The food tasted great and I even had enough for leftovers (this may vary per person though, because my friend got the Chicken Parmesan and he devoured it all--also looked pretty yummy)!

author: Melanie M.
text: Mona Lisa's is an excellent homemade pasta spot in the Italian North Beach neighborhood of San Francisco! I would highly recommend anyone go there for an excellent pasta dish. But be prepared, if you want to order wine, your best bet is ordering a bottle. They have a terrible wine by the glass list! They also brought out bread that was a major joke (stale, and certainly not made there). I wouldn't recommend going for a super nice wine and pasta night if you don't plan to order by the bottle. We sat outside so we didn't get the atmosphere of the restaurant- but it seems very family oriented/classic authentic Italian. I had the veal ravioli and it was EXCELLENT! The portion size was perfectly controlled despite that meant the dish was on the more expensive side. I wish they had side salads and soups as an option for a starter but that didn't seem available to me. I also didn't think that their dessert menu was anything to write home about. Go for the pasta!

author: Parul V.
text:
True Italian place where the owner loves to feed his guests. 

This place has an expansive menu which offers options for everyone. The restaurant is happy to customize something if its needed and want to serve some great food with love. The owner Maurizio loves chatting with his guests and that's something that's equally enjoyed and appreciated by both people from SF and people visiting SF.

author: William L.
text: Charge on credit card was more than what I signed for... Probably an error but check your bills. Did was ok... I had shrimp pasta.  Nothing mind blowing... Servers seemed to have a bit of an attitude.  Didn't feel Italian hospitality.

author: Annika M.
text: My husband and I have been coming here for years on special occasions (e.g., Valentines Day, birthdays,etc.) and love getting the Cioppino! It arrives in a super hot cast iron pan full of shellfish and a yummy sauce. We've been to a number of restaurants in SF and our favorite cioppino is at Mona Lisa's. Last night we were treated to the arugula salad with fresh mozzarella and prociutto which was AMAZING! The owner is there every time we show up and makes us feel like family and the service is on par. I do recommend reservations fri and sat night as the line is out the door.

author: Avery A.
text: The best pasta in SF. Seriously love this place sooooo goooood and everyone's so friendly! Thanks for the good times Mona Lisa!

author: Daniella S.
text:
They feed you plenty family style. They rip you off with the wine so careful when going with a group they open bottle after bottle. In the end they charged us $435 for 3 bottles of wine ( we asked for 2 and they pushed a third on our group no one had asked for.... So when we asked to take the last bottle home with us after discussions back and forth the waiter emptied  the bottle in the back and then put it in a paper bag and gave it back to us with a straight face insisting it had been empty when we opened the bag and found the empty bottle.
The  food was fair Italian the ambiance quirky enough the staff are thieves.
I do not recommend going here in groups at all.
In fact I regret having eaten here at all.

author: C C.
text:
The owner is very rude. He said "You leave or not, I don't care. It's very busy. Just leave." What kind of customer service is this?

I ordered a pick up and it showed it's ready. It was ordered almost one hour before I showed. I politely asked him check if it's ready for pick up. I know it seemed busy, so I just waited until I have eye contact. Then, with smile, I asked him, but that is the response that I got.

I understand it can get busy and can be stressful to manage many people wait in line. However, he shouldn't tell customers like this as I already paid for it and waiting my food.

author: Tony C.
text:
I am not sure where to start with this review. I have walked by this place for years. At the moment I'm thinking, what took you so long to go on chef?  

We came through the door on a night that I was sure we might not even get in. We were greeted by Maurizio Flores. After I was seated I found out he was the owner. This gentleman understands the true art of greeting each guest with a warm sincere welcome. That alone starts your food journey for the evening on the right foot. 

The restaurant itself is cozy and warm. All of the pictures on the wall remind me of Satdi's restaurants in New York City. I am told all the famous pictures are at the owner's friends and people who have eaten here. The picture over our table is one of the late and great Prince. I had the opportunity to cook for him for 2 weeks.  The lights hanging in the middle of the restaurant reminds me of our flat we had for a week in Positano

We were seated in the section of Joseph B
Luca M. Wow!!!  The genuine care and comfort of their guests is their highest mission. I feel like we could be one of the few tables of English speakers.  Watching these charming waiters crossing over from Italian to English to give perfect service to each and every table. 

We started our first course with the calamari and it was fried to perfection. This is not one of these overly breaded bowl of rubber bands. How could we not have bruschetta as well. Beautiful, tasty and not a treat to be missed. 

We had the meat lasagna and the house pizza. Unfortunately, they took away the menu for me to describe perfectly how they prepare the dough. 

Thank you! Thank you!! Thank You Joseph B
Luca m and Maurizio Flores. It was a true honor to get to eat with you tonight!!!  This is why they have been here since 1979!!!

author: Shelley N.
text: I had made a reservation to celebrate a best friend birthday. We were seated a few minutes after our reservation time which was not a problem.  The wait staff was very polite and very friendly. For appetizer we had suppli allá Romana which was  very good. I had the spaghetti al salmon with pink sauce and my friend had penne alla zia rina which were both delicious and served hot.  For dessert we each had their amazing tiramisu which was to die for.  Unfortunately we ended the evening on a small sour note: 2-3 minutes after our bill was paid we were told by the owner to hurry up.  When he made his comment to us we were just gathering our things. We understand the restaurant was very busy but the tone used and words were not the right way to say something to us.

author: Steven S.
text: The food at Mona Lisa is fantastic! Without reservations, the wait can be long, but worth it.

author: Evelyn B.
text: I am extremely disappointed with the lack of accountability from this restaurant. My bf and I came here today to celebrate our anniversary swayed by the overwhelming number of good reviews from this restaurant. As we were eating our food, I saw a cockroach run across our table. We brought it to the attention of our waiter and he responded with, "Yeah the cockroaches are running away because we have been fumigating the restaurant....." Only later adding that, " that the cockroaches came from the restaurants over there *pointing across the street.* The waiter failed to demonstrate any concern about the health implications of cockroach infestation. If anything it seemed like the waiters was attempting to justify or normalize the situation. After the incident, we decided not to even finish our meal, asked for the check, paid and left. The waiter even had the audacity to ask if we still wanted desert, however, did not bother to apologize for our unpleasant experience. We are not the typical customer that this establishment caters to, my bf and I are Latino. We can't help to think that this could be a factor in why this incident was not taken seriously. The picture shows the cockroach on the yellow table cloth. We also posted a video since the original picture was a live picture.

author: Iain M.
text:
The waiter had an Italian accent.  Okay, that's mildly entertaining.

The location is good.  It's a tourist trap, but if you want to eat in this neighborhood on Columbus, you are likely to eat in a tourist trap.

The restaurant was very crowded, that's good, but it made it very difficult to hear other people in our group of six.  The restrooms were clean.

The starter, a three-tiered plate of antipasti, which had excellent variety and good quality.  I suppose it was a little awkward to dip the fried calamari in the bowl of sauce, as things didn't really fit on the table right.  If I came back I'd order this again, but if with five or more I'd get a second dipper of sauce for the calamari.

Our entrees were mediocre.  I had veal scallopini.  It was very basic, just the veal, sauce, proscuitto, over wilted spinach with a few potato wedges on the side.  Presentation was bland.  The guy to my left had the mussels, and he reported meh.

Here's the big problem though: the bill was too high for what we got. $300 for six people, two of whom were kids, with only one glass of wine among us, not including tip.  Had this been $200 I'd give them four stars, but they just aren't earning their prices.

Maybe just stop by for the antipasti.  It was a fine size for 6 and good and (I think) just $26.  You could get two and a little wine and be pretty happy.

author: Lily H.
text: Olive Garden tastes better than this. Unfortunately because we waited a long time to eat here and paid too much LOL we got suckered, I hope you don't

author: Shaleen L.
text: I was so excited to try this restaurant.. well the whole women thing they raved about on yelp i wanted to see. Plus the restaurant looked soo cool in the pics. We got there and this man standing outside shrit unbutton he looked sloppy. Had us sit inside wit our baby and the stoller. It was ok because it wasn't busy. We sat and sat and sat till the man from the front finally can wit a water. Just put on the table and walked off talking in some other language. So we waited some more. No one i mean no one said hello be wit you in a moment nothing.. then the waiter came and said " oh no one knew who was going to take this section so i can help you " wtf really.. i watched 6 plate's go out of that kitchen b4 he came. Then we asked for a bottle of wine. They were out of 2 top choices. So i closed my menu and we left. Just to the owners of this restaurant....ur staff made me feel very unwelcomed. We ended up going to a much better place..

author: Alex R.
text: This is probably my new favorite restaurant in the entire Bay Area! I came to visit SF for the weekend and a great friend of mine introduced me to Mona Lisa's! I must say this is the best Italian I've ever had. I ordered the chicken fettuccine and my boyfriend had the 4 cheese ravioli. Both absolutely exquisite! I really appreciated the wide range of wine selections. Best part of all was the service. The waiters are very attentive and the restaurant owner is a true delight who only wants his customers to have the best dining experience possible. Thank you Mona Lisa's!

author: Victoria K.
text:
Delicious food and quality service! One of the best restaurants in San Francisco and that's saying a lot. We had the chicken piccata and also a grilled chicken breast as our main dishes.   They both came with super delicious sauteed spinach and potatoes.  

The atmosphere is also fantastic; very unique! Perfect location in north beach. We took a taxi,  so I don't know about the parking situation.  I will say, that it was packed on a Thursday night, though we had a reservation.  I have come here pretty much every time I've been to San Francisco, and it is consistently good.

author: Mihai D.
text: This is probably the best Italian food I've ever had! Not only was the food amazing but the service was really great to, we were lucky enough to be seated in a cool vintage car parked right outside the restaurant which really added to the experience, if you're in San Francisco this definitely has to be on your list of places to try!

author: Sara D.
text: The restaurant was very busy and my hopes were high, however I'm extremely disappointed!  The bread we were given with our meal tasted a week old and was gross.  I got the lasagna, my husband got the spaghetti bolognese, both were very bland and had no flavor!  The lasagna did have a very good quality of mozzarella which I appreciate, but that's it.  I saw no sign of basil or any other seasoning.  We will not return

author: Alma C.
text: Always a great experience! Delicious food and great customer service.  A must when visiting San Francisco.

author: Gaurang K.
text:
Good food. But extremely poor service by a rude server. 

1) The server arrived 10-15 mins after I sat down. The restaurant was not busy at all.

2) The bread came after the food was served. 

3) The server forgot about my drink. Came after I had almost finished my food. 

4) Server didn't come to check how I was doing during the meal. On 3-4 occasions I had to frantically try to call someone else to get pepper, deserts and water.

5) Server came to pick up the check 10-12 mins after I put the credit card in it.


After I left low tip, the server came and argued with me why did I leave less tip and I respectfully explained the reasons, he got really angry and faught with me.  

It's sad to see such a good restaurant having such a bad server. 

(To the restaurant: server name initials is G. M.)

author: Angel P.
text: The venue reminds me a lot of Europe and Vegas Cesar palace at the same time. So many celebrities have been to this place and it's pretty cool that they have pictures of a lot of them hung up in their restaurant. We got a bottle of Chardonnay and it was on the sweeter side but it was still good. I ordered the seafood pasta and it was very delicious, they gave you a really good amount of seafood. We ordered bruschetta as appetizers the tomatoes was so fresh and the bread was the perfect amount of crisp. The customer service was superb but our food did take awhile to arrive and we were getting hungry. Check this place out!

author: Michael Patrick M.
text: Fantastic spaghetti with salmon and fettuccine sauce, Fantastic atmosphere!  They have a great variety of dishes to choose from!

author: Marissa M.
text: We waited a long time for everything from drinks to the check. We were there nearly 2 hours and it was only the two of us. It's e trembly cramped inside so if you go try to sit outside. The anti pasta appetizer is fun and delicious. The pastas however were hard to eat due to the high saltiness and I LOVE salt!!! It was honestly unbearable and neither of us could finish our plates due to the sauce which is a staple in Italian food.

author: Kelly O.
text: I don't know whether it was DoodDash or the restaurant- but I ordered food at 715pm for my kids and myself with a delivery estimate time of 45-55 minutes. After 1 driver leaving due to food not being ready our food was not delivered until 945pm! 2.5 hours for dinner delivery and starving kids. Totally unacceptable. And cold. So disappointed.

author: Conrad L.
text: What a great time we had for dinner with Mom. The decor is playful. The service was helpful - Giovanni suggested a good Chianti and helped us navigate the large menu. Lasagna was rich, delicious. The Involtini de Melanzane was not as special as I had hoped - lacking flare and that eggplant 'punch' of flavor. The Risotto allo Zafferano was a revelation - the shrimp were very nice and I have never seen a dish so extravagantly seasoned with saffron - excellent! That dish alone is reason enough to return, and we will.

author: Kimberly W.
text:
Quality Italian food with a fun atmosphere. All the staff are so friendly and work to make your experience enjoyable. 

Can be quite busy during peak times (weeknights, weekends) so try to make a reservation before!

author: Maria I.
text: I loved this place. The food it's amazing and the service was great this is the first time that I am in San Francisco and this was my first dinner at the little italy and I recomend this place with no doubt.

author: Omar T.
text: Amazing, perfect date night.  Staff is so attentive, food is delicious.  Felt like I was back home in Italy.  Highly recommended if you're in San Francisco.

author: Meredith D.
text:
This place was so highly reviewed we stopped here for pasta and wine. Honestly, it was just ok. It wasn't bad, but I can make better pasta at home. The wine was also really overpriced at $12 for a glass that they probably paid less than $12 for the whole bottle.

 The bruschetta appetizer was probably the best part of the meal, but again, not anything super special. Overall way overpriced for what you get, even for the Bay Area.

We'd also just barely finished the bruschetta when our pasta was brought out and felt super rushed to get out of there.

author: Zoe B.
text: Service was really bad when it was busy (I've been a waiter before, so I have a lot of patience with that).. we asked twice for bread, didn't receive water for at least 15 minutes, asked two people other than our server for certain items, and was overall forgotten by others because we were in the corner. Felt bad for tipping low, but the service was so terrible for the price we just paid... not to mention that the other table right next to us received parmesan cheese :(

author: Blake B.
text: Perfect spot for late night Italian in North Beach. The owner and all the staff are attentive and cheerful, serving you in an eclectic and entertaining space. The food comes quick and hot, even without being overpriced (a rarity in North Beach). I'd highly recommend Mona Lisa for a solid staple Italian Meal in SF!

author: Holly D.
text:
I had made reservations for dinner here Friday evening before our Speakeasy experience. I made reservations for 4 of us at 6pm. Our server came to our table quickly and brought us our beverages quickly. However, we did not receive our meal until 7pm. Granted we did look over the menu but it took them well over 40+ minutes to deliver our meal to the table. They did have a large group that showed up 1/2 hour after us and I'm sure this contributed. Since we had to be at the box office at 7:30pm this left us little time to eat. We had just enough time to wolf down our food and pay the bill. Not the best dinning experience for what was to be a special night out with friends. 

The meal itself was delicious! We ordered Chicken Parmigiana and Involtini Di Melanzane. The sauce with both dishes was outstanding yet different from each other. The chicken was tender and succulent, not dry at all. The eggplant was cooked to perfection, firm and flavorful. We would highly recommend both of these dishes.

author: L R.
text: This is so cool! I am sitting in the car that lives right outside the restaurant!! The owner is always super nice and helpful and I love their gluten free pasta

author: Alan W.
text: Excellent lunch!  Best we've had since getting here!  This is genuine Italian food.  The greeter barely knows English she was such a sweet hostess!  I had a Chicken Alfredo and she had Chicken Marsala.  The meal came out quick and perfect and service was the same!  This was the perfect place for a birthday lunch!  Luca and Olympia were the best!  I can't give them six stars but I would if I could!!

author: Sam V.
text: The place is amazing. The vibe is so relaxing and cozy with excellent,attentive and friendly employees. We were lucky enough to be seated in the car table. Like it's a literal car with the table; it stunning and I would definitely recommend. (Side note: this will bring you a lot of attention: you'll feel like your a painting in a museum)

author: Jessica T.
text: My second time here and I realized Mona Lisa is the place to come for Italian food!  We waited for a while to be seated but so worth it!!! The food is amazing! Mauricio, the owner, is super friendly and tries his best to please his customers. I can't wait to come back to my favorite Italian restaurant.

author: Jamie E.
text: The food and service was wonderful. We accidentally left a shopping bag there. They saved it and had it ready for us to pick up the next morning. Highly recommend

author: Jordan M.
text: Authentic Italian at its finest. The last time I had pasta like this was in Italy. The gnocchi was melt in your mouth amazing, the service was also great. Not many Italian places in the US have waiters that still speak fluent Italian. Would highly recommend to anyone thinking about stopping by for a true authentic dish!

author: Jen B.
text:
Meh. It was not great by any means. To me it's in the details.
When they had a bowl of parmesan cheese and not freshly grated...
and no pepper mill...
Meh.

author: Thomas D.
text: Me and my wife came here today and had an amazing experience, as soon as we arrived we were greeted by the owner who came up to me and was very warm and welcoming and made me feel like I was back home. Very traditional authentic italian, the food was delightful cooked perfectly but more importantly to me the experience and friendliness was top notch. Definitely will be back soon with more of mi familia!

author: Sarah P.
text: Really cute and authentic Italian restaurant. We had a group of 22 and the restaurant was more than accommodating. Appetizers,drinks and food were all brought out in a timely manner. They did not charge a reservation fee of require a minimum amount spent. The little mini cooper in the front is iconic and the staff and owner only add to the ambiance. Food was very good!

author: Sarah H.
text: Everything from the warm service to the playful decor and delicious food has my husband and I wanting to go back time and time again. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the friendly owner immediately sent over a complimentary bruschetta dish. It's evident to see that he has been treating his customers this way for 40 years. It was a perfect dining experience from the rich bottle of Chianti to the decadent house made vegetable lasagne. A gem in North Beach. Thanks for a beautiful night and cheers to our server John Carlos.

author: Ahmed A.
text:
The service is very bad and the stuff is very very rude the most bad experience I had in San Francisco 
Not recommended at all

author: Cira D.
text: This place is pretty good. Picked it on a Friday night. I made a reservation, but it did take a extra 10-15 to be sat. Probably because it was pretty full. The bruschetta was good

author: Victoria H.
text: I went with my parents and at first I was excited by the very large selection of pastas on the menu, it was also a short wait to get in when other Italian restaurants had 40min waits, but all our dishes were disappointing. I had a butternut ravioli and it didn't taste good - I don't even know how you mess up butternut squash filling because it is normally so amazing. I believe my parents got lasagna and a panzerotti and they both found that the food was okay but not great as well. I wouldn't go again.

author: Sunshine 1.
text: Chicken parmesan was great! Service was cool. We were told there had to be a $15 pp order. Just fyi

author: Lydia M.
text:
Not sure why it's so raved about honestly.

The menu was so long that I couldn't decide. Finally got the chicken parm which was good but not the best I've ever had and was a bit expensive.

author: Isabella V.
text:
This place is a must! The best of North Beach with real Italian flavors. The owner, Maurizio Florese is the best host, he is from Calabria and he knows what real Italian food is and tastes like. 
I am Italian also and I strongly recommend this restaurant, even for the special warm and eclectic atmosphere, visually entertaining, with statues, lights, photos, colors, yet very cozy. 
Fish, steak, appetizers, pizza, desserts, everything is so good! Huge menu and good wines from Italy. 
I just love it!

author: Jill S.
text:
Love love love this place! Like a trip to Italy.
The customers next to us were speaking Italian as well as the waiters cooks owners and Italian decor. Great food! "More wine Bella"?

author: Luciana S.
text: Our food was okay. To be honest, I didn't like mine because it didn't taste like anything. Even adding salt, didn't make it better. I was Very disappointed to come to an Italian place and not enjoy the food. They should improve the quality for sure.

author: Gardenia H.
text:
One of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city. The owner is so delightful and a true service man. 

This was my second visit and I brought my friends who where visiting for the first time. Our server took amazing care of us and even gave us a a complimentary Tiramisu to make our night.

Long story short, Mona Lisa will always have my heart when it comes to Italian food and service.

author: Jill W.
text: Had a wonderful dinner experience. We originally went into the Stinking Rose and the service was not up to the prices so we walked out... Mauricio welcomed us in as we were out front looking at the menu and the cute little car. There were 9 of us celebrating our friends birthday. He hooked us up with amazing Garlic bread, treated us like family the whole time all this before we even got food. The food was AMAZING !!! I got the eggplant Parmesan , mouth watering ... can't wait to come back!

author: Tom M.
text: Super friendly service in Little Italy. Fantastic pastas and pizzas. The lobster ravioli is to die for and the seafood dishes are very fresh. Highly recommend.

author: Debbie K.
text:
What a great place to stop by for an afternoon lunch or a lovely dinner. I love it here. REALLY LOVE IT!  Every time I have visited, everyone has been super friendly and the wait staff is amazing. We have walked in with no reservation and some how we always get seated at the same table! It's not a very big restaurant but the ambience is absolutely beautiful... kind of dark, with a bar on one side and open kitchen on the other. Tables are down the middle of the restaurant. It is truly one of my favorite places to visit when I am visiting the North Beach area. The food is AMAZING! Get the bruschetta, you won't be disappointed. Perfectly grilled toast with just the right amount of tomato and garlic. In past visits, I have had the Margarita Pizza, Pasta with olive oil and garlic (amazing), Chicken marsala and Pasta Pomodoro. My son absolutely loves the seafood pasta. I have never been disappointed  here. Also,  they have a GREAT desert menu...Tiramisu, White Chocolate Profiteroles, Raspberry panna cotta, Mango panna gotta, Cannoli,  Lemon ripieno,  Tartufo chocolate, and LIMONCELLO!
You will not be disappointed. A must visit. 
Bon appetit!

author: Farzan K.
text:
I went to this restaurant with a group of 10. Their food is 3/5 and I take one star off for the poor service. A couple of examples: the food was supposed to come with side vegetables but the plate came with side pasta and the waiter told us that they were out of vegetables and he didn't know about it himself. He offered and brought a side "salad" instead which was literally only a bunch of shredded lettuce. We also asked the waiter to box our leftover. He then took the plate but never brought the boxed food.

Update: it seems like manager wants to just erase the problem without addressing it. The server did bring pasta as the side instead of vegetables and when we asked he said "we were out of vegetables." We then asked why didn't you check with us, to which he replied "I just found out myself".

author: Jin Y.
