text: Incredible restaurant. Amazing ambiance, nice staff with great decorations. The pasta was amazing. Did I mention all the funky Mona Lisa decorations?

author: Prateek R.
text:
1st visit - Ordered Carbonara minus meat plus onions n peas- really liked it. Enjoyed the atmosphere and interiors. Would like to explore more.

2nd visit - Ordered spaghetti with pink sauce (with onions n peas). Loved it !!! Also found a cute little car outside as a table. 

Only disappointment is the bread is not fresh and tasty. Had better ones in other places. I feel the bread definitely defines the quality of food and the restaurant itself. That's where it lost a star

author: George T.
text: Had an excellent 2nd date here.  We both eat gluten-free and cane here specifically for the amazing GF pasta dinners.  I love SF for places like this.  Will be back again very soon!

author: T A.
text: The food was fantastic! Wish I could give 4.5 stars. I had a penne with eggplant, mushrooms and red sauce. Service could have been a little friendlier but they were packed with a line out the door. Butter or a small plate to pour olive oil on should be offered with the complimentary bread. Decor interesting. I would definitely come back and try other dishes

author: Kimi Marie N.
text:
This review is along time coming. I don't ever write reviews  but, I have to give praise to my most favorite restaurant "Mona Lisa" because it is so good or should I say wonderful is a better word.
if you are in the mood for some delicious Italian food in San Francisco then this is the place.  Their menu has a wide variety of delicious dishes to suit any appetite and each dinning experience has never been a disappointment. 
One of my favorite plates is the Fettuccine Leonardo. With each bite you can savor the fresh ingredients, the texture of the pasta and the rich creaminess of the Alfredo Sauce "Heaven" I tell you. As you sit at your table you can see and smell the food prepared to order. It really adds to experience of dinning at Mona Lisa. 
The Host and it's staff are very polite and at times you can find the Owner himself greeting you or seeing that all your needs are met. It really gives you a feeling of being "Welcomed" into their family. 
I just really LOVE this restaurant!

author: stephanie f.
text:
The Italian restaurant we meant to go to was closed, so we just happened to pop into this place. What a lucky choice for us!

First, the ambience is awesome! Lots of old school photos on the walls, Italian art and sculptures around, and beautiful tapestries on the ceiling. Nicely set tables, beautiful chandeliers, and a few DISCO BALLS! Yes, there were disco ball shining lights all around the restaurant. It was such a fun place! Definitely a nice Italian restaurant with a twist!

The food was excellent! We ordered a Caesar salad and an Italian house salad. I could eat the Italian house salad every day and not get sick of it, it was so delicious! We also ordered a yummy appetizer that was served with the best pesto sauce I've ever had, fettuccine Alfredo, and spaghetti with meatballs. Yum!

Our server was very friendly, accommodating, and actually really from Rome! What a nice guy, and so interesting to talk to! 

I would definitely recommend this place for a delicious and relaxed meal

author: Avinash R.
text: Was here on time and owner was an a-hole.  He said our reservation was at 7 and we were reserved at 7:15 - and didn't seat us at all!  Terrible if we can't even taste the food!

author: Deborah B.
text: The food was delicious and the staff was friendly!Unfortunately, we had to wait 45 minutes for our dinner to arrive at our table.  Since we had theater tickets for an 8pm show, we had to eat quickly and dash, leaving us disappointed we didn't have time to savor each bite.

author: Isabel Y.
text: Fantastic service and ambiance. The food was amazing. A great place to indulge if you like Italian food. Very authentic place too.

author: steve b.
text:
Excellent Italian. Daughter had cheese ravioli. I did fettuccine arriabata. Friendly service and nice ambiance. 

Happy. 

And full.

author: Mayur D.
text:
Dined here last night. The restaurant was super busy and had to wait 20 mins beyond the actual reservation time. Here are the ratings -

Food - 5/5 (everything was excellent)
House wine - 2/5 (Chianti, Sangiovese - tasted like crap out of the bottle, but was marginally drinkable after 20 mins or so)
Service - 4/5

Would recommend this place if you are craving an Italian meal.

author: Priyanka P.
text:
Food was amazing. Service was great. One of the best places for Italian food. 

Being a vegetarian, I don't find many places for pasta but this place has variations and they do modify dishes if needed.

author: Andy L.
text: New Yorker here and I can confidently say this is easily one of the best Italian restaurants in San Francisco. Forget those flame spots in soma and head here. It's well worth it.

author: Tevan N.
text: Absolutely fabulous!! From the moment I walked to the door I was greeted with warmth and joy. I felt like I was walking up to my family's door. Mauricio treated me like an absolute Queen. This being my first time in San Fran, and traveling alone, I was shocked and delighted. He recommended a mushroom ravioli dish. Which are hand made in house daily. *drool* And he started me off with the bruschetta. I'm not going to lie, that little piece of toast with chunks of Parmesan cheese on the side, was the best piece of bread I've had in a long time. Simple. Classic. Amazing. He also recommended the Sauvignon Blanc to pair with my meal, perfection. This restaurant is a home away from home. Easy walk to little Italy and China town. Across the street from St. Francis Cathedral. So I'd suggest a seat outside to enjoy the passers by and see the building in all their glory. I will 100% be coming back to visit my new friends and have a home style Italian meal. Absolutely fabulous food and service!

author: Kelsey B.
text: The chicken parm was to die for. Foodie tip: request garlic bread instead of the regular bread served.

author: Jesse L.
text:
This is a pretty decent Italian restaurant located in the North Beach area of San Fran.  

We called ahead and asked about reservations.  The lady who answered said "yes you'll need rev's".  Then when we said it was for 2 people she said "just come in soon and we will seat you".  

We then arrive and get seated immediately. All seams well and no reason to gripe ...until the bread comes.  Maybe it was bad timing or maybe that's the way it is but our bread basket was full of stain, hard to eat bread slices.  We had oil but no peppers or vinegar to dip in.  So we helped ourselves to the empty table next to us. 

So far we aren't to impressed.   Then the meals come.  I got the gluten free Kale ravioli $29 and my wife got the rigatoni alla borrelli $26.  The food was very good but the price doesn't quite add up.  Our server was very good but I can't put her name in this review since nobody where's name- tags. 


Over all-  good atmosphere, good food, good service and ok art

author: Ashley P.
text: This place was pretty crowded, but that means it's a good one! We only waited about 10 minutes. The food is amazing (I got the tortellini with ham/peas), wonderful service, and the wine selection is extensive. I would definitely go back!!

author: Marcello D.
text:
What a great experience that we had at Mona Lisa!
Friendly staff a great service. The Veal Saltimbocca was excellent just like my grandma used to make it for me. Good job guys, we will be back soon!

author: Niyati D.
text:
This place is awful. As someone else noted below, their deliveries take way longer than estimated, and the food is not even worth the wait. We ordered a Don Mario pizza, which notes sauce as the first ingredient in its description, and it literally arrived as in the photo - no sauce, entirely tossed, cold and hard. We also ordered ravioli, which was undercooked. All of it was inedible.

When we called the restaurant, they hung up on us. When GrubHub tried contacting them about our order, they didn't even pick up.

GrubHub delivery guy said they only started preparing our order after I called about it being 30 mins late.

Everything about my experience with this restaurant was totally awful.

Update -- 2 weeks after not receiving an update about my refund request, I followed up with the restaurant and the man on the other end basically yelled at me and hung up on me. Customer service does not seem to be valued at this restaurant.

author: Jesse N.
text: Definitely was disappointed. It got off to a fine start as the service was not bad and the atmosphere is very nice (although it is crowded and noisy). We ordered the fried calamari as an appetizer and it was decent, but nothing special. But that wasn't the issue. For dinner, we each ordered the penne alla vodka. Maybe there was a mistake in the kitchen, such as accidentally spilling all the salt while cooking, but the pasta was literally the most salty dish I've ever had. We had to get gelato after from a nearby spot just to get the salty taste out of our mouths. The next morning my mouth still felt gross. There are plenty of better spots in North Beach, especially for the price.

author: Ashley N.
text: This retaurant is so amazing! Highly recommend the asparagus ravioli, chicken some, and lobster ravioli! Great service, great atmosphere!

author: Ajitesh J.
text: Very good place. The person at the reception was very kind. The deserts are the best. Do try panna cotta as its too delicious

author: Angela D.
text: Cant remember the name of my dish, but it was incredibly delicious.  Penne pasta, ham, pork sausage and prosciutto.  Parmesan cheese on top.  It was on of the best Italian dishes I've ever had.  Thank you for the hospitality.

author: Angelica M.
text: Seriously people? I have no idea why this place has such high stars. The service is the absolute worst I have ever experienced in San Francisco! I brought my family to the city, and stopped in to this restaurant, specifically because of the great reviews. I was so disappointed! It took literally 2 hours for hour food to come out, and that was after my asking the server a bunch of times about our food and then got attitude from not only said server but also the owner and the other server working our section. Other tables came and went before our food even came out. I'm not sure if it's because our family speaks Spanish, but one would think that in a place as diverse as San Francisco things like that wouldn't be happening. One thing is for sure I will never eat at Mona Lisa again, and if you're like me and use reviews to make meal decisions, steer clear of this place. It sucks!

author: Jesse C.
text: I highly recommend this restaurant when you're in The City. Warm hospitality delicious appetizers, entrées and deserts and of course exceptional wines.  Maurizio, thank you so much for your generosity. We can't wait to come back with friends and family.

author: Lea R.
text: If you are single and coming from out of town don't recommend it.  I am sitting in the walk way. Everyone is looking at the woman eating alone. The food was ok, nothing special and the pasta I ordered was expensive.

author: Shellena G.
text: This place is amazing !!! I am Italian and the food was so good !! Just like home ! Just as goodThis with all respect to my grandmother the eggplant Parmesan was to die for ! The owner Maricio was working hard himself to get our table ready . Family owned amazing ambiance you have to come ! Thank you Mona Lisa I will be back !!!

author: Gabby R.
text: Alas the search for the great Italian go-to spot in SF continues. We had the veal alla parmagian and the sauce was super bland, I mean is salt and pepper the enemy? Also, bizarrely the sauce was so watery. Not convinced the pasta is really homemade either. My husband had the pasta carbonara, also super bland. Yeah, we didn't even venture to try the desserts we were so disappointed. 1 Star for the meh but free bread and 1 star for service.

author: Mikey S.
text: The Aldon Smith Pasta was unbelievable. The wine on the other hand was average. Service was great and great atmosphere.

author: Susana W.
text: Exquisite Italian cuisine. Very complete menu. Excellent attention. Highly recommended

author: Katerina D.
text: Amazing place, liked the restaurant style and my pizza was great! Tried a nice Sicilian vine there.

author: Claudia D.
text:
We decided to take a trip to San Francisco for the weekend. I've never been but my boyfriend has and he said that he had to show me this place. I'm so glad he did! 

The service is really just great and the food is delicious. I didn't know what kind of wine to get so I asked the waiter to surprise me with any red wine and it was delicious. The interior was so cool. It's a mix of a bunch of different things. I really just loved it here! Their pizza is soooo good. And their pasta is delicioso!

Only thing I'm upset about is the fact that we live so far away! Any time we go to SF, we will, without a doubt, be stopping by!

author: Albie E.
text:
Best place to go eat Italian food in the Heart of North Beach neighbourhood of San Francisco. 

The ambiance is relaxing and the food is very good! If you go eat, make sure you're very hungry due to very generous portions! 

Price is reasonable for food and location. The menu offers a wide variety of food, pastas, seafood, poultry, meats and desserts!

author: Robert O.
text: Just discovered over the 4th of July holiday if your looking for really good authentic Italian food you found the right place.  From the chefs to the wait staff,, great ambiance and highly recommended the raviolis.

author: Malka T.
text: My family loves Cioppino so when we're in San Francisco we search for the best Cioppino restaurants.  Until today Sotto Mare was our absolute favorite, but today we fell in love with Mona Lisa.  A quiet atmosphere with food that was absolutely excellent and our waiter was delightful with a real Italian accent which I found charming when I understood it.  We shared 2 servings of Cioppino for 3 of us (divided by the kitchen) and took home some.  They even had gluten free pasta for my son.  The only slip was missing bread plates and our table could've used a candle.  Other than that I recommend them highly!

author: diana s.
text: 10 STARS if I could. Best Italian food. Best pizza dough. Everything is fresh and made daily. Been going here for 15 years. Amazing service. Maurício the owner is a sweet heart and sure knows how to run a business and keep us customers coming back to Mona Lisa. You will definitely not be disappointed.

author: Lauren R.
text: Amazing food and the owner Mauricio is the nicest guy! Highly recommend!!! Asparagus ravioli is the BEST pasta I've ever had!

author: Bob S.
text: The food was fresh, delicious and authentic; the service was excellent and we love the quaisi-renaissance décor. They have a very good wine list. PLUS: The on-site owner spoke Italian well with me! A+

author: Denise H.
text:
I wasn't even that hungry and I can't believe the 3 of us cleaned our plates! 

We were seated all the way to back of restaurant which I thought was nice because I could see the entire beauty of the place. Very Italian,however , with sunglasses and military hats on all the busts - which I didn't understand.

author: Stavro P.
text: I'm shocked about the reviews at Mona Lisa as of recent. I have been coming to Mona Lisa since I was young with my parents and come back very frequently. I was at Mona Lisa on Monday and it is just as great as before and advertised. I was greeted by the great Maurizio and was seated quickly. I got the Cioppino (my favorite) and it was delicious. I have a hard time understanding these other yelpers with these recent reviews but I can reassure you this place is an awesome spot for a nice bite to eat. Thank you Mona Lisa!

author: Giovanni M.
text:
I went twice yesterday for lunch and dinner ! I always get the best from the best team ! Antonio during lunch time very hospitable and an excellent service ... at night had a great dinner with an excellent service from Emmanuelle ! The food is very authentic and delicious. The servers are great "Ciro , Joseph , Antonio , Emmanuelle , Giovanni " and of course Maurizio the owner is an amazing guy who greets everyone with a smile !
Love the place! 100 stars!


Highly recommend this place

author: Kelsie A.
text: We just happened to walk across this restaurant and ended up being super yummy! Pasta is good - and you can opt to get homemade pasta! The 72-hour dough pizza is the best!!!

author: Sierra B.
text: I came to Mona Lisa for my first time and let me tell you it was amazing! I've always seen it consistently busy every time I have drove by there. They having amazing decor inside and wonderful music which makes you want to dance. I have the bruschetta and calamari for a starter. Very tasty and flavorful! For the entree I have the DELICIOUS Ravioli ai Quattro Formaggi. I mean let me tell you it was so good, I was practically ready to lick the bowl! The staff was extremely friendly! From the door all the way to the table. Clean environment I haven't seen a dirty table in site! Very rare on busy restaurants such as this one. Even though I might not go to Italy anytime soon, this is definitely as close as it comes! Will not be disappointed!! Come ASAP!

author: Nate P.
text: Oh man, where do I begin? This place is awesome. The hospitality was top notch. It was the most interesting dining experience I've had. Amazing food and staff.

author: Annette C.
text: Great restaurant, great food! A bit packed on a Saturday night but the manager made sure my friend and i were seated as soon as possible. This restaurant has a great Italian ambiance and made me feel like i was in Italy without leaving California! My friend and i were only in  San Francisco for the weekend but this restaurant was definitely one of my favorite places!

author: Amanda T.
text: The worst meal we had in San Francisco during our week's stay. The meat sauce was horrible and the "homemade" pasta had to be out of a box. Total waste of $. There are plenty other Italian restaurants in the city to eat - try those. I should add the service was not good either. All around it was a terrible experience.

author: tanya t.
text:
Got take out, customer service  was nice.  Food was bland.  One of my dish was with vodka sauce which only taste like tomato sauce.
The other dishes  I order was   spaghetti with meat ball and spaghetti with sausage  taste average.

author: Precila A.
text: If I could give this restaurant zero stars, I would. I came here with my family. We were drawn to the high reviews. We were immediately served table bread, which were stale. As an appetizer, we ordered fried calamari. It tasted bland and rubbery (clearly over cooked). As we were served our entrees, a COCKROACH had appeared to hitch a ride on one of the plates. As soon as the entrees hit the table, it ran across the table and up the wall. Needless to say, we immediately lost our appetites and promptly left the restaurant without taking a bite. DISGUSTING!

author: Melissa M.
text: My mom and I came here on our annual Christmas dinner in the city, and we were delighted. The food was excellent. We had a three course meal with perfectly seasoned bruschetta, and then we ordered the most delicious pasta dishes. We topped it all off with tiramisu and another dessert. Great service, great atmosphere, and a truly authentic Italian restaurant. 5/5!!!

author: Joe R.
text:
As the saying goes third times the charm, well in Mona Lisa's case we'd say the second time it the charm! 

After our last visit (Winter 2017) and my previous review, I will say service has gotten better. Our server Roberto was friendly and attentive and this was a big difference from the last time (which we all still vividly remember)​ to be very different and not for the better; good job Roberto!

The food still extraordinary and flavorful. From the menu we ordered the Carprese Salad, Chicken Marsala, Involtini Mona Lisa, with a bottle of Donna Laura Chianti and split the Raspberry Panna Cota for dessert! The meal totaled $123.53 and while some would consider steep, just remember​ you are in San Francisco, and to eat well, you're gonna pay.

If your looking for for an Italian restaurant​ in Little Italy/ San Francisco that has great atmosphere, good food and good service, give Mona Lisa a try, but we do recommend making a reservation and doing that on Yelp made that a snap!

author: Kavita P.
text: We went for lunch. The service was great, but the food we ordered was way too rich. The caprese salad was good, but had more oil than I would've liked and not enough balsamic (to be fair there's balsamic on the table, so an easy fix). I got the mushroom ravioli based on the waiter's recommendation. It was really good, but sooo rich. I definitely regretted eating all that food right after. Might go back after an intense workout or something when I can handle that level of richness.

author: Jennifer A.
text: Though the mushroom risotto was good and the peas in the tortellini were so fresh, I would still order the pizza before either of these next time. The crust is so airy and delicious!

author: Desiray V.
text: Seriously the best pasta I've ever had in my life! Amazing service. The wine is sooo good! If I could give this place 10 stars I would. Love the decor!

author: Victoria Y.
text: Came here for lunch because it was walking distance from my office. The restaurant was pretty much empty except for us during a weekday at around noon but we came in anyway after looking at the menu displayed outside. We were seated at a little table by the window as soon as we walked inside. We decided to order the cacio e Pepe and the carbonara. They brought us a basket of bread after taking out orders and there was olive oil and vinegar on the table for us already. The pasta came out pretty fast and the flavors tasted pretty good. My only complaint would be that the spaghetti was cooked for a little too long; I would've preferred a harder, chewier texture but other than that, I really liked it. The carbonara had a good Smokey bacon flavor and the cacio has a nice peppery flavor to it. They also have fresh Parmesan cheese to sprinkle over the top as well.

author: Sanjaya M.
text: Wow. We are here on Father's Day and obviously very busy.  I wish the house bread was warm. That said 5 stars because the food was and always is spectacular here.  In particular I asked for the vegetarian Pasta with Pink Sauce and asked them to throw in some sun dried tomatoes.  Wow, perhaps the best pasta I ever tasted. Including the Gnocchi from Pizza Antica which is also very good. Excellent

author: Mary F.
text: Very nice Italian restaurant a short distance walk from North Beach in Little Italy. Good food and friendly staff.

author: Jose A.
text: This was my families first time eating here and I've got to say how great the food was! I couldn't choose what was the best dish. The waiter was very helpful and really good with our kids. As we sat there we noticed the owner was outside cleaning the sidewalk and street, shows his pride in his place and city.

author: Taylor S.
text: I absolutely love it here! Whenever I am in the Bay Area I always make it a point to eat here! I was here last night with my family and it did not disappoint. The service was excellent and we were treated really well. The people who work here are very passionate about what they do and treat us like we are Star customers. For appetizers we got the Burrata Fresca; it did not disappoint. It was flavorful and overall amazing. Then I had fettuccine with marinara. I loved it and there was so much pasta it felt like it never ended. I will be coming back as soon as I am back in San Francisco!

author: Alyssa H.
text: Cozy, delicious dinner. Everything was fresh and seemed so simple. We had Chianti, caprese, and scoglio. Great area, great team and we will go back!

author: Haltone H.
text:
Me = medigan who married into wops. I've had a lot of good Italian food, both in Italy and northeastern US.

That said, the entrees were great! The cacio e pepe was perfect. Husband's ravioli had a really fresh and homemade-tasting red gravy.  My extremely picky father-in-law (nothing is like Mama made it) would have loved it.

The negatives: the garlic app was just okay. The bread was very generic, not up to the level of the food. And wine aficionados shouldn't have high expectations here. The rose was acceptable. The pinot noir was extremely bland. Neither was poured tableside, so could have been box wines. Both were "cooked" (not kept around 56 degrees), which is pretty common. Possibly the wines by the bottle are better quality/better storage.

Service was decent. Decor was great, which is really why we ended up there though it wasn't necessarily on my 'list'. And the quality of the entrees really made it worth it.

author: Dee M.
text: Talk about service! This place made every special effort to free a table close to the door so my husband would not have to walk far and they stowed the wheelchair out of the way so he could enjoy the meal without having to be too far away from the table because of wheelchair legs. The food was fresh, fast, and phenomenal. The calamari appetizer was too much for one person so my husband shared it with our neighboring table. The house red wine made a nice pairing with our meals. We would highly recommend this place but definitely make a reservation because it is not a secret!

author: Gino M.
text:
I gotta say that I love this place.  For the last eight years - when I visit San Francisco - I love to stop here and get some dinner.  

Is the pasta fresh?  No, of course not.  You don't make HUGE bowls of tortellini and have them be hand made.  

But it's damn good.  The service is quick and the food is some of the tastiest I've ever had.

My recommendation for an appetizer is the "Sicilian Candy" - roasted garlic cloves.  SO sweet and delicious.  I could just eat those.

author: Joel R.
text: How does this place have so many positive reviews. Every dish extremely salty. I had the Lasagna, which aside from being burnt and extremely salty, tasted like nothing. Person I was with had the Carbonara which was watery and tasteless, besides the salt of course.  I don't know if it's because they used sauce from a jar or what, but the food was really bad.

author: Jeff N.
text: Outstanding. My cousin brought me here to celebrate a friends dirty 30. She'd been raving out it for weeks. I finally came and was not disappointed. The food was amazing. Wine paring are great. The service was personal and sincere. 11/10 would recommend.

author: Roxanne C.
text: We dined here July 2019. We LOVED the food. I had Chicken Piccata and my husband had Spaghetti Carbonara. We ate outside and it was fun to watch all the people walking by. The service was excellent. Wine by the glass is pricey at $12 but it is a big glass of wine. We don't go up to the city much but we will definitely make the trip just to come back to this restaurant!

author: Phoebe L.
text: LOVE. we got to sit in the car and eat and drink good food and wine. great meal, great desert. we were stopped about a hundred times for photos in the car and it was so fun! felt famous! overall amazing experience.

author: Augusto U.
text: Honestly one of the best Italian places I have been to anywhere from San Francisco to New York to Italy. Super friendly hosts and waiters and waitresses. Enjoyable and great prices from upper to high end. Great date spot can't go wrong!

author: Bria R.
text: Great experience! Food was excellent the ambiance was also to our liking. Wewill defiantly be coming back again .

author: rav s.
text: Fantastic and fantastic. The food was amazing from start to finish and the service was good

author: Rachel S.
text: We love this restaurant.  The atmosphere is amazing.  The service is wonderful and I would seriously go just to hear the waiters speak.  :)  They have an impressive wine selection and delicious, authentic Italian food.  The best I have had on the West coast.  We enjoyed the calamari-crispy, fresh, salty and delicious.  The marinara sauce served with the calamari is so good I wanted to eat it with a spoon.  My favorite dish is the spaghetti alle vongole and the combo of spaghetti with the tangy white wine sauce, rich tomato and the clams is the stuff dreams are made of.  My husband enjoyed the cannelloni with sausage and the same delicious marinara.  Everything tastes as though it has been thoughtfully prepared with love all day.  The portions are huge, the drinks are great, and we will continue to come back when we visit San Francisco.

author: Janet A.
text: Love the food Great Service this is a must go to place when in the San Francisco or in the area.

author: Burcu Ö.
text: Food wasn't good enough. I got margarita and added chicken. Marinara sauce was too much on pizza, my chicken wasn't cook really. Who wants to eat under cooked chicken. My friend got Alfredo chicken pasta, she liked sauce but she couldn't eat chicken as well because under cooked! So food is not worth it for the high price!

author: Megan M.
text: The food and service was great, our server Giovanni was awesome and friendly. We had the fettuccini with tomatos and chicken and the lasagna di casa. They were both amazing and big portions. We left very full and satisfied. Service was fast and our experience was great. Would recommend to anyone, try to get Giovanni as your server and you'll be happy!

author: Mark F.
text:
Food: Amazing
Service: Not great...

I have been a couple of times, the last time i went was not the best experience. Made a reservation at 7 and was seated at 7:50.. 

Food was flavorful, and each course did take time to be made, but once they were made they came quick, portions were good, and wine tasted amazing. The food was very filing so I was glad to take some home to enjoy later. 

The staff isn't the friendliest any of the times I've gone, and the restaurant does get busy so they don't get much of a chance to be attentive. 

Expect to be at this restaurant for at least an hour, mostly based off of how long it takes to get served.

author: Tia C.
text:
Upon arrival we were cordially greeted by the owner who showed us to our table. The server was prompt in bringing us water and bread. We were meeting 5 other people who arrived at various times. He was patient and offered suggestions from the menu. We had an antipasto dish, courtesy of the owner that was bountiful, amazing and delicious! I ordered the Don Marco pizza that did not disappoint! ( also tasted great leftover} My husband had the tricolored tortellini w/pancetta...so delicious!
I recommend this place wholeheartedly. It is worth driving around looking for parking!!!

author: Alissa A.
text: Really nothing to complain about. Owner greeted us from street and welcomed us in. Arranged table and service was quick, professional, friendly and knowledgable. Food was very delicous and flavorfull. Actually even better than most dishes I have tried in Italy itself !!! Their wine was really good too. Great atmosphere with good music. Love the art inside. Lastyly, its Family friedly!

author: Danny W.
text: I came here with my roommate for dinner about a week ago and the experience was fabulous! The food was delicious, of course! But what really got me was the friendly staff, especially the owner who would periodically come to check on me and my roommate- always quick with a joke! Felt very comfortable and had home-y vibes.

author: Mery F.
text: Mona Lisa Restaurant is one of my favorite Italian  place, they have an enormous choice of different food on the menu. The staff is real authentic Italian and they create a unique atmosphere, it's like being in Italy! I stop by for a meal or a glass of wine very often and it's always a pleasure. The owner Maurizio is unique and an amazing host. he is always super nice, a gentleman with his costumers!

author: Debbie A.
text: GREAT place all the way around....Food, wine, people and atmosphere...all Great!!!! We've been visiting Mona Lisa's for the past 10+ years and have ALWAYS received Great service and delicious food!!! Somedays we share a Pizza & a Cesar salad and maybe even an appetizer(Calamari is my favorite!!) And then sometimes we try something new... Lasagna & Fettuccine Alfredo are still my 2 favorites!!! YUM!!! Maurizio and his staff are all great, kind people and always make sure customers are happy and enjoying their food!!! I would highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner.... come hungry, large plates of very yummy food!!!

author: Michael S.
text: Good food. Nice atmosphere.  Friendly staff.  Waiter forgot part of order but charged anyway.  Just fine.  Not too special.

author: Stylishshopper ..
text:
Delicious vegetarian pasta!

Stopped in here after going to the famous Franciscan Shrine across the street on Easter. 

There were many vegetarian options, FAR more  veg options than the larger touristy Italian spot across the street...... 

Servers were REALLY friendly and welcoming, maybe because it was pretty early /slow and a holiday...... 

Anyways, I got the Penna Rosa pasta which was way more delicious than it looked!!!! 

Served piping hot, super flavorful, fantastic lunch. 

Fantastico!! I'll be back.....

author: Stephanie P.
text:
Really great ambience, good location, nice dining area and European style patio for sitting outside.  
I ordered the eggplant parmesan, and it was way too rich.  Mostly mozzarella and tomato sauce, there was a pool of oil at the top of the dish.  Would not order again.  My friend had the funghi risotto which was better, I guess some dishes are hit or miss.

author: Nicole M.
text:
This restaurant was super cute on the inside and out. The people that worked there all seemed pretty busy but everyone was friendly. 

The food is a little expensive and you don't get a ton. The drink prices are also a little overpriced. We usually get a bottle of wine with dinner but their cheapest option was $45 which is pretty steep.

author: Dd D.
text: One of my favorite places in the city. Been coming here for over 10 years and always does not disappoint. The food is rich, tasty and freshly made as always. Best on the strip of Little Italy in SF. And they actually have Italians working there. Keeps the place authentic. Will definitely be going here many more times. Thanks Mauricio. Thank you Mona Lisa.

author: Alyssa A.
text:
the menu is huge and very overwhelming but you will also feel the same energy from the dated decor. i feel bad
for the kitchen staff as they seem to be unable
to perfect any dishes. our complimentary bread was very stale and had to ask for fresh'er' bread. was hoping for a focaccia but it was just your basic slice of bread. had the burrata to start which was served on top of arugula and hidden under loads of prosciutto and parmigiana reggiano. the main focus of the dish is the burrata?? but its plated under a bunch of prosciutto. the dish itself was very unpleasant looking. none of this was dressed in olive oil, balsamic di modena or any type of salt, instead was topped with another cheese... and have table salt available. very confusing and would expect more for +20$. had the gluten free carbonara as my main and it was the worst i've had. the pasta itself had no texture, too over cooked. they didn't cook the egg mixture enough, it was very runny and inedible. on top of that the pancetta served in the dish wasn't even crispy?? i had a few bites and we asked for the bill. my boyfriend ordered a pizza and he hated it how can you fuck up a pizza my guy. the dough was undercooked and overall tasteless with shitty cheese. i was absolutely shocked that they didn't question us as to why we barely touched our mains. but then again after our app we waited a decent amount of time for our mains with our dirty dishes stacked at the side of the table for our sever to come take them, plenty of foh walked past them numerous times and he still brought our mains before clearing the table. 25$ for a glass of pinot and half ass pour beer that was also served in a wine glass and not being asked for another drink. after spending +100 we left our take aways on top of a garbage can hoping someone will find it. they weren't busy, maybe i have high expectations, this restaurant is a disgrace to italian cuisine.

author: Kaiel J.
text: Upon on arrival we were warmly greeted and were given an order of bruschetta on the house. My pregnant wife and I were extremely pleased with their service, great food, and ambience. We will come back here for food next time we are in SF for sure and with our son.

author: Rex N.
text: Mona Lisa, Mona Lisa ... Mona Lisa. Mona Lisa restaurant It's that easy to Remember. If you are looking for some great authentic Italian food in North Beach or in the city of San Francisco or if your visiting the City for the first time with friends, a family vacation or just looking for a warm tasty dish I highly recommend this great Italian restaurant. With it's great location on Columbus St. it's any easy find and even easier if you spot the owner's very unique 1965 Fiat parked outside. Once inside the restaurant you'll notice it's warm and at home Italian flair. The menu has a great selection of dishes in all categories meat, seafood, poultry and also caters with a huge selection of vegetarian dishes. The prices are quite good too! There is nothing worse than paying for a meal and leaving unsatisfied. Here at Mona Lisa each dish is a very generous serving with some left over to take home if you wish and I did I mention the bread service that will pair well with the bottles of Balsamic and virgin olive oil featured at each table. My wife Kim and I stumbled upon this restaurant after being let down by the food quality, portion size and service from several other Italian restaurants in North Beach, but NOT here at Mona Lisa, it has been our favorite place to eat ever since and we look forward to each dinning experience. After each visit we are left with a great memory of dining there and shouldn't that be what dinning is about as well. Kim's favorite is the Fettuccine ai Gamberoni (Fettuccine in Alfredo sauce with prawns) DELICIOUS! Personally for me when my meat lover's hunger takes over I enjoy Rigatoni alla Borrelli (Rigatoni in a ground pork, beef, and tomato meat sauce with spicy sausage and eggplant) now doesn't that sound good! Lately my favorite dish has been Involtini di Melanzane con Ricotta (rolled eggplant baked with ricotta cheese served with a side of roasted potatoes and sauté spinach) a very affordable dish. Eventually you want to try everything on the menu from appetizers to deserts. So like the song  Mona Lisa, Mona Lisa ...Mona Lisa, you will be singing this song and remembering what a great meal and dining experience you had at San Francisco's own Mona Lisa restaurant. Buon Appetito!

author: E H.
text: Mona Lisa is one of the best restaurants I've been to in years. I have been a couple times and always good service and great food. It does get busy so I'd make a reservation. My last order I got to go since I didn't feel like taking a table for just me. It was still delish and great portions of bread and food for me. I recommend this place highly.

author: Ambika S.
text: Mona Lisa was a great experience! Many options for gluten free dishes/pastas- I had the Gluten Free Kale and Mozzarella Ravioli, and it was delicious! We had good service as well- attentive wait staff. And the owner is very friendly and welcoming. If I lived the area, this would be one of my go-to places!

author: Luis C.
text:
Nice Italian restaurant in Little Italy that had a nice quiet atmosphere. We came on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't crazy packed or busy. The service was decent and the food was good. 
I had the Fettucine Leonardo and thought it was rich in flavor. The sauce was just right. 
 I had a hard time picking what to eat because the menu was FULL of options.
 I recommend the restaurant and hope to return soon

author: Arnel D.
text:
Surprisingly good restaraunt. 

It's hard to choose a place when you're stuck between Chinatown and Italian-town in San Francisco. Luckily my wife chose the spot and we  were glad we stopped here.

The owner was very welcoming and their staff were great.

The food was delicious and the restaurant had cool decor. 

This place has been here a long time and will be for many years to come. 

I'd visit again when in the area.

It is a busy place and tables are very close to each other so don't plan on having an intimate dinner.

author: Helana B.
text: This place was amazing! I had the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. Great portion sizes. The chicken parmigiana was also phenomenal. The sauce is the best! Definitely would visit this place again!

author: Susan C.
text: Giovanni, our server, was one of the best parts of the meal. He was very knowledgeable and let me try a few sips of different wines to pick the perfect one for dinner after asking what I liked and didn't like. The menu is extensive and the only problem I had was choosing between items. We started with garlic cheese bread made with fresh garlic. The smell had my my husband closing his eyes, inhaling and smiling. I ordered the classic lasagna and it had an excellent mix of meat to cheese to noodles mix served piping hot and tasting very fresh. I gave part of it to my husband as it was a huge serving and I wanted to save room for dessert. We shared a raspberry panna cotta that was delicious. We finished with a small glass of excellent port and I'm looking foreword to coming back

author: Nathan Anthony R.
text: I love this restaurant! I've been here a few times, and have always had a great experience! The last time I was here was with my wife a few months ago, so it has been a while, but we had a very nice experience (Again). We like to dress nice for our dinner outings, I wore a nice blazer with a tie. We could tell immediately that we were being taken care of and made to feel at home at the restaurant! A man who I believe was the owner, gave us each champagne to drink while we waited to be seated. There was a bit of a wait time, but with the complimentary champagne we didn't mind! We were given the best seat in the house! Right by the window facing the street! When we were walking out after enjoying our delicious meal, the owner stopped what he was doing and chatted with us and again made us feel very welcome. Highly recommended!

author: Lori D.
text: Oh my goodness!! Amazing Italian food! We had the bruschetta - I just wanted to try the spaghetti Bolognese and it was spectacular. Of course it's probably hard to mess up spaghetti, but it was delicious!!

author: John S.
text: Food and atmosphere were superb!  Antonio our waiter was very attentive and awesome.  Authentic bolognese sauce and chicken Marsala was to die for. The bruschetta and pizza were home runs as well.

author: Dallas S.
text: A small piece of Italy and exquisite meals, lunch or dinner, you won't be disappointed! From the appetizers  to the pizzas with rustic crust to the entrees you will be left with having to make choices, excellent list of wines as well. Amazing food, well worth the visit!

author: Francesco G.
text:
I just had a Pinsa (pizza) with broccoli and sausage. Very light and good food. The service is so festive and authentic. The owner, Maurizio, is very friendly and kind. He brought for free some antipasti (bruschetta, prosciutto and cheese). Top. 
He was always checking if everything was ok. 
Very good prices and good quality food. 
I totally recommend this place and I can't wait to bring my family here for dinner.

author: Art C.
text: Wow, the service was like being at home in Italy with family. Giovanni had several great suggestions- all good. This is a repeat. I had penne pasta, the wife had lasagna. Both were great. This is a legit Italian restaurant- sauce made from real tomato's, by hand, with love. Fresh cheeses - awesome garlic. Almost makes me want to live close by (unfortunately I live a long plane trip away). Explore this place, the menu, the people - Italy in SF!

author: Shaun G.
text: This is the best Italian food I've ever had.  Everything was phenomenal, right down to the tiramisu.  Staff was exceptional on every visit.  A must stop in San Francisco!!!!

author: Juliana N.
text: I loved this place. The food was great the wait service amazing. Fresh parm, oil & vinager at the table. The waiter seemed to be speaking italian to the manager and such love how they try to make it authentic. The best was they still cared about what I thought I called one week later because I couldn't stop thinking about the wine (chianti) and they told me which one to get and I have to say being from far away I loved that they wanted to make sure I had good thoughts. Spreading the love

author: Maria M.
text: My boyfriend and I found this place on yelp. I made a reservation and upon arriving the owner greeted me by my name. We sat in a corner table our waiter was very attentive and even suggested some of his favorite dishes. I went with the lasagna and a glass of moscato. It was a good night.

author: Amanda J.
text: Simply amazing. the service was fast and our waiter was super friendly. anf the food... oh the food was incredible will certainly be returning again soon.

author: Lisa E.
text:
Very disappointing now. This was my families go to Italian restaurant in North Beach for 25 years. The inside was cozy and felt very authentically Italian. Now the owner has installed TV screens everywhere which makes you feel like you're in a sports bar, they've put military and law enforcement hats on the busts of all his sculptures and the place is full of pictures of movie stars headshots which is unclear as to why.... So confusing what image they're going for in there now.

In the past the servers offered to grate Parmesan cheese over your dish. Yesterday a bowl of pre-grated Parmesan cheese was just placed on the table like it came out of the jar.

The chocolate profiteroles used to be amazing and now they're just OK. We won't be back. Disappointing.

author: Karen T.
text: Best Italian Ever!  What an Amazing family  and the food was Like Momma!  Marinara was Perfect  My first to San Francisco now with love from this family! You will fall in love the Italian way  Thank you  Mauricio ! Stefan and I appreciate you !

author: Emma H.
text: While traveling to San Francisco from Washington, this was my first time in the city. And I fell in love with the staff! You can tell the owner takes pride in his restaurant. While dining my husband and I were treated like royalty! Not to mention the food was the BEST Italian I've ever had! If I could give more stars I would!

author: Anne S.
text: The best Italian  food you can imagine! Good sized portions. Incredible tasting. Cream sauce was to die for. Chicken Piccata was delicious.. but that cream sauce...5 stars!

author: Calvin M.
text: Really enjoyed eating here, the food tasted really good. Location is good, got to sit by the window which was also very nice.

author: T O M.
text:
Unfortunately, this is definitely one of the worst restaurant I've ever been in SF. 
Atmosphere is old, menu is boring, and dishes are too salty. And from my experience, I can tell you that this place, doesn't serve an authentic Italian food. If you are in SF, you can definetely find a better restaurant.

author: Deana H.
text: We ended a food walking tour here. We had a great little table on the street and were served a pizza along with a glass of wine. The place was so fun, but the best part was Maurizo who kept coming out to check on us. Come to find out he was the 4 generation family member of this place. How awesome is that! These are the type of places that we need to patron and preserve from big money corporations taking over. Our tour ended and our tour guide left us, we continued to stay for another bottle of wine and ended with a cannoli. However, it was Maurizo who made the experience the best.

author: Jeanine T.
text: Went in to simply ask how long the wait was. Some man who thinks he's better than everyone else said "I don't know" and then made rude remarks. Pointed me outside and said "I'm on Italian time". Bud, that's how you don't get business. Get some better manners to potential customers. Thanks.

author: LD W.
text:
Right on the main drag I've passed this place before and wondered if they catered to the tourist crowd.  Heck, even if they do (and I was a tourist by the way), they kicked ass!  

Had a great waiter, thick Italian accent, wonderful pastas and calamari.  And wine.  And did I mention the pasta?  I had gnocci in an amazing blue cheese cream sauce.  

I seriously plan to return next time I'm in San Francisco!

author: Alysha M.
text:
This place is no joke!

Wow. The fettuccine Leonardo is to die for. 

Extremely authentic Italian- as in, everyone who works here speaks fluent Italian. It's awesome.

author: Jamye A.
text: Really awful service. I had reservations for valentines day. They sat us on a table that was in the middle of the whole restaurant. I had to look around and ask to sit somewhere cozier. Restaurants should always prioritize reservations with the best sitting. They brought us water and just put it on the table expecting us to pour it. what kind of service is that? Food was mediocre. I can make a tastier pasta at home. The only thing that brought me here is the whole Mona Lisa theme. But I will never come back and I do not recommend this place.

author: Claudio M.
text: This restaurant is always great.  The food is very authentic and delicious.  The service is second-to-none.  The owner makes his rounds saying hello to people.  Highly recommended.

author: GS S.
text:
Walking around North Beach, looking for a nice place to eat and we found this amazing restaurant with such a warm atmosphere. Mario and Giovanni made our evening. They were super friendly yet very professional, delicious wine and conscious eats. If you are red wine lover do not pass by THE Brunello. Absolutely Delicious! The pasta is definitely the star of the show. Every dish was outstanding and cooked al dente to perfection! Also arrived on our table at the right temperature. The icing on the cake was that, while waiting for our bill to arrive, a server brought little surprise dessert wino. 
Will definitely come back and I'm not just saying that because the music was fire, mostly because the servers were so cute and friendly. Thank you Giovanni, Thank you Mario.               *5 STAR*


Nana Sarkisian

author: Melody D.
text: Excellent food and great service! We thoroughly enjoyed our meal! We highly recommend this place!

author: Beth S.
text: Everything we ate was amazing! We had margarita pizza, spaghetti with meatballs, lasagna,  rigatoni aldon smith. We can't say one was better than the other, they were all uniquely delish!

author: Paul D.
text: Another beautiful night at Our favorite restaurant in San Francisco  Moriceo and the staff is excellent s the food is always amazing!!!!!!

author: Judith B.
text: We visited this place with our daughter and her husband on our last day in San Francisco. I felt in love with the food! I had the Ravioli Di Porcini, finger licking. My husband and son in law had risotto. One had Risotto Di Porcini and the other chicken Risotto. I am looking forward to my next visit to the

author: Kelsy S.
text: We ordered food to go based off a recommendation from someone who had eaten there the night before. Can I say Surpurb!!! Both me and my friend ordered the spaghetti bolognese and meatballs with sausage. They included a good amount of bread with the meal however, I wish there was a way to include the olive oil when ordering for delivery.

author: Alex B.
text:
Prons: very cozy restaurant with cool interior. 
Cons: However food did not meet my and my wife's expectation. 

Insalata di Spinaci was great, big portion and yummy but a bit too lemony. 

Chicken Marsala was a bit too bitter. Chicken itself was good but could be a bit softer. 

Risotto was ok but rice slightly undercooked. 
Seems like both dishes lacked salt (maybe good, because salt can always be added) but there was no twist or kick or something exciting about them. 

The red Cabernet Sauvignon ordered by glass was not enjoyable, tasted cheap. 

My wife liked Tiramisu, I thought it was OK.

Verdict: maybe we ordered wrong dishes at the place. It was ok but certainly not the experience that would want me to come back and have more.

author: Bader M.
text: Best Italian food ever ... the restaurant achieves the highest level of Italian authenticity ... I go to eat there everyday and I'm happy to spend my money there ... I highly recommend this place , my favorite Italian restaurant in North America

author: Amy M.
text: We pretty much found all our food from Yelp reviews. This place did NOT disappoint! We came for an early dinner on a weekday and there was no wait. we loved how authentic the restaurant felt (my husband is Italian and frequents Italy) The owner was there and spotted to say hi. Everyone was speaking Italian so it felt very authentic and was fun to hear. The food was great but very $$$ but we didn't care as 1) we were in San Francisco and everything is expensive and 2) because the experience was so amazing!

author: Pieter T.
text: Had a wonderful dinner and all the staff were amazing. I had the spaghetti all ametriciana which had the best sauce I have ever had   My wife ordered the lasagna which was exceptional and a very large portion.  I will be having her leftover lasagna for my lunch tomorrow.  The atmosphere is old word Italy and makes you feel comfortable.  Would highly recommend to everyone

author: Tim O.
text: This is by far my favorite restaurant in SF. Their chicken parm and chicken Marsala are amazing and they have a great selection of wine and beer. Authentic Italian food and a great place to go with a group of friends or family. If you save some room after the meal, go for the Tiramisu!

author: Nilufar F.
text: I honestly do not understand how this restaurant has 4 stars rating! If you end up here, Do Not order carbonara! Mine smelled so bad and tasted even worse! I'm usually shy to send the food back...but I did today! they switched my food for a fettuccine alfredo that tested like water... How could you mess that up? The only star given is for their service, at least they were nice enough to switch my food.

author: Anthony C.
text: Great food and great service.  They really take care of you here.  This was our 2nd time here and we made sure that we came back.  We found this gem by accident back in September and we brought our family back w us.  So good, a must !!!

author: Adam L.
text:
When they tell you 15 minutes they mean an hour and a half...
If you are Italian you will wait less
Go to stinky rose
Way better

author: Seth F.
text: Small place with great Italian staff.  We got pizza, lobster ravioli, and pasta.  The sauce was amazing, the pizza was tasty, and my kids loved the mozzarella cheese salad.  We would definitely go back.

author: Yesenia C.
text: Very good restaurant! I suggest you make a reservation because they can get busy. The service was super fast and nice! Will definitely be going again

author: Taylor M.
text: I absolutely loved the Penne with Vodka Sauce here! The vodka sauce was amazing and our waiter Manuel was so friendly and welcoming! Highly recommended! I'll be coming back next time I'm in the city

author: Mark-Anthony B.
text: It was around 8:30pm when we came. The layout was nice. I was unimpressed by our server. I literally watched him leave the restaurant to chill outside and drink wine. It was hard asking for anything, only had one cup of water the entire night, literally. The food was okay, you can't rush perfect but damn it took us so long to get our food (not even busy) and wasn't too great. The dining experience here is very weak and not consistent throughout the night. Wouldn't recommend, especially for a birthday.

author: Jackie Z.
text:
Yesterday a few of us friends felt like enjoying a lovely Italian meal. I recommended Mona Lisa Restaurant, as I have had several yummy experiences at this restaurant before. Before entering my friends and I were scanning the menu located outside of the restaurant. The owner of the restaurant asked how many in our party, then proceeded to offer an appetizer on the house. 

We were seated, ordered beverages, our appetizer (which was "on the house") and lastly ordered our entrees. Our waiter was friendly and fast, which was perfect since we were starving! 

ALL of our food was perfect and delicious. No complaints there at all. On the contrary, the ingredients were fresh and rich. 

My issue here was the lack of communication in regard to our appetizer on the house. It was a good 20 min seated, when we ordered our drinks and appetizer. Once our ordered appetizer came out, our server brought an ADDITIONAL plate of bruschetta and said the owner "also sent you this". When we got the bill, the bruschetta was complimentary only. We were never asked if that's what we wanted as our complimentary appetizer. To me this smelled like tourist bait and I was extremely disappointed, especially when I was the one to bring my three friends to this restaurant. 

I asked our server and he repeated to me that the bruschetta was the complimentary dish only. Management, please make sure that if an offer will be made to a customer, that the Terms are crystal clear. I took responsibility for paying our non-complimentary appetizer as I didn't want to have a petty argument over an appetizer.

author: Sarmad R.
text:
Delicious Italian food, recommended for lunch and dinner,
We got the pasta with eggplant and it was one of the best i tried

author: Corey K.
text: Fun place!  We walked up at dinner time and they were able to seat us right away. I ordered the Penne al Forno alla Calabrese and it was delicious!  Great service as well.  Highly recommend!

author: Stephanie G.
text: This location is easy to find and make reservations at too. The space is relatively small and cramped but so are most places in San Francisco. The menu is great and full of options for vegetarians. I wish there were a few more options with pasta and veggies. It was mostly just pasta and sauce on the veggie menu. The staff was all great and the prices are really reasonable. I tried both the house salad and the spinach salad and the house salad is the way to go. I will definitely be back to Mona Lisa next time I'm in San Francisco.

author: Roshi R.
text: We were so surprised eating the first bite of our pasta after looking up the reviews in Yelp. It was super greasy and tasted almost pungently. We mentioned that the food is extremely bad but the owner came to our table and told us that we are gonna charge you so we are better off ordering something else. The second pasta was as bad and greasy. I don't recommend this place at all.

author: Nicole M.
text: Fantastic experience! The Burrata Fresca is amazing & you can't order a bad pasta dish here. The owner is a gracious host & wait staff are very attentive. Not a bad date night at all.

author: John D.
text: We had a great time there. Food was great, the service was friendly and helpful, and it didn't hurt that the owner was from the same part of Italy as my family.

author: Angela S.
text: Great place for yummy Italian food and wine in our favorite San Fransisco neighborhood. The antipasto for two is incredible; the service and ambiance are warm and homey.

author: Efrat K.
text:
Amazing food! Great service! A real italian experience. Yummy!
Not much to say the carpaccio was amazing! The tiramisu was one of the best ive had.

author: Mony S.
text:
Pretty good italian food. We got the chick parm and penne with pink sauce as the main course and garlic in white wine with parm for the appetizer. The owner is absolutely adorable, but the service is alright and the food doesn't deserve the price (24$ for a chick parm!). Wouldn't come again, but not angry at the experience. 
-two college kiddos

author: Kieran O.
text: So much on the walls to look at.  Recommended by a cousin of mine and it did not disappoint.  Delish Italian food with nice wait staff.  We went in July and would definitely go back on our next visit.

author: Camellia M.
text: This restaurant was absolutely amazing. The service was perfect (especially Antonio C.) and the restaurant itself was absolutely beautiful. The food was delicious and the owner and waitstaff were very welcoming. Many many options for appetizers, entrees, and desserts. One of the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco.

author: Lety L.
text: Delicious authentic Italian food!! And awesome service! Today I tried Diavola Pizza, Pasta Pomodoro and Tiramisu... a must in the North Beach!

author: Natasha S.
text: Best service I've had in SF. Order the chicken Parmesan and pasta with Alfredo sauce! Best I've had. Thank you to all that made my birthday dinner special

author: Danielle B.
text: So glad we stumbled across this gem in the city! They took our party of 5 late Christmas Eve. Food was awesome, service was excellent, will definitely be back! Seafood risotto- on point!

author: Angela Q.
text: Went here for my best friend's birthday. Intimate and eccentric environment. Excellent service, food and wine. I had the seafood spaghetti and she had the chicken parmesan. Delicious. We even had a surprise from one of the guests, an opera singer singing happy birthday.

author: Carlos A.
text: I've been here a couple of times and I always leave content. The food is great and so are the wine options. The service is exquisite and the restaurant is definitely something you have to experience firsthand. Will definitely be back again!

author: Karla M.
text: My husband and I came for our One year anniversary to this wonderful place, Im seriously so glad we came to experience yummy food and wine in this restaurant, im so sad i didnt get to take any more pictures of the food; i was too excited enjoying the moment (: .Our waitter lucca was also very attentive and nice. I will defenetely recomment this place to my friends and family . Thank u so much for giving us such a great experience!

author: Kathy D.
text:
Awesome restaurant.... food,staff,service,ambiance... I have now spent two birthdays there and love it!! Little Mona Lisa car out front makes a great photo op!
I highly recommend Mona Lisa restaurant!

author: Janeice S.
text: Mauricio was fantastic. So pleased with the service and the food. Be sure to stop in when you're in the city.

author: Trini H.
text: Food was 5 star, service was 1!  The food was excellent. Everything was fresh, authentic Italian food. Unfortunately, our waiter could care less about taking care of our large party (10). He made a couple rude comments and we had to ask for more wine. Then we get the bill and of course due to being a large party, he added his own tip!  He didn't deserve the 20% he gave himself.  There are too many wonderful Italian restaurants to ever go back here.

author: Mark A.
text: Asparagus ravioli's were very good.   I've been here twice and both times the service was exceptional.   Would come back again and again.

author: patti b.
text: Can't give a review on the food, server was beyond rude, walked out and he threw a temper tantrum yelling at us! This was after sitting at the table for an hour with no water or service. Server was busy talking with other employees. He told us too get out! We were visiting for a week, this incident was traumatizing! I'm still upset, and the response from the manager didn't seem genuine! Very upsetting on our vacation!

author: Lance A.
text: First - we live here is SF, and originally from NJ - we know and love Italian. Mona Lisa is our favorite in North Beach - it's our weekly Sunday dinner spot. Across the entire menu the food is excellent - Cacai de Pepe, meatballs, arancini, manicotti, fettuccini Pescatore, and penne San Francisco are our favorites - but honestly everything we try becomes a favorite.  Service is great - they'll always find you a table and treat you like a VIP.  The Italian wine list is fairly priced as restaurants go, but the House wines are fine.

author: Scott F.
text: I tried this restaurant a while back. Hopefully they have a new chef & staff. I ordered a fusilli dish with marinara-type sauce. As I dug in, I noticed there was an actual broken-off corkscrew (yes, a metal corkscrew) in the pasta. I sent it back, but the waiter was pretty blas`e about it. He asked if I wanted something else, & I said no. Then when he brought the check, the pasta charge had not been removed. He was lucky I didn't call the Health Dept. I didn't have my phone or I'd have taken a photo. This was a few years back, so hopefully they've changed hands. Let's hope so.

author: Anita C.
text: Great place overall. I loved the unique decor. We made reservations and were seated right away. Our waiter was very nice and gave us great meal recommendations. Food was good!

author: Jim C.
text: Atmosphere was great, the service attentive, huge menu.  We ordered two pizzas for two people and that was way too much food.  I found the pizza to be a bit "soupy" and the sauce too salty.  I'll probably try something different on the menu next time.

author: Victoria A.
text: The appetizer platter is dangerous... couldn't finish my pizza afterwards!! Beautiful restaurant, amazing service and incredible food that will leave you comatose lol

author: pamela w.
text: This was a fabulous dinner - hubby and I split the huge seafood plate with linguine and split the spinach salad.  Had a great bottle of montepulciano with it.  We are in town for a conference but have traveled the world and many times in Italy. This is the real deal and our service was spectaculAr!

author: Sherille S.
text:
Been to this place several times. The host is always friendly and engaging. The wait staff can be a little busy at times, but they always refill the water. It can be a little hard at times to track down the waiter for the bill when it gets busy. I can also see why some people complain about the service since the waiters can be abrupt at times. 

As for the food, good amount of variety. Huge portions. I do have to mention some inconsistencies.  The first time I came, I ordered the squid ink pasta with calamari, but for some reason it didn't come with the calamari,  so I had to mention this to the waiter and they fixed it. It was great once they got it right. Second time I ate there I ordered the frutti di mare and it came with fish and was missing some items listed in the description. I had to mention this again, so they added the missing seafood, but the fish was left in it so it added a weird flavor and I didn't care for it. The last time I ordered the rigatoni with spicy sausage, meat sauce, and eggplant. The order was right this time, but it was very oily. 

Worth a try, just make sure your dish comes out as described in the menu.

author: Bethany H.
text: I love this place! The food is always super tasty and fresh and the service is on point! Everyone is super friendly. Definitely my favorite hang out restaurant in North Beach!

author: Gigi G.
text:
This place is so romantic and cozy!
I ordered the spinach salad. Walnuts' oily flavor is perfect with sweet and fresh spinach. Cheese is not too heavy and sour.
For the appetizer, definitely try bruschetta! Tomatoes with crispy bread, full of juice!
You can't miss the pasta, too! Just choose whatever you want! They have the best sauces and soft, chewy pasta! 
When the lights were turned on, it looked like an old Italian movie during Renaissance. Yellow, warm lights shined on the old pictures and paintings. You were surrounded by the shades of vintage and smiled, just like Mona Lisa.

author: Cathy L.
text:
The perfect Italian experience!! Great food,  atmosphere, and hospitality!  Love love the risotto piscatory!!   Great gluten free choices!!! 

Mauricio and staff the best

author: amanda c.
text:
The food looked good.  But I didn't stay long enough to try it.  The service was really, really rude.  To the point that after we put in our order, I cancelled it and left.  

After getting conned into entering by a nice man who was sitting outside, we sat and waited.  And waited.  And then waited some more.  When our server finally came to our table, he acted like he was doing us a favor.  When the kid at the table next to us started banging on her table and yelling, I knew it was time to go.

We went across the street to Il Casaro.  A much better experience!

author: David T.
text:
Only had delivery, but I was pleasantly surprised. The food was good.
I only got to try a couple of things, but I'll be back.

author: Gene D.
text:
I had to take off a star due to the service received the evening we dined there.  More on that later.

The decor is your classic North Beach fare.  It was stuffed full of decorations, etc.  Some would call it gaudy while others would call it classic/typical of the area.  i would agree with the later.

The food had its share of hits and misses.  My Chicken Saltimbocca was surprisingly good.  It was simply prepared with roasted potatoes and sauteed spinach.  The chicken was moist while the prosciutto and sage offered delicious contrasts to one another.  The sauce/juice that was present had a good flavor profile to it.  The spaghetti Carbonara was so-so.  It was not a good as other places we had been too.  We couldn't pick out the reason but only knew so by the taste.

Roberto (?) was rude and not very attentive to us.  When he first came over to take our drink orders, everything seemed fine.  After that, things changed for some reason.  The wait to take our orders was extremely long.  In fact, several tables around us, where people arrived after us, had already ordered.  We tried to get his attention several times to no avail.  The menus were closed so that should have been a clue to him to come over.  It took several requests to just get the balsamic vinegar for our bread.  Then, after only having it for a few minutes, he came by and took the vinegar and olive oil, only to give it to a couple at an adjacent table.  Needless to say, both parties were shocked at that move.  The couple was kind enough to give them back to us after they had poured some for themselves.  

We might come back some time, as long as we do not have him again...

author: Joe M.
text: If you want the real deal pizza and Italian flair this is your spot.   Being from Italy this is the closest thing to home you can get for true Italian pizza. They use premium imported Italian ingredients.  The crust is made with double zero flour and is extremely light and crispy.  Guarantee you will enjoy it

author: Rachel K.
text: Let me tell you something. The NERVE of these sub par rude servers is BEYOND my comprehension. I can't even begin to express my rage because there are no words. We came here with family for a night out and all put in when the bill came. The server- who had to be asked to refill my glass and was nowhere to be seen most of the evening- decided that he is deserving of a 5 star tip and came BACK TO THE TABLE to ask "if service was ok" because he only go x amount of dollars. FIRST OF ALL how DARE you come to whole table and try to shame us. You can politely pull someone aside if you really think that there was an "issue". What in the flip is this?!? WHO DOES THAT!!!!! Who!!!!!!?!?? I've read some other reviews with the same issue and it seems like the manager "addresses" the problem but it continues to happen- so maybe GET RID OF YOUR SERVERS!!!!! I plan on showing back up and asking for a FULL REFUND. who the hell do they think they are? The food was sub par at best- and when you add that level of service then this hole should just go out of business. I've been to several upscale restaurants - this isn't one of them. And maybe they didn't get the memo but a tip is EARNED, if it isn't then just add it to my bill and don't leave me to decide what I want to give. This experience ruined the rest of our night and put a sour taste in our mouth for the rest of the trip. Glad this restaurant strives to embarrass their patrons and nothing is done about it. This isn't the last they've heard from me I'll tell you that.

author: Lori M.
text:
My daughter was visiting San Francisco with her boyfriend, so I wanted to send them a gift card for her favorite restaurant, Mona Lisa. Unfortunately as they went to use it, their waiter/waitress informed them it had to be printed. It does not state this on the site when you go to purchase. They're supposed to have a Merchant App, but they do not. This seemed like an easy way to buy them dinner, but that was a fail. I looked at the site who sells the cards and it says the retailer just scans it. Very disappointing, especially since we don't even live there anymore. Am I out the money? Beware-DO NOT buy online Gift Cards for this restaurant! Waiting on my refund from Egiftify. Will update my review once this has been resolved.

UPDATE:

I contacted Egiftify land after they communicated with Mona Lisa and myself, I have been refunded. I personally received a phone call from the manager at Mona Lisa and they apologized. I'm sure after educating their wait staff, there will no longer be issues with redeeming E-gifts.

author: Jamil L.
text: The restroom is amazing: delicious Italian food,good decor and welcoming team. I'll definitely come back!

author: Shanette F.
text: Food was good, I have had more flavorful Italian food. The waiter had a bad attitude, he was rude. The food was brought out quick, they are open late.

author: Jasmine H.
text:
I was walking down the street with my friends trying to find an Italian Restaurant with a lot of options and this place did not disappoint. 
The owner quickly came up to us and was super sweet so we decided to give this place a try! The decor was homey and very inviting with picture frames and busts everywhere. We decided to try the penne salsa rosa and lasagna vegetale. Overall the food was just okay. The penne pasta barely had any sauce and lacked taste. The lasagna lacked taste as well except for the spinach taste. I just wish it had more of a ricotta flavor I was looking for.
Other than that, the service was amazing as the server was attentive and very nice. The owner gave us a free appetizer of bruschetta which wasn't bad at all. 

I don't know if I would come back but the only reason I would come back would be for the decor and the amazing people who run the place!

author: Jessica S.
text: Great authentic Italian restaurant. Came here for a friend's birthday party. We sampled a bunch of appetizers, the pasta trio, and I had a salmon entree. It was fantastic. Wish I could have kept eating but I was stuffed. Def would come back again.

author: Erin M.
text: I absolutely love this restaurant especially for date night. The staff is so accommodating and makes you feel like family. I recommend to anyone looking for a quick bite or a fancy date

author: Nick S.
text: Very rude maitre d accused us of being late and had already given our table away only 5 mins after our reservation time. Worked out pretty well as the Italian across the street was superb!

author: Alex O.
text:
We here looking for good food with high expectations, while the food was great the service totally ruined the experience.

We were seated immediately into the small and busy restaurant and proceeded to wait 15 minutes before even being noticed to receive water, bread or a greeting. We flagged another waitress for some service, and while she helped us, our waiter was still nowhere to be found. 

Finally our waiter came to our table and without a greeting, asked in a very unfriendly way what we wanted to eat. 45 minutes later we received our food and our waiter never came back. 

All in all, a dinner that should have lasted an hour or so lasted nearly 2 due to the negligence of our waiter, and what a shame because the food was great. (Chicken Parm-- Penne Ala Vodka) 

If you're okay with going to a very busy place and waiting a long time for food and service, the food may be worth it to you, but for us, we won't be coming back.

author: Ahir C.
text: Terrible service, and the food wasn't good. Their pizza is served without any sauce, nobody told us, and when we questioned why the server lost his temper and said that "it's the way is in Italy", we went in Italy our last vacation and it's DEFINITELY NOT like that. The food was served cold, and it was an horrible experience.

author: Chris L.
text: Great service! Great with my kids! Would go back in a second! Very cool space, too - eclectic and intimate.

author: Ivan R.
text: No taste, bad service. Overall worse Italian restaurant I've been too and I thought Olive Garden was bad.

author: Brandon W.
text: (I had to give a start but if I could I wouldn't I didn't even get to eat my food!)The head manager wearing a black chiefs coat was rude from the time we walked in to the time we left. We were seated at a table for four but there was only two of us. A larger group came and they needed the table which was fine. But the waiter shoved our plates over dropping our sliver-ware and napkins on the floor. When I stopped the waiter to tell him it's fine to take the table but the way he was doing it was rude; he said "I have a larger party coming oh well"! I got up to speak to the manager in black coat, and he wasn't any better. He stated "sorry he don't speak good English so it's ok"! I will never come back to this restaurant nor recommend it to anyone but instead cont. to eat at The stink'n rose or calzone they give better service and respect their guest! I left and went next door to TSR where they always kind and service is impeccable.

author: Orlando L.
text: Was looking forward to eating here, was recommended by a local.. got the Mona Lisa pizza... when it came out it was a sloppy mess, soggy, all of the ingredients sliding off... it was mush.. so sad

author: Stephanie B.
text: We ordered the calamari and bruschetta after our hike. The owner personally seated us, he is very personable. We sat outside under some heaters and enjoyed the view. Prices are affordable and they got us seated within 10 minutes. If you're looking for an authentic Italian restaurant this is it. He even got us some wine on the house. Mauricio is so sweet and I would definitely come back.

author: Michelle P.
text:
We came in for a super late lunch/early dinner on a Saturday. My boyfriend ordered the chicken parm and I ordered the chicken Marsala. They serve you bread while you wait, but it was cold and didn't taste freshly made. 

We waited a decent while for the food andour waiter had left the restaurant to move a car, so when the food was ready it just sat there on the bar. Finally another server noticed and brought it to us. 

The flavors of the food were great. The Marsala sauce was delicious; however, my chicken didn't seem fully cooked and it grossed me out. I had to stop eating the chicken and just focused on the sides.

author: Arielle C.
text:
If you are in the city and in the mood for Italian food, then look no further; Mona Lisa's got you covered. Besides the cutest ambiance (Instagram worthy), all the pastas on the menu are to die for. Creamy, saucy, tasty, and dare I say, addicting!!? 

Also, the owner Mauricio is always there to greet you as if you were the oldest of friends.

author: Juanita I.
text:
