After being lured in by the friendly owner while we were perusing the menu on the sidewalk late one Friday night our experience quickly went downhill. 

We were seated at the teeniest table next to the kitchen, right where the servers rounded the corner. They kept bumping my husbands chair and apologizing.

I don't know if not ordering drinks or appetizers affected our service in any way but it was subpar at best. We had had a very late lunch and weren't ravenously hungry. 

We got some crusty bread to munch on as we preceded to wait forever on our food. Our table was also missing the balsamic vinegar that was on other tables and our server never came around so we could ask for it.

After waiting a good hour plus on our food it finally arrived. 

My husband ordered Spaghetti Carbonara and while good it just can't top the decadence of the one we had years ago in Rome.

I had been craving a Margarita Pizza so that was what I had ordered and it was delicious!

During our time waiting we had plenty of chances to observe those around us and it was quite interesting! The table next to us got the five star treatment as the gentleman knew the owner. Their complimentary three tiered hor dourve tray looked heavenly! The strangest part was when the lady disappeared into the bathroom and a couple of minutes later the gentleman slipped in too. Oh dear! Only for both of them to emerge minutes later. 

So, to recap. The food was good but the service lackluster. I'd skip the Mona Lisa.

author: Ema J.
text:
Authentic Italian, right down to the very long wait times. 

Pros: food was good, staff were friendly and fluent in Italian (with accents), food was good, atmosphere and decor were fantastic

Cons: service was excruciatingly slow (we were expecting this based on other reviews and it still exceeded our expectations!! We were there at 2 pm and there were only 4 other tables occupied). The only service I've ever had that was slower than this was in Italy - no joke - so maybe it's slow on purpose (which is why I gave them 4 stars. With American speeds it would be 5 and if I thought it wasn't slow on purpose then it would be 3 stars).

author: Shawn B.
text: Been in the area since 1985 n stopped for a late lunch on Saturday around 3:00 pm - place was empty with maybe 3 other couples in the front - it was cold n we asked to be seated in the back since doors n windows were open n raining outside - ordered a spaghetti bolognese n chicken marsala - everyone knows that spaghetti sauce is supposed to stick to the spaghetti - I should've walked out when my dish had a ring of soupy watery sauce all around it - too hungry n ate it n will never be back - seemed one is also shunned upon for not ordering drinks -

author: Lynn F.
text: Great Italian food in San Francisco.  Anytime I'm in the city, I take time to have dinner.  Make sure to have a reservation or there may be a wait as it's a very popular place.  Enjoy!

author: Meredith J.
text: The service was outstanding.  Nicola treated my table like it was the only table in the packed restaurant.  It is because of his service that we will be coming back!

author: Colton T.
text: This has to be the best Italian restaurant, no doubt. Great service from not only the server but the manager, Mauricio as well. I ordered Chicken San Francisco, like a tourist, and it was so good. Had to wait 15 minutes but it was 100% worth the wait.

author: William D.
text: My favorite Italian restaurant in the city. The food is wonderful, the staff impeccable and super friendly. Always greeted with a smile and a thank you when leaving!!! I highly recommend!!!

author: Kayla M.
text: this is my favorite italian restaurant ever it's literally the best food i've ever had and the bread that they bring out before the main course is UNMATCHED. the restaurant atmosphere makes it feel like i'm actually in italy which is exactly where everyone wants to be. if you're looking for the best italian food EVER i suggest you go to mona lisa. why go to italy to go get some okay pasta when you can get THE BEST pasta right here in the city sis!!!

author: Annalee H.
text: So delicious! Authentic Italian family and environment. Our waiter was wonderful and we Loved our dinner. We will be back again soon!

author: Daniel S.
text:
I was introduced to this place by my girlfriend and her family who have been coming for ten plus years now.

Aside how great all the sauces, delicious pastas and wines are; the service is one of a kind. The severs make you feel as if you are their top priority despite how busy they may be.

Tip: Come in with a big appetite because you might not finish the portions.

author: Jen P.
text: This place was average. I feel I could have recreated all of our dishes on my own. Great service and very friendly

author: Sabrina O.
text: loved the interior of the restaurant very italian! the food was really good and the service was good the staff all seems very italian

author: Giulia D.
text:
This is my favorite Italian restaurant of all time.

Maurizio is fantastic, he makes you feel always welcome and he is always ready to make you smile with his jokes.

The food is really good quality (please give a try to Penne al Forno alla Calabrese), fresh and it always comes in huge portions. The pinsa is amazing, very light and delicious. The Tiramisu is spectacular at the end of the meal, really creamy but not heavy.

The wine is always abundant, as the Italian tradition wants and good quality for the price.

The ambiance is really cozy and warm and the staff is amazingly kind and available to accommodate any request.

That's the perfect Italian spot in San Francisco to me.

author: Eddie A.
text:
First time at Mona-Lisa (ML). The place was bustling when we dined on a Friday night, but we did not have to wait for a table.

From a decor standpoint, ML subscribes to the theory that more is more.  Very old school, chintzy, Italian restaurant, to the point that it was actually fun.

The food came out fairly quickly, but the waiter was very inattentive.  In fact, he replaced my wife's Diet Coke because we advised him that the glass was chipped, but he didn't bother to refill my soda, even though the Glass was empty. 

The Gnocchi al Quattro Formaggi was way too heavy and the cheese was overpowering.  The spaghetti al'Amatrciana was pretty good. 

Overall, it was OK, but with so many other options in North Beach, don't think we'll be back.

author: Anahi R.
text: The service was awful! I could literally copy and paste a previous review because it was exactly what happened to us on Sunday evening. The server Antonio didn't bring us our drinks on time the bread came with the food that was cold. I ordered the carbonara it wasn't awful but it wasn't great either. We sat outside on the sidewalk tables. I don't recommend that we literally had people asking us questions while trying to eat and people smoking not recommended. But the reason for the one star is the service it wasn't busy and yet we waited a long time for everything and last but not least the server Antonio came over to argue about how much we tipped him when told that the service wasn't the best he said we where going to have bad karma! Really wish the manager would do something about their servers seeing as I have read thru the reviews and I am not the first to complain about their current staff.

author: Louis V.
text: food and atmosphere was real Italian.. loved it.. waiter was very knowledgeable.. and owner was from Italy.. treated us like we were family..

author: Anton S.
text:
Like my wife's post says, this place ROCKS! Seriously the best Italian I've had in a while. Nothing fancy, nothing expensive and over priced, just some old school cooking! The owner was around and stopped in to chat with our kids and Check in on our family. I can't rave enough about the lasagna, my grandmother makes the best one I've had... but since she doesn't have yelp I feel safe saying, this one was neck and neck with hers! 

We will make sure this is on our list of places to eat everytime we visit San Fransisco. If you're looking for the old school feel with the food like Grandma used to make... this is the spot. Nothing was left on my plate after our son got done eating all the meat sauce. If I could give it 20 stars I would. Seriously AMAZING FOOD!

author: Nikhil A.
text: Awful experience. Waited 30 minutes to be seated even though we had reservations. After being seated for 15 minutes we finally got a server. Who brought us ravioli that was over cooked and hard. Followed by forgetting a dish we ordered. The owners excuse was "oh we are too busy". Definitely not coming back to pay 100 dollars for bad service and mediocre food.

author: Ken J.
text: The ambiance and history make it a great place for tourists. Its menu options  are  overwhelming... but its recipes are spotty. Party of five, we ordered a lot and shared.  The antipasto, IMO was the best we had.  The other plates were okay... but nothing to write home about.  The ravioli was way too salty. The minestrone soup was real thick and bland. The pizza and calzone were bland.  Would I go back-- sure with tourists. And I would order some of the less known dishes such as the pasta con tonno. Would I suggest this place? Probably not.

author: Lejla C.
text: After an attempted lunch prior to coming here went horribly wrong at another establishment this turned out to be a breath of fresh air. Our party of 8 showed up without a reservation which I'm sure some places would find annoying. To my surprise the staff was extremely welcoming and seated us fast! The waiter was super nice, took our order within a short time, got everything correct, and made sure to check up on us. The atmosphere and food were great. Although the food is somewhat pricey I find the overall experience worth it. I will definitely come back and recommend it to friends!

author: Danielle A.
text: Very ,very delicious Italian food ! Authentic and flavorful! Loved the atmosphere and service was the best! Especially the owner, Mauriizio , an absolute gem!! I can't wait to dine there again !

author: Annie N.
text:
Candle lit dinner, good pasta & wine, with the lovely bonus of having a Mona Lisa painting with her perky breasts out-- honestly what could I complain about?

Appetizers:
I recommend the bruschetta bread. 
I believe our platter came with assorted salumi and Romano cheese. I was a big fan of the cheese; had a strong taste and I was very down for it. 

I had the Fettuccine Leonardo-
Cream sauce, tomatoes, and chicken. 
Went well with my White Zinfandel. 

Owner was very nice and thankfully authentically Italian. 
Thank you for letting me eat while enjoying your breasts out, Mona Lisa. I shall be back to admire your loveliness hopefully soon.

author: Michelle G.
text: This place is so amazing!! I can still taste the pasta I had. It's soooo good. I've been to Italy before and it brought back memories of the food I had. I would definitely recommend it. They're even open late hours. We happen to run across it because we got into San Fransisco late and stopped here for dinner. Highly recommend! My family and I loved it. I honestly don't think anything on the menu is bad. We all ordered different things and all of us loved it. Which we had a place like this closer to home.

author: Sofi V.
text: It was amazing!!!!  The food was great, especially the bruschetta.  Dessert was delicious; the limoncello gelato was FABULOUS.  Everyone was so friendly.   Great spot for a date night!

author: Deb N.
text:
On a trip to SF I was referred her by a friend in Seattle and also by a local.
1) The staff was wonderful.  Greeted like valued customers the minute we walked in the door.  All our needs were met and the girls are now planning/dreaming of a trip to Italy. 
2)  My daughter was in heaven!  She LOVED the pesto sauce we hot with our mini fried calzone appetizer.  Not a lick of sauce left as she dredged up every spec with bread.  I tried to make the same sauce when we got home, but fell short despite my intentions!
3) Everything looked good and we had a hard time deciding what we wanted.  So, we found 3 items and agreed to share so we could all get a taste.  My daughter's friend got the 4 cheese alfredo (OMG yum!!!), my daughter got the canniloni and I got the lasagna (both came in a large hot dish still bubbling from the oven).  Everyone was so happy!
4) We took our time eating in this cutely decorated place.  I felt transported to Italy as the owner and waiters all had Italian accents and talked amongst themselves in Italian.
5) Reasonably priced.  Walked it off as we headed DOWN to our Hotel at the Wharf. :)

author: Jeanette M.
text: Not a fan! Cute place very intimate but the service was not great! Bread was cold, was not offered drinks until my 9 year old asked and we had to flag down the waiter for everything. The pasta was okay not was I expected

author: Kevin A.
text: Wish I was there right now, this place is so BOMB. True Italian food for the soul, pasta, lasagna, & great service

author: Cindy S.
text: Today I had lunch at the Mona Lisa restaurant with friends from Daughters of the Nile prior to seeing Beach Blanket Babylon. The food was delicious. And our waiter was friendly. I was happy that it was recommended to our group, and hope to go back again soon.  Thank you for a wonderful meal.

author: Steward D.
text: First time eating here. Calamari was outstanding! Our meals were very good and the place has a great old Italian vibe. Definitely recommend if you are looking for good Italian food in North Beach!

author: Kathleen P.
text: This is a wonderful restaurant where they make thrown pasta.  Service was great. It is a small restaurant and crowded thus a little noisy. They have a children's menu. The food is delicious. Salad prices are high as are appetizers. I was too full to eat dessert.  We were there on a Saturday at 630pm and although we had a reservation they still had tables available. They were very accommodating rearranging tables very quickly to suit party sizes.  I highly recommend.

author: Josiah M.
text: The food tastes good, but there was some something small and hard like maybe a piece of sand that made a loud crunching sound and scared me of chipping a tooth. It only happened once in the middle of eating my cannelloni and I ate the second half very cautiously. I will personally try to avoid this place in the future.

author: Patricia G.
text: Great location and the atmosphere was nice! We sat outside and got to enjoy the the evening! The only thing I did not like was their bread!

author: Cami F.
text: Absolutely loved the lasagna and bruschetta! We also had excellent service. It's tough choosing a place in this area with so many options, but you will not go wrong with Mona Lisa.

author: Casey M.
text: I order Mona Lisa a decent amount, typically the same thing - the fettuccine Alfredo (it's amazing!!!). Last night I also got the margarita pizza as well, it was so delicious! I recommend trying both.

author: Lou C.
text: This restaurant is amazing. From the decor to the service and the food, we could not have asked for more. We spent 45 minutes wandering the streets trying to figure out where to eat and so glad we stopped here. We have told everyone we know that if they visit the area this place is a MUST. We are planning another trip to the area in the summer and cannot wait to eat here again!

author: Linda C.
text: Most amazing food, Service and ambience! Had the caprese, perfect blend, not over-vinegared, lasagna was BEYOND AMAZING! Even the house Chardonnay was great!

author: Elizabeth C.
text: Found this place wandering today. Tbh, the place is a little pricey but most definitely worth it. The waiter was very nice and very attentive to our needs. You truly get an authentic Italian experience here. The place has a very lowkey vibe to it and I found myself admiring all of the art and statues throughout the entire restaurant. My friends ordered a calzone and I ordered the Fettuccine Leonardo. It is basically chicken and Alfredo sauce with baby tomatoes. Extremely good and has lots of flavor. So, if you're ever in walking home from Pier 39, you might find this place. It's fantastic!

author: Long T.
text:
We were in our second night at San Francisco and decided on Italian to celebrate our time during the New Year holiday.  My brother found this restaurant and it was quite delicious.  Atmosphere was really nice and we got to hang out and have fun without causing a fuss around other people.

I ordered an Italian steak with a melted Gorgonzola Cheese topping, but definitely wanted my Fettuccine Alfredo pasta fix.  Food was really exceptional and loved every bite!

Only thing I did not really care for was our very minimum effort server.  He was big and was okay enough, but spent more time with other tables than ours.  I was quite disappointed with that.

If you want to come for the Italian food, that's cool.  It's best enjoyed sitting down (though the wait time was pretty long too).  Just don't expect THAT stellar of a service when compared to other restaurants around the area.

author: Moe D.
text: Make sure your waiter speaks English. They don't listen when you say easy ice on your soda and instead I got a drink with more ice without realizing it. Then the waiter tried to charge me for a refill because my soda was finished before food arrived. When I asked to remove it the waiter asked me why I only have 10% tip and that he is new and all that other bs so I gave 20% to shut him up. He also forgot to give me my to go food because he was busy ringing up his tip. If you don't do your job right then you don't deserve a tip at all. Moral of this is make sure you get a waiter that speaks good english.

author: Claudia M.
text:
If you're looking for some of the most amazing Italian food in the city, this is your place! True old school feel and vibe, with amazing taste. When I say the food was delicious, my husband said it's the closest to his grandmothers lasagna has ever had... our baby was even eating the meat sauce like he couldn't get enough.

The owner was around the whole time and truly provided old school customer service. This will be a new staple for us every time we visit. It's no surprise they've been in business for 39 years!

author: Taher R.
text: If you really want to know the true Italian cuisine, with the best ingredients, in a romantic and cozy atmosphere, you must certainly go to Mona Lisa. There you will be greeted by a friendly and eclectic team, they are Italians... people from every corner that make Mona Lisa a place of the world with the best Italian food in the United States in my opinion

author: Narine G.
text:
Came to visit Little Italy and Chinatown today with family to take in the atmosphere and different cultures. My review is as follows: 
For the food: 5/5
For the service: 3/5
For the atmosphere 3.5/5
Overall: 4/5.

As a starter, there is bread with balsamic vinaigrette and olive oil. For the table of four, we had ordered the appetizer platter (for two), which was plenty for a party of four. We were all thoroughly impressed with the calamari (especially the sauce), along with the salami, and cheese. For my personal entree, I ordered the lobster ravioli. Though the entree was not plenty in portion it was plenty in heartiness. Everyone else on the table ordered the fettuccini pescatoro (and were equally pleased, minus the misratio in clams/mussels to pasta). Overall, I would recommend getting the appetizer platter with a bottle of wine, for an afternoon delight.

For the service - our waiter did not seem too interested in assisting us. On a busy night, I would have understood . . . Also, I felt that as we were the only young adults, we were frowned upon.

author: Alex M.
text: Visiting from out of town we decided to stop by this place since it smelled very good.   Plain and simple very good Italian food.   There are a lot of choices in this part of town and I'm glad we decided to eat here.  We order fettuccini Alfredo, chicken parm and a pizza which I don't remember what it was called.  Everything was fresh it did take a while to get our food but since it's all made to order it was well worth the wait.   I would have taken pics of our food but eveyone was so hungry that I didn't get a chance to.  If and when I come back to frisco I will defiantly come back here to eat again

author: Amanda J.
text: A delicious authentic Italian restaurant. Good, fresh food; friendly, attentive staff; and a good atmosphere. Highly recommend and look forward to going back. Make sure you reserve a table.

author: Walter R.
text: When in San Francisco a visit to Mona Lisa Ristorante Is a must. Authentic Italian food with outstanding service equates to an enjoyable and satisfying dining experience. Maurizio and Filomena have welcomed locals and tourists for 25 years serving tried and true family recipes that have stood the test of time. Bottom line if you are looking for a fun place with great food and wine in North Beach San Francisco, make your way to Mona Lisa Ristorante! You will definitely come back over and over again.

author: Jesica I.
text: Last stop on our walking food tour (staycation). We had the Margherita pizza and it is one of the best I've had. Very basic/simple, perfectly salted dough, thin crust, light texture from the cornmeal. I enjoyed this pizza and would come back again.

author: D. K.
text: This place is so much fun. Good service, but tight seating and very loud. We ordered the appetizer tower. It says it's for two, but probably better for 3-4 people. The lasagna was great but skip spaghetti and meatballs. They were dry, sauce was not very good and the noodles were under cooked.

author: Oscar A.
text: Excellent service! Professional, courteous, and respectful staff. Food was delicious! We had to come back for our dinner dates. Perfect atmosphere

author: Lynne M.
text: This is my go to Italian place, I just love it the food is so authentic.  The pastas are so good, so fresh.  Little hard to park, but it doesn't stop me from going.

author: Sarah A.
text: Their spinach ricotta ravioli is the best i ever had. The portion however is waaay too small for the price. The food itself is tasty and would be worth the price if the portion size was not so small. Their bruschetta is also really good and they are generous with the bread & tomato mix.

author: Jim H.
text: Great Italian restaurant. They recommended a great Pinot Noir that was a great blend with our meal. My wife ordered the caprese salad, fresh tomato's and mozzarella was perfect. Had the Pinsa for the first time and it reminded me of our times of vacationing in Italy. Recommend to anyone who is looking for authentic Italian in San Francisco.

author: Aaron B.
text:
I have been going here for a long time. Great food and service.
The rigatoni Aldon Smith is great.

author: Tommie S.
text:
Incredible food, great service and amazing ambiance! We had a beautiful meal and shared a bottle of wine. Our server was fantastic and attentive. 
Everyone traveling to San Fran should make it a point to eat here! 
It's authentic and all of the employees speak Italian! The kitchen is open so you can see the food becoming a masterpiece and the art work is beautiful! 
The restaurant is perfectly positioned on Columbus avenue, right in the heart of North Beach or Little Italy!

author: Andrew M.
text: Awesome atmosphere, great Italian and thoroughly enjoyed the wine.  Lots of character and I recommend you check it out!!

author: Vincent H.
text: A little pricey, but excellent ambiance, and tasty food. Our service was good as well, and good wine.

author: Sonia D.
text:
My parents / brother were visiting me in the city, which happens rarely, and I wanted to take them to a nice restaurant in North Beach. However, I am so extremely disappointed with staff, service, and food that it ruined the whole night. Let me address each piece...

1. Service- we were seated quickly, but once seated we waited for forever before someone even came to our table.  It took so long that we almost left, but finally our server came after more than 20 minutes and brought us water. Which brings me to point 2....

2. Staff- HORRIBLE. We were greeted by Luca, and by the time were ready to order since they took so long to arrive in the first place. Let me start off by saying he was not at all pleasant. We weren't all that hungry, so we ordered 3 dishes to share: Chicken Piccata, Rigatoni Aldon Smith, and Risotto. Luca immediately arrogantly stated that since there are four of us dining, we would have to order four dishes.

What?! This was nowhere stated on the menu, and I saw other diners at the restaurant clearly sharing dishes. I thought he was joking at first and tried to laugh it off, but he retorted that he was being serious and demanded us to order another dish. I asked for some time to think about what we wanted to order. I was shocked that there was an obligation to order one dish per person for our table, when clearly it wasn't a requirement for others. I realized a few minutes later that he was probably taking advantage of us, thinking that we are tourists, since we were there as a family? I flagged him down and asked him to cancel our order and we will take our business elsewhere, and suddenly he seemed okay with serving us. This was absolutely not the ambiance I wanted to bring my family to, and was so upset at the upfront rude behavior of Luca that it ruined the rest of my night. 

3. The food itself was hit or miss. Rigatoni was excellent, Risotto was average, and the Chicken tasted like it was just boiled and doused in sauce. 

The food and service could have been pardoned, but I am so turned off by the arrogant behavior of the staff that I am never returning here again.

author: Yowz A.
text:
I live here. I've been to every restaurant on Columbus more than once.

This is by far the worst. Not even close. I had pasta with pancetta, but they must have heard my order as "pasta with rancid pancetta." The only thing worse than the taste was the after-taste.

My dining partner ordered pasta with cheese sauce. They served her naked pasta and started shredding parmesan cheese on it. We said, no, we want cheese sauce. They said, "We don't have cheese sauce. We have four-cheese sauce." So we asked, to their visible annoyance, to send it back and come back with "four-cheese sauce."

The salad was overflowing with oily dressing, making it inedible.

The draft beer provided ummistakeable evidence that they never clean their beer lines.

This place is beyond awful. What an embarrassment to North Beach.

author: Douglas B.
text:
Who is cooking ? Too much salt too much grease the food did not taste fresh the food is way over price. Entrees for $20 to $25 $30 each.
I live here in SF for 38 years and really never went to your restaurant because I always considered the restaurant a tourist trap well my gut intuition was right overpriced poor  Italian food .
I don't know how you get four stars you barely can get to two. based on your appetizers.

I will not come back. Good luck! Oh yeah you want unless is outdated over price also.

author: Deana C.
text: We left the restaurant next door to the Mona Lisa because we weren't impressed with their menu. Mauricio, the owner, was outside of the Mona Lisa and brought us immediately to a table and treated us like family!! The food is phenomenal, the service was out of this world, and I will definitely be back here every time I am in town!

author: Zig B.
text: Stoped by for Margarita and some wine for lunch. Great service. Decent wine. Pie a solid 9.5!

author: Karen W.
text:
Last February while in SFO we stumbled upon Mona Lisa.  Our waiter Luca had just arrived from Italy to work in his Uncles restaurant.  We enjoyed our meal and the hospitality.  Last week we returned and to our surprise Luca was there and remembered us.  We so enjoyed our meal and wine and his great hospitality.  Eating at the Mona Lisa reminds us of  
Italy and will hold us over until the summer when we can return to Rome.

author: Sheena T.
text:
Sigh.... 

This review is long over due.

My boyfriend made a reservation here on Valentine's Day at 5:00. We got here at 5:07 (finding parking) and ordered around 10 minutes later. We ordered the calamari appetizer - they give you a lot, but there were no tentacles! The redeeming part of this dish was the marinara. 

The real juicer was the wait time for our main dishes. Ree. Dick. Q. Lus. 

We waited a good 45 minutes for very plain pasta. Service was atrocious and seemed annoyed at us asking to check on our order.

The pasta that we got was very basic and probably could easily be concocted by getting tortellini at Trader Joe's or Costco. Not worth the money or hassle.

Cons:
1. Longgggggggg time to get food!
2. Food was mediocre
3. Service was below par
4. Expensive for food quality that is below Maggiano's!

Bottom line? Will not return. Ever.

author: Roberto M.
text:
Got lovely anniversary lunch today. Food and wine knowledge from my server Giancarlo was great. Presentation of the dish and atmosphere was very good We got very good Montepulciano riserva red  wine. 
Only complaint one noisy and rude guest next to our table.

Mr.and Mrs.Hutchins 

Pacific Heights
San Francisco

author: Rachel M.
text:
Came here because a former coworker of mine said this restaurant is really romantic. We were seated right away, and we thought we were off to a good start.

Well, long-story short, the ambiance was probably the only great thing about this place. They weren't busy when we went here at 8PM, but our waiter paid more attention to their other guests than us, so we felt very neglected. Maybe we just came on a bad day. 

For all these reviews about amazing food and a long wait for the food, we expected the food to be incredible. We did wait a while for our food, but that's not problematic for us. We were just really disappointed by how the food tasted. I am a huge advocate of chicken parmigiana, and it lacked flavor. This was my boyfriend's first time trying it, and now he's not convinced he should try other chicken parmigiana for comparison. 

The ravioli we got was ok tasting, and so was their bruschetta and tiramisu. For the price we paid for the food, though, it doesn't connect with us.

author: Elissa M.
text: Fun place to sit on the sidewalk and watch the world go by. Good Authentic Italian food and Italian staff. Seemed a little pricey. Pictured Pasta Bolognese with homemade fettuccine pasta (extra $4)

author: Al L.
text: Nice, fast service, felt comfortable even though it was empty but the food was well cook and a lot of flavor. Desert truffle ice cream was nice finish but I want more desert so I walk to the cookie bear place down the street for a special treat. Great experience at mona lisa felt at home.

author: Anthony B.
text: This is the best restaurant I have ever eaten from! They are extremely nice, professional and make you feel at home. The food is amazing, unlike anything i have tried before. Each bite made me smile wondering how a meal could so good. My wife and I went the first day we got to San Francisco and we have been talking about it all day that we had to go back again the 2nd day which is today. To be honest, I'll be back again tomorrow. Their servers were super nice. Hope this help. I rate them a 10!

author: Chloe B.
text: Amazing atmosphere, authentic food and the best service! Went for my 21st birthday and had the best time, dinner and wine! Manicotti and tiramisu were to die for and everyone there really makes you feel like family!

author: Tim B.
text: The homemade pasta was very good.  The Italian feel was great. I believe the owner was going his best. But we were surprised as to the service.  We were virtually ignored. Maybe she had too many tables. We don't know. But when glasses are empty and no help, that is not good service. Also, she appeared very disappointed with our 15% gratuity. Which is a Surprise to us with being ignored. We had not been here before. Not sure we would return.

author: Eileen B.
text: Lots of vegetarian options!! Service was great, the food was even better. The server was very accommodating with changes. This is our new go to place for Italian food.

author: David B.
text: The Mona Lisa is the best restaurant in the area. Fast service, clean restrooms, and great food. When we first arrived, my family was kindly greeted by the w

author: Lana A.
text: Beyond fantastic! We stumbled on this restaurant and grabbed the patio. The owner is incredibly friendly and welcoming to kids. Let our boys sit in his car. The food is so delicious! Authentic Italian. Real Sicilian calamari! Amazing antipasti! Phenomenal service! Don't even get me started on the pizza or desert. Best we have ever had. Cc ant wait to come back! Thank you thank you thank you!!!!

author: Lexi T.
text: Mona Lisa's is definitely one of the "must try" Italian restaurants in the little Italy neighborhood. I've gone to this restaurant many times over the course of about 15 years now and it has always remained one of my favorites. Very small but super cute restaurant with a great ambiance and decor. The owner is there often and chats with the customers. He and many of the workers are from Italy and have great stories if you take the time to talk to them. The food is amazing and very hearty and authentic. I'm pretty sure they make their gnocci in house, as well as their sauces. The red marinara sauce is so flavorful and pairs well with many of their dishes. Great wine selections as well.

author: Tiana T.
text:
We came here for my birthday and absolutely loved it!! We had a fairly large group, 16 of us, and they were very accommodating. The service was great - the servers were attentive, refilled our waters before they ran out - we never had to ask for a refill of anything. 

Food:
We could smell how great everything was even before we walked in. It made waiting for our food that much harder, but, luckily, our food came out fairly quickly. The appetizer platter was MASSIVE. We got two and they were served on what looked like tiered tea trays. Very pretty, presentation wise. I personally loved all the vegetarian dishes, and everyone seemed to enjoy the rest of the appetizers. 


As for the main dish, I really liked what I got -some squash ravioli, but my friend's walnut gnocchi dish was to die for. Would go back for that alone.

author: R St John P.
text: The best food, the best vibe, the best service truly truly truly classic Italian awesome!

author: Amber K.
text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco! I come here at least once a week when I'm in the area and always make it a point to try something new. I've never been disappointed!!! Everything always tastes amazing and homemade. You can always expect the best service while here no matter the time of day. They welcome you in like family. Maurizio and Luca are the best!!! I highly recommend this place again and again!!! :)

author: Reba Jane S.
text:
With our latest Restaurant.com coupon in hand, we eagerly zipped across the Bay Bridge and into Little Italy.  It was a crisp evening, so the warmth of Mona Lisa was very much welcomed by my husband and me.  
We were greeted outside, ushered in and shown to our table just that quick.  
Fresh bread, bottles of water and a menu.  We're on our way.  But first, we had to try the bread.  A little olive oil, a little balsamic vinegar and uummmmm.  Delicious.  But we didn't want to fill up on bread.  How we managed any self control is beyond me.  Bread is a weak point with us.
So we ordered an appetizer, the mini calzones with pesto.  The calzones were stuffed with cheese and ham.  Fried (baked?) to perfection and the pesto was so creamy and a great dipping sauce.  It came on a lettuce bed that was dressed with some fresh tomatoes.  This would be a perfect lunch all by itself for the hungry business person.  And, the tomato, calzone and pesto combo was a real taste treat, said my husband!
Our entree' (I've shamefully forgotten the name of the dish) was a chicken breast that was grilled and seasoned with some special peppers.  On the side were roasted potatoes and also a side of spinach.  A little of everything on the fork for the perfect bite.  
Aside from the perfectly delicious food, the atmosphere is just plain fun.  All sorts of things going on, yet not in your face.  Look around.  Famous people's pictures who've visited are framed on the walls around the place.  The ceiling is a light show!  The music, I wish it were Italian as well.  Just a personal thing.  I like hearing the music of the place that the food is paying homage to.
Our server was gracious.  Service was excellent.  I'm so glad we had the opportunity to visit Mona Lisa.  This is now on our "Revisit" list.  I'm not a big fan of Italian food.  It seems to be mostly of three components: meat, pasta, sauce.  Boring.  I have been awaken to Good Italian Food!  And you can be too!

author: Linda N.
text: Truly a gem. I loved the vibe, staff and food  the sauce here is truly magical. The calamari was my favorite. I was seriously full off the calamari due to the large portion. My pasta was great too but I couldn't eat it and had to take it to go after devouring the calamari with my husband.

author: Gina D.
text: We love coming to Mona Lisa. My dad is friends with the owner and they always treat us with such respect and such kindness. I would suggest the Oso Buco over polenta or fettuccine. That is my favorite. I've never had anything there that I didn't like.

author: Roxanne S.
text: The atmosphere and the food was very quaint the food was authentic and was excellent. I would highly recommend this place. Very friendly staff and just excellent service.  It is not for a family with young children it is more for adults and grown children.

author: Pat M.
text: Great little restaurant in the heart of SF's Little Italy. The customer service was top notch as well. Will definitely be back.

author: Socialle C.
text: Simply put, one of the best restaurants in San Francisco. From the owner ( Moritzio ) on down this place is always a great night out. Chicken Picata and the antipasto tower are excellent. The Italian staff are fun and don't forget the dessert ! You will not be disappointed at Mona Lisa.

author: Dominique M.
text: The waiter and front of house were absolutely horrendous - aggressive and rude. I've never in my life been lectured by a waiter. We booked a large group table for 11 and we were 10 mins late and they gave our table away and insisted it was our fault that they had to give our table away!  Worst customer service. We were shouted out of the restaurant. AVOID this tourist trap!

author: Alex R.
text:
I now understand the 3.5 star review for this restaurant. I am thankful that they drop off a bread basket as soon as you sit down. This was able to hold us over for an hour and a half until we received our plate of spaghetti and a plate fettuccini alfredo. That's right, an hour and a half wait for our dinner, and that's not including the 30-40 minutes it took for the waiter to come and take out order. Oh and if you think you're getting a refill during that hour and a half, it's not going to happen. So be sure to ration out your beverage. 

By looking around, I could easily tell that I was not the only one unpleased with the wait. I even observed two customers send their orders back because they were not prepared correctly. The staff appears to be untrained and is unable to handle the busy Saturday rush. At no time did anyone apologize for he wait, or keep us updated on our meals preparation process. One thing that really got to me, was when a table that ordered after us, received their meals about 10-15 minutes before us. Again, I did not have a complicated order, but definitely waited as if I did. 

It's sad to say, but I receive better customer service at Walmart.

author: George M.
text: Deep, rich, Italian setting. Homemade ravioli and gnocchi dishes.  Family run, active owner, friendly and efficient service.  Lively crowd on a Friday night but easy to get a reservation with short notice on Yelp. Tables arrangements sit from 2-10 people.  Outdoor sidewalk available for small groups.

author: Tim A.
text: I have to say I am not a big Tiramisu fan, but here it is made to perfection! Melts in your mouth. Epic and a must try! The food is great and I love the decor as well. Great place

author: Steve H.
text: We go here every year on our anniversary! The staff is great and there menu is extensive with lots of wonderful meals! You won't be disappointed!

author: Jenn P.
text:
I'm from the Midwest but my husband is Italian, and somehow we missed this little gem until tonight.  Wow!  The charming sweet man at the door was actually the owner, and in a flambouyent ambiance we had an amazing dinner.  We shared a plate with bruschetta, complex with herb marinade and fresh, with some mozzarella, basil, and toasted French bread.
My Vitello Mona Lisa was outstanding.  A Marsala sauce that was both sweet from the Marsala wine and savory from the mushrooms was served with excellent wilted spinach and roasted potatoes that had a perfect outer crunch.  The Prosciutto on top was crispy and delicious.
He had his standby favorite that he orders wherever we go, the Veal Parmigiana.  The sauce was bright and slightly sweet, certainly made with pomodora.  
We would have stayed for dessert but early morning calls.
Mom is coming for her yearly visit next week and we are taking her there.
Highly recommend it.

author: Zuly V.
text:
HIGHLIGHT of my trip to SF! 

We had a large group (14) who couldn't agree on where to eat. Thankfully my fiancés cousin wanted to dine at Mona Lisa because one of his buddies who knows the owner highly recommended it. Loving Italian food I went along with it and as did everyone else.

We were greeted and seated promptly. Our server was extremely attentive and guided us thru the menu. We were served delicious complimentary appetizers. Such a nice gesture from the owner. My food was to die for. LOVE LOVE LOVE the amazing sauce they use for the Lobster Ravioli. My food was excellent and I was extremely satisfied. Didn't feel bloated afterwards, it was light, yet fulfilling. Everyone was content with their selections as the portions. 

It's difficult to dine with such a big group and satisfy everyone, they nailed it! 

Afterwards we took pictures with the Mona Lisa vehicle - such a touristy thing to do but we LOVED it. Will definitely return and try more items.

author: Jenna S.
text: Great and friendly service and tasty pizza (specifically the Mona Lisa). Is pretty much always busy which is a good sign!!

author: Shelby D.
text:
The one rating is not for the food at this place. When visiting this restaurant yesterday, the food was hands down thee best Italian food that I have ever tasted. 
The one star is for our server. Being in the industry for 8 years, the following was very disappointing. We ordered a soup, salad and calamari to start. Happily pacing ourselves with the appetizers while preparing for our entrees. There were 2 wine glasses that were empty on our table for more than 10 minutes. When they wanted another glass, we could not spot our server anywhere in site and had to flag down another wait staff to try to find our server. We asked how much longer for our food, to which he responded that he was waiting for the Caesar salad to be finished that we had on the table. Well my oh my, this was no small Caesar salad to start with. Shocked to say the least to hear from our server that they were trained to wait until all the food was completely gone until firing up the entrees. 
When clearing the appetizers off the table, there was no pardon my reach while our server felt inches away from my face with his arm extending to grab the soup bowl. This happened more than once, sadly. 
Our entrees arrived at last and everything was cooked to perfection. Zero complaints about plates, presentation, temperature, or anything else guests tend to comment on. 
We ordered two desserts which were pretty delicious. 
Our server only checked on us twice while there was food on the table, while one of the check ins was if we wanted boxes. 
To say if we'll be back for another shot...not too sure on that one.

author: Taylor S.
text: This is a great spot! I had dinner here tonight, and I absolutely loved it! I ordered the spaghetti with marinara, and my family ordered pumpkin ravioli, and penne pasta with pink sauce. It's very well decorated to say the least, and when you walk in you can see the hustle and bustle of the restaurant. I really enjoyed my pasta, and my family really loved their dinner. It was fresh, authentic Italian food, and the there's something on the menu for everybody. The portions aren't lacking, and it's reasonably priced as well. I absolutely love the Fiat car outside the restaurant. I was with 3 people, but you can actually eat in the car with 2 people. The owner was very nice and seems like a very hardworking guy. If you walk by here, you haven't had dinner, and you see the car outside the restaurant, eat here!

author: Katherine G.
text: Best Italian food I've had outside of my hometown in NY. Genuine hospitality and they make you feel like family! Grazie!

author: Peanuts M.
text:
The food here is not good! It's frozen food heated up in the microwave. There's nothing original or tasty. The chicken was rubbery, the raviolis were microwaved and overall, not very appealing to my taste buds. The pizza was the only thing that was ok.

The service however-excellent. Everyone was super friendly and accommodating.  They were very warm and welcoming people-thank you!

author: Sev A.
text:
the most amazing place.... 
it made my trip to san francisco :)
we were visiting from la we had a dinner on sunday evening there the food was amazing. the owner made us so wellcome and gave us the best servise ever.... we had a dinner in thier cute car out side of the resturant it was could but it made our experiance 100 time better. if i could i would give this place 10 star.. thanks for the best food and a great servise ...thanksss

author: Jim G.
text:
Very rarely will I give anything lower than 3 stars unless I was completely dissatisfied with the whole experience. Aside from the lovely hostess with curly hair and glasses ( didn't catch your name, but keep up the wonderful job) my experience here may be my last. 

- It's a disgusting feeling when you do not feel welcomed to a restaurant or anywhere for that matter. I ate here with my younger brother and felt that our waiter prioritized certain tables over ours. Haven been a waiter, I understand different signs customers give me in order to accommodate their wants and needs. That being said, we closed our menus since we already decided on what to get. Our waiter passed us several times and clearly saw that we were ready, but still insisted on not acknowledging us. Finally, he took our orders. Losing my appetite already, but hey, hopefully the food compensates for his lack of friendly service.

- Food comes out and it looks semi-pleasing. My "Spaghetti Polpette " lacked sauce. The spaghetti itself was not cooked al dente as requested. My brother's pasta, "Spaghetti allo Scoglio" was appetizing, I give them that. 

- I took a couple bites and was not pleased, so I was waiting for my waiter to check up on us. He went to our table and asked us how the food was (kind gesture) but as I was speaking, he walks away to attend to another table, that did not even flag him down. Such a rude move. He comes back after attending to the table next to mine, and says, " you wanted more sauce?" "Yes, please".

- I was presented with more sauce in a timely manner. Sauce wasn't flavorful, but I really didn't want to be that "one guy" so decided to let it go. Did not end up packing our leftovers (which I usually do). 

It could have been an off day for them. Our waiter could have been having a bad day. But regardless of the fact, servitude, friendliness, and tastiness is always key, and Mona Lisa did not reach my expectations. Would I give this place another try? Yeah, I would, but would definitely try something else and request another server.

author: Pooyan J.
text: There are a few times in life when a meal is so expertly crafted and planned that it is nothing short of genius. Last night, We had one of those meals. Thanks for the great service.

author: Ittai B.
text:
I just had dinner here last night for my girlfriend's birthday. And it was amazing.

North Beach has its fair share of Italian food, so it's meaningful when a restaurant is able to stand out among so much competition. I'll break it down.

The Food - I need to start here. The bread is classic Italian - slightly crispy outside and soft inside. We split the caprese for an appetizer - everything was fresh and crisp. I ordered the Mix Seafood Grill - a massive helping of shrimp, swordfish, and some of the best salmon I've had in years. My girlfriend had the chicken cacciatore, which we both loved. For dessert, the tiramisu was simply divine.

The Service - When I say "everyone was fantastic", I mean *everyone*. The owner himself was making sure we had the experience we wanted.

The Ambiance - there is a classic fiat out front that they've converted into a little booth for two. We had dinner while watching the setting sun change the sky's colors. 

It couldn't have been better. And my Italian girlfriend agreed.

author: Chase C.
text: Stopped by for a quick dinner before heading to the giants game! Food was very very good! The restaurant was easy to find and the service was great!

author: Mark P.
text: Very intimate cool location with very good food only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because it's so hard to park I can't come here as much as I'd like too.

author: Kt K.
text:
Our first choice ran out of pizza so we meandered over to Mona Lisa's and looked at the menu and  the fellow who drives the tiny fiat said I have a table for you come in, I will take care of you .... I believe he meant it , I am of the Italian linage and I know Italians love to nurture people will food ...He had me at hello.....

the place is buzzing with activity and the staff is hustling all over . The ambiance it sexy with some  quirky over tones which are to be pursued while you wait for your probably too busy to actually give you service waiter ....which made this a food experience , not a dining experience ..DO NOT expect to have a leisurely romantic meal here , you will be genuinely disappointed . Plus , the lighting is dim so everyone looks pretty ....the tables are small so ordering a variety of items will not be a comfortable endeavor , and since they pack them in ...expect to be crowded and rushed . 

The glass are probably sterile , but the cleaning lady has been here is a decade or so ...get over it if you want to enjoy - marred wine glasses with finger print and servers tossing giant chilled bottles of water under their arms in bulk to toss them on your table without making any eye contact what so ever .....

Being ignored by our server in the beginning was a bit off putting but we stuck it out ..he didn't recommend anything on the menu .... if he did say the Margerite's pizza was boring and I appreciated the honesty ...it was also only $12 buck and I wondered if he was like yeah move up the price point .....so I threw him raise a ordered a glass of wine - it was tolerable but I won't rave about it any memoir - this is not a wine list type of place ...if you want great wine here you should bring and pay any corkage fee with glee - your palate will thank you . 

We ordered and appetizer and I think our waiter not interested with that -- it was a very put the butts in the seats and get them out vibe . 

But the burrata came and it was lovely - the prosciutto  was delicious with a fantastic texture and intricate flavor ... and burrata was lovely right temp the dish a delight - the bread however was unfortunate ....Stale dry San Fransisco sour dough only resealed  by the delicious olive oil that boasted a true olive flavor and added that fat the the bread needed - they really should call ACME and figure out the bread but they are busy so don't really have to fix it ......

My happy level came up after the burrata ....and then the food came - meatballs as perfect as meatballs can me finding the delicate line between flavorful robust meat and tender juicy fall apart on your fork goodness -- someone grandmother taught them well ...I had the parpadelli with bolognese and the pasta was delightful light and smooth and absorbent of the sauce which was good but not a cream finished deeply robust meat sauce - but good ....the Lasagna was a muilti  layered  yum fest really highlighting the good parmesan and increasingly pasta ..... yummy --

At glance summary - nice enough - food is tasty - service is uninterested in you and assume you are a tourist and if you no like a tourist on the street will happily take your place - understand you are eating and moving on  enjoy !

author: Lesli H.
text: Horrible service, food was decent. I don't usually write yelp reviews but my experience here was horrible. Customer service wasn't great the waiter seemed to only help us when we kept bugging for his attention, we decided to not leave a tip because we weren't satisfied with the service. while paying we stated that we weren't leaving a tip, on our way out the waiter asked if we were leaving a tip we stated that we weren't and he then started rambling about how were we not going to pay them, that he needed money to pay the cooks as if they aren't already getting paid already, he insisted that we left a tip but no where did it say it was mandatory after basically arguing with him we decided to just leave and ignore his comments. Never coming here again

author: Elisabeth P.
text:
We searched areas in northbeach that had gluten free pasta options and this came up really close to our hotel. We were able to make reservations online and had no problems getting seated right away. Our order was taken quickly and food came out promptly. Our server was nice and helped with my gf requests. 

The atmosphere is like so many other cute cozy Italian restaurants in the little Italy district. Tons of little tables packed together, Italian flags hanging from the walls, the ceilings painted with resembles to the Sistine chapel and similar romantic art. 

The gluten free options here are good. They have a rice fusilli pasta and said I could have any sauce... And wow did they have a lot of sauces. Almost too many to choose from. They also have gf pizzas. 

We ordered the caprese salad which was good and they also made a tomato based calamari appetizer since I couldn't have the fritti, it was pretty good. I had the bolgonese meat sauce which was tasty, tho my pasta was really undercooked and tough to eat. My friends ordered a veal dish and the other a risotto with prawns. The one with the veal said it wasn't bad and the one with the risotto didn't eat much of hers. 

Price was ok. About 16 for the pasta and 11 or so for the appetizer was what I paid for. It was really nice that there wasn't any additional gluten free charge, that is hard to find. I ordered their house Cabernet which was good, I just thought 10.00 was a little pricey for just a house glass of wine.. But then again, maybe I've just been in the Midwest too long

Overall it wasn't bad. I would go there again but it wouldn't be my first choice in northbeach.

author: Karen W.
text: I love this place! Everyone is so nice, and they're all Italian, so I can practice!  I've never had a bad meal!

author: Molly A.
text: This restaurant was the best Italian restaurant I've been too and that's saying a lot. It had this vibe you know, it was crowded but in a good way. It was covered wall to wall with paintings. There were really 2 main points about this restaurant that really stood out to me. First off the food was to die for. We got the tower off appetizers plus we had the bread they gave us to start off with. We were so full by the time it got to our main course! All of this shocked me cause usually I can eat ALOT. But this is all in a good way, we wanted to eat all the food. When it did get to our main course we ate maybe 3-5 bites plus bite from others people to try theirs. The food was excellent and tasted very good the next day! Lastly but certainly not least, THE SERVICE! The service was tremendous here they were so kind. So first when we walked in there was this kind man greeting everyone and talking to everybody. Then this amazing lady got you situated and talked to you as well. She made sure you were ready to eat and hoped you were having a good day. They good came out relatively quick and did not disappoint. They did a good job checking on us making sure everything was just right. Once we are our main course they do something I've never seen, ever. They asked how our food was and then we asked for to go boxes. Then they got them for us and then he proceeded to put our food in the boxes for all of us and put them in a bag for us to take to our hotel. I've never seen that before but it just seemed so nice. Then we got our check payed and got up and left. The same person that greeted us said goodbye. Really I would recommend and would go here again!

author: B A.
text: Had a beautiful dinner in their outdoors section as the sun was setting. Superb Italian hospitality + excellent food!

author: D C.
text: I had a great time in this restaurant. The food was delicious and the staff was friendly. I am not from the area, but I went back, that's how much it impressed me the 1st time. I recommended to anyone.

author: Kristin B.
text: Great food, good service, good wine... our server Nicola was the best!  I cannot wait to come back.

author: Rob A.
text: Excellent authentic Italian food amongst many restaurants in Little Italy - San Francisco. Marco was a Great waiter that took excellent care of my family. We will be returning back in the very near future.

author: David B.
text: Went there on 12/30/17 for my girlfriend's birthday.  She has talked about Mona Lisa for our entire relationship and it did not disappoint. Food was absolutely amazing. Service was amazing. Only thing keeping it from a perfect 5 stars was I ordered the Margherita pizza and they forgot to put the basil on.

author: Jim C.
text:
Had a chance to try this restaurant, the food is terrific but the service is not on par with the food. I can understand if they are busy, but there were only maybe 10 people in the whole place. 

I would give them a second chance, but with so many other choices. It might be a long time before that happens. 

The choices are so great in little Italy, you can't afford to not be on your game everyday. I know restaurant work is hard, but to be successful it's being consistent.

Thanks for replay. I will do that, as all have off nights.

author: Bayrem D.
text: This place is a not just a restaurant, it's like a museum, and the service is super fast and people care a lot about customer service, plus the owner is super funny and likes to interact with everyone

author: Danielle M.
text: I had the pleasure at dining at Mona Lisa recently. I have been recommended to try this place out by Armando, Mauricio's nephew. Mauricio is a very friendly man and the food served is absolutely delicious. To be honest, the restaurant wasn't so busy when I had dined and the staff was exceptional. They had just finished their peak hours before my arrival, but were still working hard through what I imagine, exhaustion. Thank you Miguel for the chicken marsala recommendation!

author: Jessica M.
text: This is an SF city MUST! We visit frequently from Monterey, and our first stop is always Mona Lisa for dinner. I love the vegetarian options, however my husband is a meat eater and this is his favorite restaurant as well- win/win. I have had the opportunity to visit Italy before, and this is as close as it comes! Indulge, and don't miss out on an amazing dining experience from food to service! The owner knows what he is doing to exceed taste and service!

author: Linda H.
text: Mona Lisa is the place to go in North Beach for the ultimate Italian experience and authentic, tantalizing food.  Don't neglect to order the family style appetizer to start your meal off!  Maurizio & Marco are delightful -- and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Tell them Giovanni Teldeschi sent you!

author: Sam C.
text: One good Yelp review last year and the owner of this place goes crazy. Complements of the house for an assorment of Italian appetizers. This restaurant got even better. The best Italian restaurant Ive ever been.

author: Brianna S.
text:
From a Celiac:

Wow. This place has a lot going on! Decorations, busts, pictures, paintings, lights, and Italian men running around!

This place was very accommodating for a Celiac! They had gluten free options for pastas!!! They had a lot of chicken, fish and beef dishes. I had the Saffron Risotto. Honestly, it wasnt very good, it was too greasy and didn't taste like saffron. But, my whole family all absolutely loved their dishes!

I looooooved the bottle of wine we got. Very extensive wine list, always a prerequisite for a good rating from me. 

While I didn't like my dish, I'm sure I would've loved a GF pasta dish. I would definitely go back!

author: Kerry Y.
text: This is by far the BEST authentic Italian restaurant around. We loved every bite! The appetizer tower had the tastiest calamari at the top of the tiered plater, the middle section had an assortment of meats, and the bottom tier had caprese with fresh buffalo mozz, prosciutto wrapped cantelope, bruscetta and olives. My main course was the gnocchi and 4 cheese sauce. It was like little pillows of scrumptiousness! My son had the spaghetti vongele, and it had clams cooked perfectly with lots of yummy garlic. My husband's cannolini was baked and bubbling when it arrived at the table and every last morsel was devoured! We were so stuffed we had no room for dessert, but it looked like we missed out! I will try to save room next time :) Oh, PS, the service and owner are delightful!!!

author: Lana M.
text: Great food and great service! We had a wonderful experience and the owner made us feel very welcome. Pizza tasted like home (New York) so I'd highly recommend:)

author: Lindsey W.
text: Wonderful Italian restaurant in the center of Little Italy. Wonderful service, delicious pizza, a great wine selection. The tortellini was to die for and the lasagna was fresh. The risotto was made to order. Wonderful place, definitely a step above.

author: Dave K.
text:
The atmosphere is great, but the service and food are 5-Stars out of 5.   They took care of our table of 6 very well.  The owner gave our table a special Birthday treat with Sony and dessert.   Such a great guy!!
Go and enjoy.

author: Louis A.
text: We stumbled upon this gem while walking through Little Italy of San Francisco. The servers were incredible and the owner was so kind and generous. The food tasted just like my parent's and grandparents in Calabria. I will definitely be back.

author: Sergio B.
text: This place first of all had amazing service very funny friendly and nice then and on top of that the food was to die for , the best Italian restaurant I've ever been too and the price is like any other restaurant in San Fransisco.

author: Doris S R.
text: Best Italian food and the host Maurico is so hands on and really makes you feel so comfortable even the waiters, need to eat there you won't regret it

author: Beto D.
text: I'm new to San Francisco all the way from The Bronx, NYC. I knew I was going to have a good time from the picture of Derek Jeter in the front. The service was expeditious, the food was delicious, and the overall experience was memorable. I'm definitely dining here whenever I'm in the area.

author: Michelle D.
text: Stopped in for a quick bite.  Pizza was excellent - crust was perfection.  Service was even better - fast and friendly.  They seemed genuinely glad we came in. Will definitely be back.

author: Paul K.
text: Mona Lisa is a North Beach Italian Experience.  Food is definitely very good, not outstanding...but you go to Mona Lisa for the kitschy ambiance and Italian experience and have a very good meal at the same time.  It was a fun dinner in North Beach

author: Jonathan U.
text: I was super skeptical about this restaurant because it seemed touristy. I went with a friend that was visiting and it turns out this place was fantastic. The pasta was great and the dessert was great. The ambience is crazy, but in a good way. This might be one of my new favorite spots.

author: Flip F.
text: I've been coming here for 11+ yrs bc it's my wife's favorite, I finally have had the meal that just made me melt......Ravioli Zucca, Pumpkin Ravioli w/ Sage & Brown Butter Sauce. If I'm ever granted a last meal on death row [J/K, #Sorrynotsorry] I only want this w/ a sprinkle of parmesan.

author: RvChick R.
text:
The best Italian food on Columbus street in San Francisco. We ordered penne with mushrooms, eggplant, and red sauce and the house lasagna with meat sauce. Both dishes, which we shared, were outstanding. The only negative at this restaurant is the service . . . It's not the best and not worse. Other than that, this place is a great place to visit for an Italian meal while in San Francisco.
Okay, yes we went back again . . . And it was just as good as I remembered. This time our waitress was outstanding and we have absolutely no complaints. If you like Italian food and you don't want to waste your money this is the place to go! Awesome

author: Michael J.
text: Was recommended on a tour but service was terrible food was not the greatest. Atmosphere was nice tho. But we won't be returning there ever again.  Go at your own risk.

author: Maria Francesca A.
text:
Let me start off by saying, I know good Italian food. I know good Italian food because I come to Mona Lisa every chance I get. Whether it's a birthday or just a night out, Mona Lisa never fails to deliver great service and even better food. 

I've been coming here since I was a kid, Maurizio has always stood at the door to welcome passer-bys and returning patrons. As I walk in, I'm always greeted with a kiss on both cheeks and a glass of wine. And on a few occasions I've even been seated in the Fiat outside. 

Funny story - I went on a first date to Mona Lisa, this guy was going on and on about how great the food and atmosphere are. He had no idea I was a regular. We walked in, and Maurizio greeted my with a kiss on the cheek and sat me down at my favorite spot in the corner. My date could tell something was up. After a few minutes, this guy was so confused when an order of Calamari was delivered to the table, "Courtesy of the Owner." I laughed and told him that Mona Lisa is like a second home to me. Dinner was outstanding, as always. I had Ravioli with Vodka sauce (my favorite) and he had the Pollo Piccata (my second favorite.) We shared a bottle of Pinot Grigio and tiramisu for dessert. Unfortunately, we didn't fall in love... but the food was great, so thats a plus!

Would I go back? Every day for the rest of my life!

author: Cristina R.
text:
Awesome restaurant!

I had late dinner here last night and the food was so authentic and delicious!

You can find here wide selection of pasta (vegetarian, meat or seafood) and meat/seafood entrees. Vegetarian/Gluten free friends won't be disappointed! I had the black squid ink linguine... Yum!

The owner was very welcoming and our waiter was very helpful and checked on our table few times.

I will be returning back very soon!

author: Emily C.
text: This is my third time here. I should have paid attention to the updated reviews recently. This dinner was utterly disappointing. First off the table bread was hard as a rock. Secondly, the Caesar salad tasted nothing like authentic Caesar dressing but more like a flavorless dressing with refrigerator taste. The Bolognese pasta tasted like canned food and the vodka penne was a la gross. I will not be returning. Do yourself a favor and go across the street to calzones restaurant. Definitely a lot more tastier. :/

author: Alina D.
text:
I genuinely had a wonderful experience here and have no complaints whatsoever. It's a genuine Italian restaurant - sure, it plays up stereotypes to draw people in (i mean, it's named Mona Lisa and has a fiat), but the experience overall was fantastic. Just don't be in a rush. The staff (as far as I could tell) and the owners are Italian to the core, so things may not be prompt or quick, but they will be good and delicious. 

My family and I were drawn in by the owner standing outside next to the menu, and while we were looking at it he mentioned that an appetizer was free for the July 4th weekend, and that we could trust his cooking since he was Italian, Etc etc, and for curiosity's sake we were like: sure ok. We were seated immediately, near the windows, so the dim lighting wasn't so bad, but I can imagine further into the restaurant it would be more difficult to take photos of your meal. The inside itself is beautifully decorated with a painted ceiling and fun pictures and statues. Throughout my time there, the waiters were singing along to the Italian songs and chatting amongst themselves casually, and I thought it was just really amusing and different than say, an Olive Garden or any other run-of-the-mill Italian place. 

The free appetizer we did get was a delightful crostini that we ate with our red wine we ordered - I believe we got the Cabernet our waiter recommended. The sliced bread we received as we waited for our food was also refilled promptly and delicious as well. It seemed as if there were not enough olive oil/balsamic containers to go around but our waiter took ours from an empty table so it didn't cause a bother. The place was busy and popping by the time we left, and it was pretty funny because there was an older fellow outside who must be a friend of the owners or maybe work for the restaurant who was greeting people and saying 'thanks for coming' etc, and he had a picture with the owners on one of the walls, so at first we thought he must be famous but we had no idea. Just a treat to people watch!

And, ok, the meal. I will dream of this meal I think, forever. I'm going to Rome for a few months next year but I don't even know if anything there can top it. The menu had so many unique choices it was so hard to choose, but eventually I settled on the gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce, spinach, and pecans. 

It was mind blowing. The sauce was creamy and so thick so I had to stop several times just to savor it, but I'm so glad I had the wine and the time. I didn't even end up finishing it all! My table also ordered an eggplant dish, a veal dish, and another pasta dish, and they were all delicious as well (I of course sampled - how could I not?) Anyway. It was absolutely fantastic, hands down the best Italian food I've had in America. 


Tldr: go. Order bravely. Take your time. Enjoy it.

author: Liz R.
text: We have lived in the Bay Area for over 25 years and this is the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco. The food is as authentic as it gets and the staff is very friendly. The owner talks to each customer and loves making customers happy. We have been multiple times and each time we have returned the owner remembered us. You can't order anything bad off the menu because everything they make is absolutely fantastic. I highly reccomend this place to anyone and everyone.

author: James O.
text:
Yes after you get out of that #Awesome little car up front enter into a #Retro SF "Little Italy" the Maître d' and service is impeccable we had such a good time sitting down ordering food and cappuccinos the desserts are so authentic! Most of all while on #Vacay the people you meet should "Add-Value to your Life" Great Spot all around.
4-Star Only because parking is a BEAR in The City!!!


-Blessings

author: Sophia S.
text: We found this place on yelp. Needed pasta for a change. We are both vegan. Enjoyed the bruschetta, mixed grilled veggies and two types of pasta with veggies. All good. The prices seemed reasonable except for the mixed grilled veggies. That was astronomical for what we received.  Would return though. The service was good and fast.

author: Isabel R.
text: Came here for homemade manicotti and ravioli on Christmas Eve. Definitely wise to make a reservation as this place fills up. The space itself is warm, vibrant and cozy. The service is great! It was our first time and the waitress was informative and patient and kind. The other staff members were great too, making sure we were seated in time. Food is fantastic. Looking forward to return and try other ravioli variations.

author: Cyndi L.
text: I have eaten at many Italian restaurants and Mona Lisa is by far the best I have ever had! The lasagna was amazing and my husband had the calamari and salmon dish which he loved. Our waiter Nicola was great! Would highly recommend when visiting San Francisco

author: Catie F.
text: This was one of the best meals we have ever experienced. Such excellent service from our waitress Maria and all of the food from start to finish exceeded expectations. Recommend all pasta, seafood dishes, and the meatballs were phenomenal. The entire staff is so helpful, courteous, and fun. Will definitely be back!

author: Joe M.
text:
Oh dear - where to begin? Reservations for 7pm - food arrived at our table @ 8:30 pm. Forgot the appetizer. Waiter refused to split the check between 2 parties. Kinda rude wait staff - just rushing all over the restaurant, pushing past guests. Probably a good restaurant for tourists who have no choice but to put up with that kind of service. Over-priced, over-rated!!!

Not planning to visit again. Try the restaurants on the same street. Much better service, much better food.  Oh well - live & learn.

author: Diana P.
text: Absolutely very favor full wonderful service ambiance is just what I was looking for in Italian dining. Love Love Love it

author: Erica L.
text: Meal was amazing!!! Atmosphere and service were incredible. My dad has the lasagna and said it was the best he's ever had. Every meal was amazing!

author: Omar L.
text: Best Italian food in the bay area and the coolest owner as well. Pay this place a visit and you will not be disappointed. My family and I have come here many times during 4th of July weekend and the owner has always gone out of his way to show his gratitude and even provide us with wonderful recommendations as well as a free appetizer at times.

author: Azra K.
text: Horrible, possibly spoiled food. No seriously, left with full plates on the table, no one even bothered to ask why and my crazy hubby still tipped.

author: Kevin W.
text: I've gone to Northbeach all of my life...when steps of rome was steps of rome, when broadway joe's was on Broadway, when there was a carl's jr at the corner of Broadway and Columbus, when Carol doda and the killer piano were still around. Not sure why I never tried Mona Lisa.  Well my wife and I finally went last Friday for my birthday and we had the perfect experience.  We had a big evening ahead so we kept it light. We ordered two traditional pasta dishes.  They made the entrées in front of us, super fresh ingredients, came out piping hot, large portions and super tasty.  The ambience was romantic, the service attentive, and the manager was awesome.  He provided us with a free cheese veggie charcuterie meat appetizer plate which was a nice touch.  They also brought out the TASTIEST CREAMIEST TIRAMISU free for my birthday.  While free is great, as we are also business owners, we always support other business owners so I made sure and was happy to include extra tip to pay for the free appetizer and free desert.  Free aside, this place is fab for ambience, great service, great food, value; and kudos to the mgr for his leadership of the crew and overall friendliness.  He's pictured on the business card.

author: Mary G.
text: What a wonderful ending to our Beach Blanket Babylon night in SF.  The food was amazing from appetizer to desert.  I have been on the search for the best calamari for a couple of years now and I think I finally found it.  The place was packed but service was quick.  Will go back next time I'm in the City!

author: Cecilia L.
text:
The reason for my one star is due to my waiter who we asked to split the with specific details and guess what, he did as he pleased.

Then came back and said, " it's going to take a long time to fix". I don't care JULIAN it's your job!!!
HE DIDN'T FIX IT BECAUSE IT WAS GOING TO TAKE TOO LONG. So I guess this restaurant doesn't have respect for your money. I have never been so upset at a restaurant before.

To the manager, I would consider training your servers on how to refund because he pretty much told me my money doesn't matter.

author: Max F.
text:
This is not bad Italian cousin restaurant but today when I went here with my wife I got the most terrible service ever from servers in my life. This guys were like a stupid asshole. They were every time late and confused with my orders: they brought another pizza, they forgot about beer, when I asked about 2 dishes they brought 1, and portion of panzerotti was smallest than usual - 3 instead of 4. Also when I asked to call manager server Roberto said he just left, also this Roberto was absolutely not friendly, rude and said he would call police cause we didn't want to pay for beer we didn't order. And at the end he even allowed himself to swear!! Is it what you called "great" service?! 
Will never come back here! And don't recommend.

author: Roger N.
text:
Convenient after Beach Blanket Babylon, the food was solid, if unspectacular.  They sat us near the front door, which never closed, and we were chilly the entire meal.  Might have ranked it 4-star but for that.  Service was so-so, friendly, but we had to ask twice for olive oil. Very Italian atmosphere, which would have been more enjoyable if we weren't cold.

I had chicken parmigiana, which was good, just not as good as what my wife makes.  Roasted potato and spinach sides were excellent.  My son's pepperoni pizza had a really good crust and was cooked well, but it had a bit too much sauce for his preference.  We also tried the tortellini formaggio (very cheesy) and spaghetti carbonara (pancetta could have been crisper), which both had good flavor.

author: Kirby O.
text:
1 large party
Reservation time: 7:30
Seated: 8:10
Entrees arrived: 9:15 or so

Service was bafflingly slow, even by Italian standards. It took at least 15 minutes for the server to greet us after we had been seated. We watched many other parties be seated and served, meanwhile we had to flag down our server to get wine and bread while we waited. My out of town guests enjoyed their entrees, but my bf and I thought our pastas were mediocre at best. I can think of lots of local Italian places with better food and service at a better (or similar) price point.

Edit: I appreciate the restaurant's response. Perhaps we would have enjoyed the pasta more if it was served at the right temperature. Sure, it was busy that night, but the slow service kept us from enjoying our dinner and I won't be back.

author: Sheila V.
text: We had a party of 8 that we reserved a table via Yelp. The staff was super friendly & food was really good. Great atmosphere & a fun delicious dinner.

author: Eva P.
