text: Wonderful experience. Went here for my anniversary (I did reserve online because the wait could be deadly sometimes), and we were instantly sat down and taken care of. Lovely service, always making sure you have enough bread and water. The owner is very a sweet guy, you'll see him walking around talking to guests. I really did feel like I was in Italy for a moment. Everything felt authentic. The food was AMAZING. Definitely going back!

author: Erika R.
text: My boyfriend and I will be dreaming about the calamari and Leonardo fettuccine after leaving San Francisco for sure! Delicious food and cozy atmosphere!

author: Rick M.
text: What a total let down !!! The Resturant looked amazing the staff spoke Itialian but the lasagna was served in a bowel and it should have been because it was just sauce and noodles plus very bland . It was slop !!!! I

author: Angie R.
text:
I'm not going to down them for the service, it's busy, crowded, and you feel like cattle being herded in, i could live with that. My complaint is the food! Spaghetti carbonara had no flavor except for the burnt pan taste. My fettuccine alfredo tasted like noodles in warmed up watered down non fat milk....seriously!  Calzone appetizers were simply lunch meat ham with a small shaving of cheese wrapped up in a blanket, very bland.  I blame myself for not adhering to its poor yelp ratings. 
Go to another Italian restaurant with a better rating.

author: Theresa U.
text:
5 stars for the service. From the hostess to the busser to the waiter, all excellent. We had a late reservation and were the last guests there, never felt rushed or uncomfortable at all. In fact, my waiter had the cooks add some pasta to my leftover Cioppino. Wish I got his name.
My husband enjoyed his Diavola Pizza, I had a slice and it was great. My Cioppino was OK..I've had better but the portion was huge. Prices are spot on for Little Italy, our disappointing lunch at the wharf cost more. Yeah, we should've know better but were playing tourist for the day. 
We'll definitely not hesitate to dine at Mona Lisa again if we're in the area.

author: Frank R.
text: This place has gone way DOWNHILL. Had dinner at Mona Lisa a few nights ago with a friend from LA. There was hardly anyone in the restaurant which to me is a big sign. I decided to take a table since I have been to Mona Lisa many times before with great memories and thought what the heck. The food was ok but our waiter was as friendly as an overcooked Italian sausage. Like we were an inconvenience to him. ZERO eye contact, ZERO warmth, basically a big fat ZERO when it came to service. Never going back there again. Arrivederci!

author: Tycoon N.
text: The food was ok maybe a 5 out of 10 but the customer service really sucks, they took 20 min just to get us drinks and they were not even busy they only had 2 tables and the rest were empty and the food took 40 to come to our table and it was warm, I'm good off of this place

author: Hanson G.
text:
This service is so bad. The 2 waiters have rude manners which I'm pretty sure are non-excising. I feel really bad for the host who is extremely nice. He has to suffer from these rude people. 
          Not only was the service bad the silverware was dirty. When everyone on the table touched their plates, their fingers were dirty. 
     My advice is to never come here ever

author: Johnny L.
text:
Thee Best Italian I have ever had!  Little Italy in San Fran is a must when ur roaming around CT (Chinatown)

so the 1st time we came here, we heard thru a recommendation from a spice place nearby, as we were trying 2 find the best Italian restaurant 2 go 2 n thanks 2 him.. we found this place!  thank u thank u!

that 1st time we went, I had the salmon risotto in cream sauce; it was like HEAVEN!  man, y don't we have this in Seattle?!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! yeah, it was that serious.. my wife had a gnocchi dish n she fell absolutely in love!!!

the day after our 1st visit, we went back n shared a pizza, I believe it was Calabrese which had oregano, sausage w/ full flavors of tomato n garlic, we may have added prosciutto.. it was really good!

everything is good

so many items 4 each form of pasta, just countless good stuff! on their menu

this 3rd time we went, we went 4 lunch n we shared a Calzone al Forno; it was the best calzone I had in my whole life.. definitely different from the American calzone, as it was softer like a pastry crust filled w/ fresh Italian tomato sauce that teamed up w/ fresh mozzarella 2 soak in2 the stuffed prosciutto that gave the eater something that will eject them out of their seat n out of this world because it was so good.. the only complaint will b if the inside was hot, since it was sitting @ the chef's counter 4 a little bit n cooled off

the service is consistently good

this place has a lot of photos of famous ppl who came here such as any1 from Derek Jeter 2 Martin Yan.. it is just that good since 1979! n the decor I bet has looked the same since then

just the Best Italian, @ least on the West Coast.. that I can say

author: Veronica M.
text:
Being a North Beach girl for the last 20 plus years, I know where to go & what to go for.  The usual Italian restaurant for us in the neighborhood has long been Sodini's or Ideale.  Mona Lisa has always been considered a tourist spot.  But out w friends recently, the wait for Sodini's was 45 minutes, so we decided to give Mona Lisa's a try.  

Stick w certain pasta dishes & you'll be fine.  My man's chicken piccata was a true study in mediocrity.  It was over salted & the sauce was a clingy mess instead of accentuating & tasty.  Pass.

The carbonara, on the other hand, was delicious.  The bacon was extra crispy, which gave great contrast to the dish.  The sauce was rich & flavorful.  A decadent dish.  Lip smacking good.

The rigatoni w truffle I ordered was also very good.  Good balance of flavor, w just the right amount of truffle, this dish was lighter & cleaner than the carbonara.  My man kept taking bites.  He didn't care for his piccata dish, but really liked this.  And it was nicely al dente.  A win.

It's kitschy, but not completely over the top.  This is North Beach.

In a pasta mood?  Mona Lisa's not a bad call.  Just know what to order.

3 stars.

author: Cindy F.
text: I don't usually send reviews, but this restaurant deserves a great one! First off, the gentleman who sat us, was a happy guy with an infectious smile. I believe his name is Maulazio? That may or may not be correct. So, sorry if I didn't get it right. Anyhow, the food was dynamite, and being Italian, I know my food!!!! I will return!!! It was fun, the wine was superb, and everyone was Italian!!! It doesn't get much better than that! Thank you Mona Lisa for a great experience!!!! Cindy!!!

author: Mete R.
text: Big pilates but comes with a price. I don't think price value performance is worth it. Having said it, the food was more of a 4 star. We had meatball and salmon fetuccini pastas. Salmon was better but both dishes are good. It is also nicely decorated but very touristy. It is not your local neighborhood Italian restaurant.

author: Armand D.
text:
BAD. RUDE. INSULTING. WOW!! I was INCREDIBLY offended by the service here, and I'm not easily offended. So much so that I NEVER, EVER leave Yelp reviews, but this prompted me to sign in after YEARS of city eating. To be honest, it really felt like prejudice (over I don't know WHAT, sure we looked young and funny looking but hell, I was wearing a tie even).
It was the worst service I've ever seen GLOBALLY. Here's a breakdown:
* We came in Saturday night, 2 hours before closing. Asked to sit outside, they said sure. 
* THEY IGNORED US! After water came, we NEVER saw them again. Over 20 minutes, and they were NOT busy at all, maybe 3 tables full inside. 
* We asked to move inside because we had waited so long we were FREEZING. They said sure, and we had to move our water and place settings in OURSELVES.
* Still: SLOW, RUDE service. Mainly a short haired/short bearded guy WHO WENT HOME and walked past us as we were sitting (wearing a black shirt and black backpack).
* WOW!!!!!! We asked for a little vinegar and olive oil for our bread, and they said "Sorry guys, OUT OF VINEGAR", which is fairly shocking for an ITALIAN RESTAURANT.
* WHAT?!?!?! After he left, another waiter came buy 10 minutes later and BROUGHT A BOTLE OF VINEGAR TO THE TABLE OF TWO WOMEN SITTING RIGHT NEXT TO US.
______INCREDIBLY INSULTING!!!!!!__________
* Had to ask for a refill of water, had to ask for the check (which took FOREVER), NEVER was checked on to see how everything was going. 
* The table next to us had to SEND AN ITEM BACK because IT WAS UNDERCOOKED. The waiter asked if they wanted a discount, they said "No. We want what we ordered, but now we want it to go". 
* Again, we arrived 2 HOURS before closing, so it's not that we walked in 10 minutes before closing, but even an hour into our meal a guy shouted "WE CLOSED" to a group trying to walk in. 

Hell! We were just a group of to, a young guy and a young lady. We just wanted to have a quick bite and we pay/tip well! But for the first time ever: I DID NOT WANT TO LEAVE A TIP, THEY DID NOT DESERVE A PENNY. I WAS COMPLETELY INSULTED AND IT FEELS LIKE WE WERE "PRETTY WOMAN'D" (aka judged for appearing to not have money). 

I left a $1 tip and I hope they got the insult. Congratulations Mona Lisa, I'm against leaving bad feedback but YOU PUSHED THE ENVELOPE. We will forever laugh at how terrible and rude your service was, and if I were the owner reading this, I would definitely take a look at that server who served us Saturday night 6/10/17. 

It's a shame, the food was good. But you could have given us C service and this would have been fine. You gave us not even F services, but I'm giving you and I- FOR INSULTING. 

Shame.

author: Lenny H.
text:
Disappointed. Definitely don't want to go back. 
Why?
Service below average. Our cousin joined us after we had our food, and the server didn't give her a menu, water, and only barely acknowledged her presence (she ended up eating elsewhere). 
Food very expensive, and not very good. My meal was tasteless and bland. My husband didn't feel well after eating there. 
The decor and location are fine, it is cramped but that was OK. 
The topless Mona Lisa picture was interesting. 
I'd say, go there and just have wine, salad and bread and make up your mind before ordering anything else.

author: Yvette G.
text:
Normally I would only give this place four stars, but the service was so outstanding that I had to give it five stars.

Mauricio was awesome! My friends and I were promptly greeted when we arrived, and were seated immediately.  We shared an appetizer with caprese, bruschetta, and Sicilian candy.  The "candy" is candied garlic, and it's amazing.  I probably would have eaten the whole thing if I wasn't so afraid of knocking a persons' socks off when I spoke.

I had the linguine allo squallo (spelling?). It was an awesome pasta dish with salmon, mussels, calamari, and other seafood goodness that I can't remember. The red sauce was lightly seasoned and did not drench the pasta, which I like.   Mauricio suggested an amazing Greek (yes, Greek!) wine that was fruit forward with a nice dry after-taste.  The wine complimented the dinner perfectly. My friends and I also shared the pistacchio dessert and the tiramisu.  All of us were ready to take a nap after dinner!  My friends and I plan to be in North Beach again in a couple months and we will definitely be coming back to Mona Lisa : )

author: Ted D.
text: Feels like a quirky east coast Italian Restaurant with a huge menu and larger portions.  The Italian Sampler triple level offering is excellent as is the Iron Skillet Cioppino ( I would order this and they have a version with pasta and crusted Pizza topping to hold in the steaming broth).  They have handmade Ravoli - 5 different versions.  I did not love my Veal Saltimboca - no brown sauce, sage too chopped and Veal tough and tasteless.  Ambiance is fun and quirky - NY Italian meets Hollywood.

author: Keli R.
text: This place was fantastic.  I found it on yelp while searching the neighborhood for something yummy.  I had to order the pizza because as a Sicilian that is my favorite go to food.  It was so fantastic.  They brought out a meat and cheese tray before the meal and it was totally worth it.  Be advised drinks are a little over priced and when I say drinks I mean coke and sprite.  But the food is worth every penny so I stuck with water because soda changes the flavor of the food.  My kiddo ordered the pizza too and she raved about it.  She's a really tough critic.  My other half ordered the lobster ravioli and he said is was to die for.  Worth every bite and he licked his plate clean, the sauce was yummy. Now I will be honest we were here about 3 months ago but I wanted to make sure that I got my update on here.  Can't wait to visit again.

author: Alfredo D.
text: Asked for olive oil four times. The people sitting behind us and next to us got the olive oil after only the second time they asked. Made us wait 20mins even though we had a reservation. The bread came out cold and borderline stale. The calamari came recommended by the waiter and it was subpar at best. It was very chewy and oily. The sauce was great that came with it and paired nicely with our bread that was olive oil-less. Then the another table that was seated a bit after us and definitely ordered after us received their two entrees before us. We only ordered one to split. And then to round it off. The ravioli we ordered was minuscule in comparison to everything else. Not bad but not great. How is ravioli more expensive then a large order of calamari but yet so much smaller? Mine as well go to bucca di bepo and know what you're getting yourself into and get your money's worth.

author: Stanley H.
text:
If I could have demanded my entire meal be comp'd by the owner i would have. By far the worst service I have ever had at a restaurant period. Food was amazing, or server was probably the worst server I have ever met in my life....a "fine dining" Italian restaurant where I had to ask for more wine.

Seriously?????
And that final check?? "Tip included in final total??? "#%^%%%^%"

author: Nicola C.
text: I never ate to this restaurant , but Maurizio the owner is worth all the 5 star , Great personality very welcoming for sure next time I fell like eat Italian foods this is the place to visit ! Grazie paisa'

author: Lyla H.
text:
Honestly yes yes ....

My expectations where the best about this place !! And yes ! 
I sure got the best I love the service ,  the recommendations  by our server where spectacular, 
Thank you so much to the whole crew 

FULL RECOMMENDED IN SAN FRANCISCO

author: Juan V.
text:
I believe the owner was at the restaurant Saturday night helping out. I don't know if that's common on him. He Seems like a great person and can see the passion he has for the restaurant and his customers.

Food and Wine was great.

author: Imelda G.
text: Great service (Samuel our waiter) really made us comfortable and welcomed. Great food and reasonably priced. I highly recommend the chicken parmigiana. We also had pasta arrabbiata good but a little spicy.   For dessert we had the white chocolate covered cram puffs really good.

author: Jason S.
text:
We've been here at least 20 times over 15 years. It is always a pleasant experience. Food is fantastic and the service is usually on point.  I always bring out of town guest here.

Penne al Forno alla calabrese is my favorite!

How ironic that I write the review, only to have a not so great experience just 10 minutes later. They changed their recipe and when we brought it up to the owner he seemed bothered that we commented on it.   He said "well bye and walked away" Keep in mind we were literally the only people there. 

I hope this was a one off experience. We will try again next time we are in the city.

author: Chris S.
text: A friend recommended this Italian restaurant. We went during a very busy dinner time-but we had reservations and were seated immediately. Staff was very friendly as were the other diners around us. Good family place. Great selection of food that was well prepared and served hot. Couldn't ask for a better place!

author: Samantha S.
text: AMAZING! The owner is an absolute delight. I have been coming here since I was 12, and am now 26. He ALWAYS remembers me and my family when we come in, and gives us a complimentary appetizer. Mauricio is wonderful! Definitely check this place out; you won't be sorry.

author: M K.
text: Thank you Mauricio the owner and our waiter Luca  who both along with the chefs made our birthday party so special! All so patient and efficient For all 12 of us The food was delicious and amazing the service 10 out of 10!! Amazing I felt I met new members of my family great service food and hospitality for sure you will see all of us again !

author: Linda X.
text:
Came with a large group and they set up the tables to accommodate us when we got there. The atmosphere is nice with dark lighting and the service was friendly and quick.

We ordered the calamari ($17) and tomatoes caprese ($16) appetizers. Both were tasty but pretty pricey for the serving size. For the entree I got the lobster ravioli ($20). It was just okay in my opinion - there was not too much flavor in the tomato sauce and I couldn't really taste any lobster. Then for dessert I ordered a cheesecake ($8) which was good the first few bites but was way too rich that I couldn't finish it on my own.

Overall okay Italian restaurant in the area and very good for group dinners.

author: S G.
text: We had a great dinner, and they were so kind!! They treated us like family and we ran into a couple that had been visiting for years and they couldn't stop raving either!

author: Marylin P.
text:
Came here from out of town after a friend raved about the food here. It doesn't take much to impress me but the Italian food was awful. I came during lunch hours. The restaurant was not packed. I ordered the pumpkin ravioli. The spunk in stuffing was okay, the pasta itself was not very good and the sauce was bland. My friend ordered the fettuccine Alfredo. Bad choice. Tasted like Campbell's soup. No joke. 

Service was friendly though. I am told their sea food is what is good here. It's an Italian restaurant-I hoped for at the very least good pasta. Come on!

author: Jim M.
text:
Pretty sweet restaurant. The owner is at the door greeting people the "old skool" way. Had the cioppino and it's right up there with the best of em' in SF. Been to North Beach a lot growing up in the area, and have probably been to most of the restaurants on or around Columbus. Mona Lisa holds its own.

Cheers!

author: Caterina R.
text: Truly the Worst pizza I have ever had: I ordered a basic Margherita pizza, the dough was fine but the sauce was simply terrible, left me a bad taste in my mouth for all the evening; also the cheese was stale. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the service, but the food was very disappointing. Would not suggest to anybody to go especially to native Italians. Moreover, I was disappointed by the appetizer, panzerotti, that were nothing special very badly fried. One star for the environment and for the service.

author: Gerald R.
text:
NORTH BEACH EATING PART VIII: SOUTHERN CUISINE - COLUMBUS DAY

I ate here at lunch today on Columbus Day. As my title stated I generalized the cuisine as southern cuisine. When I have been starting my North Beach adventure I would go to Italian restaurants trying to find specialized, regional cuisines. One of the major problems of trying to categorize the regional cuisine of the restaurant is the extensive menu. There are so many items on the list I was worried about the quality of each dish. In addition I couldn't what in the menu what the regional cuisine of this restaurant; the only reason I stated southern cuisine of this restaurant was because it stated on the Yelp information. Having quick lunch I needed to just one item, but I wasn't sure what item to ordered. It was either Fettuccine Mona Lisa or a risotto dish. I asked the waiter his recommendation about the risotto. He asked if I liked meat or seafood. I was thinking about the seafood. He went down the list to pick certain items. In the end I decided to order the Fettuccine Mona Lisa for one reason. In the past if a certain restaurant names a dish after its own restaurant name I'm assuming the dish is its specialty. That's why I ordered the Fettuccine Mona Lisa. 

As mentioned before one of the reasons why this menu was confusing was because I couldn't tell what is their specialty. There are several items named after the restaurant (Fettuccine Mona Lisa, Chicken Mona Lisa, Pizza Mona Lisa, and Veal Mona Lisa). There are also dishes named after the City (Spaghetti San Francisco, Chicken San Francisco, and Risotto San Francisco). Since this restaurant is on North Beach why doesn't the restaurant name some of the dishes after North Beach? Lol.

Now back to my only dish, which is the Fettuccine Mona Lisa. Two great things about this pasta is that the pasta is cooked al denta and the sauce is creamy but not heavy. One thing I didn't like about this pasta is it was quite salty due to the olives. Since the olives are cured having the olives with the ham makes dish quite salty. I would recommend either having the olives or ham alone in the pasta but not both. With abundance of items on the menu I feared that this dish would not maintain its quality. Other than the olives the pasta was quite tasty. 

Even though I only had the Fettuccine Mona Lisa today, I've eaten here before. The last time I ate here was about 10 years ago. I don't think the menu has remained the same but what I remembered was that the menu was very extensive that made it intimidating. What I ordered last time was the salmon, but there were so many different dishes of salmon I couldn't remember what I ordered. However I do remember the salmon was dry and overcooked. The fear of having too many items is some of the dishes won't be as good. Even though I've only eaten here twice in the last ten years my rating is based upon two items - a tasty Fettuccine Mona Lisa and a dry salmon. In a sense my rating is based on one word - consistency. With too many dishes consistency is hard to achieve. I feel if the restaurant cuts more than half of the dishes in the current menu I believe the quality of the food will be much better and consistency will be better achieved.

author: Bruce W.
text:
Home... Best way I can described this place.
I've bragged before, I'll brag again, still one of the best & my favorite Italian Restaurants in SF. 

You can never go wrong with Bruschetta, but when it's made with fresh Ingredients, and the skill behind the kitchen that is Mona Lisa, it's simply Perfection!!!!

author: Isaac H.
text: Came here on a Tuesday, the food was just alright and the service was alright as well. Nothing to brag about at all.

author: Trina T.
text: Came 2 days in a row. Although it's a busy place, they seated us quickly both days. Cesar salad is delicious, the pasta is fabulous. Service is exceptional. Every table is good. Make this a place to come when in San Francisco.

author: Robert U.
text: Meh.  Nice authentic Devore, but the pasta sauce was very mediocre, the steak I ordered was over cooked.  The service was also mediocre.  The food and experience was not worth the price.  It's not bad, just a very expensive and mediocre restaurant.

author: Megan D.
text: Best authentic Italian restaurant in SF! The only thing better than the food is the service. Everyone is so nice, and the owner is amazing and knows how to take care of everyone who passes through the door. I'd give them 10 stars if I could!

author: Rachel M.
text:
This review is for the most amazing Gnocchi I have had in a very long time! My husband and I live in Fremont and drive in to the city, just to have this Gnocchi. We have even ordered it on take-out and reheated it a few hours later. It was still AMAZING! Light, melt in your mouth, gnocchi! We've tried all the different sauces they have to offer and they are all yummy! The Pesto, the gorgonzola, and even the Gnocchi Sorrentina (the tomato sauce based gnocchi) is great! The staff are friendly and the atmosphere is fun. 
Thank you Ristorante Mona Lisa!

author: Marie S.
text: Oh my goodness can you say amazing authentic food!!! I was on family vacation and needed a place for 7 people that would take a reservation I came across this gem on yelp, once I seen the pictures and reviews I knew I had to try it. Staff was very kind, food did not take long to come out. It is Italian food the the portion sizes were very well worth it. I would definitely come back.

author: Corine M.
text: I would give this place 5 stars for food quality but the service tends to be hit or miss so for this review four stars it is. We have been here several times and this trip to San Francisco came just for Mona Lisa food.  Had a reservation without issues. Great selection of food...one of our favorites is the lobster ravioli, but honestly everything is delicious.  Their bread is average.  Unfortunately our waiter forgot to put in our order and never came back to clear our plates after our appetizer or the salads.  Service does tend to be on the slower side usually so if you are in a rush you will have to keep onto of your waiter. The food always trumps the service and will always bring us back.  Of course we will be back again next time we are in town.

author: F B.
text: This place was kind of mediocre. I've honestly had better Italian food before in my hometown. I was a little put off by the slow service. We weren't even there on a busy night. It's almost like we were forgotten. Our food finally came after waiting 45+ minutes. Ridiculous. This place was talked very highly of during one of our tours we took, but honestly I don't see why? I probably won't be going here again.

author: Casandra H.
text: Amazing food, staff and atmosphere! The food is authentic, delicious and fresh. Great wine list too!

author: Charlotte G.
text: Good food, service, and ambiance. Got the Vegetarian Lasagna and Gnocchi Ruggero and it was really good. Their food is very filling, the Lasagna is enough to share. Overall happy with our choice!

author: Kevin T.
text:
I'm in Frisco a lot with work,  but when here at Mona Lisa, I feel like I'm back east at a family reunion.  Great service that goes well beyond keeping your water & wine glass full. 

I have never had a meal there I would not recommend.  They are all delicious and modestly priced for SF.  

Maurizio is your host and genuinely welcomes all. If you can speak some Italian, you will find yourself having a great time chuckling up with the Maurizio and the staff as they truly enjoy hosting patrons with a jovial graciousness rarely seen.

The Pastas here are renown and the veal dishes are superb. For something lighter, my personal favorite if I am not quite up for a big meal is the Antipasto Misto ($19.95).  It is a very well presented platter (see my pics) of thinly sliced meats (prosciutto crudo, salame and soppressata), olives, cheeses and peppers.  It makes for a meal in itself and goes so well on the front patio with a favorite glass of wine.

author: Isabel M.
text: Came across it by accident and it was he best thing that has ever happened to me. Literally so delicious and authentic. 10/10 would recommend!

author: Sharon P.
text:
Great service and atmosphere!
We both had spaghetti and it was amazing !
Healthy wine pour!

author: Erra C.
text: I love Mona Lisa. A true Italian feel. Food is good. The experience is excellent. Everyone is very friendly.

author: Sal L.
text: Had my wedding dinner here and the dinner and staff was amazing. Service was awesome and the staff was very friendly and accommodated our every needs. I want to thank the crew at Mona Lisa for our great experience. Thank you

author: Dana C.
text: Seriously everything I desire in a night out on the town with food and drink was fulfilled tonight. Outdoor ambiance, excellent wine and the most amazing lasagna. All next to my husband. Thank you!

author: Jen B.
text: Fantastic food, great service, authentic ambiance! I would highly recommend! The homemade gnocchi was to die for!!

author: Fang L.
text: It's an excellent restaurant. Their foods are wonderful! They have fabulous deco and service is good. Highly recommend this Italian restaurant.

author: Marissa S.
text: The food was pretty delicious but the service wasn't that great. Our waiter was rushing us the whole meal.

author: Sarah F.
text:
First off: this is absolutely NOT a place for a quick dinner. But if you're looking to spend a whole evening with good food and good wine, it's perfect.  

I mostly only had wine (of which there's a good selection), but I did steal some bites from others in my party, and it was all delicious. I'd love to come back when I have more room to eat!

author: Michael G.
text:
The greatest Italian food and the best service in San Francisco.  They treated our table of six like family.  They helped us celebrate my wife's birthday on our 06/26/17 visit with a beautiful dessert and a room full of singing.
The owner is fantastic as he orchestrates the flow of the restaurant while visiting his guests at the table.
A+, first class establishment.  Cannot wait to visit again.

author: Jen W.
text:
Just alright, decent food.  When we came, the place was ridiculously packed.  I mean, I felt like we were sitting elbow to elbow at our tables.  

The hostess at the front was super friendly...and had an awesome memory.  She didn't miss a step when figuring out who was next for a table.

Anyhoo, we had ordered a bottle of wine.  Apparently, they were out so the server literally ran to the other restaurant in their chain to grab one.  He ran back to us, cracked open the bottle, and it was delicious.  

The food...wasn't as great.  I ordered the spaghetti bolognese...doesn't get any simpler than that.  It was alright...we went home and made it ourselves the next day.  Much better when it's made at home...

The sampler was pretty good though.  It came with a melted garlic cheese thing (Sicilian candy), bruschetta, and caprese.  Haha.  

3 stars...but I probably won't be back.

author: M H.
text: When I lived in San Francisco I would dine here at least once a week, and always brought my visiting guests. I often think about hopping on a plane just to come in for lunch. Living in LA now, haven't found anything like it. I hope to visit SF soon, just so I can eat here.

author: Owie N.
text:
Decent place to get Italian food with a huge menu selections. Can be overwhelming when looking at menu.  Love the decoration and the vibe at this place. I ordered:

- Antipasto Misto: mix of prosciutto crudo, salame, cheeses, olives and soppressata.

-Ravioli Aragosta (lobster) with tomato cream sauce.

-Spaghetti allo Scoglio: white wine sauce with shrimps, clams, mussels and calamari.

Everything tasted alright to me but nothing scream out spectacular. The service was friendly so that is always a plus.

author: Erica S.
text:
Food is great, service is wonderful and Maurizio?...... Is number ONE!!!
A special place to spend a night in good company. Great atmosphere!

author: Scott H.
text:
From the moment we walked in we felt this place was special. If there were a checklist for great service, this place could check off all the points. Fast? Check. Personable/ attentive waitstaff? Check. Incredible food? Check.  The atmosphere was awesome on a Saturday night, it was busy and bustling but we still were tended too frequently!
Highly recommend this place. And try the tiramisu!

author: Vanessa G.
text: Ambience = A....Squid ink risotto = A. They don't skimp on the expensive squid ink and it's amazingly flavorful!

author: Sierra B.
text: I absolutely love this restaurant! I came across it one day walking down Columbus and the staff is very friendly! I tried their calamari as a appetizer and ordered a chicken fettuccine as a entree. I had Wasef as my waiter and he was AMAZING! Even thought they were super busy inside he still was able to help me with any questions I had. I definitely recommend him as a server! The Owner Maurizio is very friendly and welcoming!! I highly recommend this restaurant weather your a tourist or live around the bay it's simply wonderful! Will definitely be coming back ASAP

author: Diane B.
text: Great authentic Italian Food! My husband had the chicken parmigiana and I had the Lasagna both were excellent and made with fresh ingredients. The owner is friendly and the ambiance is true Italian. Excellent!

author: Andrew T.
text:
Don't quite know why everyone is bashing on the restaurant so much. The staff was friendly and provided good service. Food was cooked well and quite tasty. Desert was good but was not cooked fresh since it was frozen. I would reccomend you check it out if you like Italian food. 

Remember! Tony bennet went here so it must be good!

author: Dina J.
text: One of my girlfriends and I spent a day in the city and decided on some Italian food. We came across this place. It's definitely filled with character and culture. It's a cute spot for a date, candle lit dinner. The staff was very friendly! We ordered some pasta and cioppino and couple glasses off wine, but with that they threw in a free appetizer in the beginning and free dessert in the end! The appetizer was what seemed to be a sampler of cheeses and meats. Very good! The dessert was some type of ice cream which was also good! That is what I call great hospitality. Little gestures like this definitely makes guests want to come back! So thank you! Great food and very authentic.

author: Paul V.
text: Looking for a great traditional Italian restaurant, look no further. Amazing food and service

author: Laurie R.
text: The ONLY reason this place gets 4 stars is because of the food and the atmosphere. As most reviews state, the service is awful. Even the owner was laughing at his not so friendly slow server telling him to hurry up and that he is lazy. Not professional, but pretty damn funny. I had the chicken a magio, which was a chicken breast filled with ham and mozzarella cheese with a tomato sauce. It was absolutely delicious. My bf had the seafood pasta, which is what I usually always get  when I go to place like this in the bay, But I had it the night prior in Oakland. It's a good life, yes I do know this! I recommend the food, not the service

author: Jezabel C.
text:
LOVED THIS PLACE. It's so good. My boyfriend & I ordered the pesto, fettuccini Alfredo & calamari as an appetizer. So so so good! The owner is really friendly & caring and the decor of the restaurant is so romantic & nice!
The reason why it's 4 stars & not 5 is because it took 40 minutes to get our food. I know we had an appetizer, but I mean c'mon, it doesn't take 40 minutes to make pasta and the restaurant wasn't even full.. But either way! I really liked this place & if I'm back in SF I'll go back :)

author: R B.
text:
My family and I visited San Francisco, Monday last week and we decided to take the boys to a nice Italian place for their birthday dinner.

The Mona Lisa won it in spades! 
The decor and ambiance made it seem like something right out of a movie, I half expected to look over and see Robert DeNiro and Joe Pesce eating at a table.

We were warmly greeted and seated almost immediately, the service was great, Matteo was our server an he was happy to answer our menu questions and had great wine reccomendations. 

When Matteo learned it was our boys' birthdays,  he made them feel special, we felt like we were getting the VIP treatment.

The food, the food was amazing, some of the best Italian cuisine I've ever had. 

We know where were going for dinner next time we travel up to San Francisco!

author: Amanda R.
text:
My boyfriend and I are on vacation here from Austin, Texas and stumbled upon a whole neighborhood of Italian restaurants. We looked at the menu outside and a group outside told us that the food was amazing and that we had to try the mini calzones. We decided to give it a try. 
We were seated by a very friendly man whom I pretty much assume is the owner. He was great! Asked us if we spoked Italian. We don't but he did! Fantastic! 
The place is very decorated. It's very busy decor but almost cozy. Fun to look at. Real table clothes, gas lamps, bread and water in funky bottles as soon as you sit down. Awesome. 
Biggest complaint? Service. 
We waited 5-10 min to be greeted by our server. It wasn't busy. I heard the two servers talking about what tables to take. They were the only one on as far as I could tell before dinner rush actually started. 
The appetizer we got was ice cold. The waiter took them back and then told us that they were out of it so we got the mini calzones. Which were great. 
Main course was okay. My boyfriend loved his NY strip that he got. Although it was a little more done than what he asked for.  I got the chicken parmigiana and was so disappointed.  The chicken was tiny and tough and it cost $22.95!!!! 
My boyfriend wanted another beer and had to ask twice to get one. I asked for another glass of wine and never got it. The waiter was not attentive at all. Forgetful? Preoccupied? I could tell he was in the weeds but come on. Ask for some help from your co workers! 
Overall I paid $127 to treat my boyfriend to a birthday dinner that we will mostly remember by the terrible service of our waiter. :(

author: Connie G.
text:
Mona Lisa in the flesh of flavors!!! While traveling to this area I really wanted some real traditional Italian food.  This place really hit the spot! The staff greeted us in Italian and we had a place to sit right away during lunch.  It was so romantic :) the eye candy made it a great dining experience as well haha! 
Now to the food! We had free bread, oil, and vinegar 

Fettuccine alla Piero - 20.95
light cream sauce, with shrimps and asparagus

So good!!!!! I mean really really good!!! It was served hot, fresh, and full of flavor! 

The waiter was very tentative to the table and that accent! haha! 

 I liked the oil and vinegar so much I bought some from the market next door! I had to have a to go box and even brought it all the way back to SD the next day to eat or lunch! 

Traditional, Romantic, Unique, and Enjoyable! What does that spell! TRUE Review!

author: Henry K.
text: Very friendly staff. They recognize me as a returning customer every time I come here. Food is great, lots of seating available and probably my favorite Italian food in SF.

author: Chuck T.
text: Just arrived late in the day and we started looking for somewhere to eat. Simply this place was great! The only real complaint? The place is tiny, I kept getting bumped by people walking by. Mad the foolish mistake of trying another Italian restaurant  ( wanted to try something else ) and that was an epic fail.

author: Tracie B.
text: Food is always delicious and great service. A real authentic Italian experience and a large varied menu with something for everyone.

author: Kyle B.
text: Molto bene! We enjoyed the most delicious dinner. The bruschetta was amazing and the ravioli ai quattro formaggio was the most fabulous ravioli I've ever tasted.

author: Eugene K.
text: Great food, great service, very accommodating! We were searching for a place for the family and were greated by owner outside in Italian.

author: Andy R.
text: One of the best authentic Italian restaurant so far I have ever been to. The cheese tastes amazing. And if you are a foodie, you can tell that, the difference in the quality. Highly recommended and please have a reservation in advance if you don't want to stand in a line and wait. But it's worth it.

author: Sami M.
text: Food was pretty good. I would recommend getting pasta instead of pizza (pizza was pretty average but pasta was delicious). Pizza was only average because our waitress put pepper on it. Not crushed pizza peppers but straight up BLACK GROUD PEPPER, and she never checked back with us after our food took almost 45 minutes to come. So in conclusion good food but bad service.

author: Bon V.
text: Pricey but tasty. Their house salad dressing is great. Large portions. Light red and spicy red sauces are well done. Great alfredo and pesto. Friendly and polite service. Inflated North Beach prices really warrant a 3.5 rating. However, my family had a very nice experience and we would return.

author: Allyson H.
text:
Well, Valentine's Day is definitely not the day to eat here. So far, it's taken at least fifteen minutes to get water....just got it after 18 minutes.
I can overlook the long wait for the water since the wine was plentiful and food delish but would still avoid on Valentine's Day.

author: Karina P.
text:
Salmon Carpaccio is only big slices of salmon with few onion rings and small capers. No oil, no balsamic. Bruschetta is the same quality - old tomatoes and old leaves of basil. I called  Italian owner of restaurant, he was not happy to know that his food is too far from Italian style. He told me - Look to my small  eyes, I am Chinese. It was bad joke, I don't like racists. We did not eat more, pay and leaved this place.

I can't write comment here and I answer you in my review.
Thank you for your comment, hope my review will help you work better.
We visited your restaurant 02.23 around 5pm. I was with my friend Susanna. We travel a lot, and I visited Italy few times in the year. So I love this country and know taste of Italian food. I am sorry I did not make photos. Wish to your personal respect guests more.

author: Hailey D.
text: Well, the wine was great! Unfortunately that's the only positive thing I have to say. We waited 20 minutes for drinks, and an hour and a half for our food to come out. My husband's wasn't the warmest, and my food was cold. I hate sending dishes back, but my chicken was just too cold to enjoy. Definitely over priced as well.

author: Nick K.
text: Great service. The majority of the people working and eating spoke Italian, which was a great indicator of how good the food was. Pizza and pasta was amazing.

author: Yarden H.
text: The service was terrible. Plenty of time before responding to it. The food arrived cold. And the price is not justified

author: Michael A.
text: The restaurant had great service, and a cool, busy atmosphere. The food, however was disappointing. Both pasta dishes we ordered were "starchy" and heavy. Disappointing, especially for a North Beach Restaurant.

author: Charlie S.
text: Coming here was such a pleasant experience! My partner and I were wandering around North Beach and were drawn to the restaurant because of how charming and classy it looked on the inside. As we were browsing the restaurant menu outside, one of the waiters stepped out to invite us in and told us about an appetizer special they were having, which immediately made us feel welcome. The staff was incredibly polite and attentive. And the food was awesome. I definitely recommend the lobster ravioli (I forget the Italian name on the menu) because it was by far the best I've ever had. This is a place I would love to come back to!

author: Christina Y.
text:
I give this place a solid 4 stars. My friend and I were exploring North Beach and decided to dine at one of the many Italian restaurants we passed by. Mona Lisa gave us a vibe we didn't get from the other restaurants. Plus, they had a car outside which you could dine in.

Since it was such a beautiful day, we were seated outside so we could enjoy the weather and people watch. Split the lobster ravioli and the signature Mona Lisa pizza. I wasn't blown away with the pizza but it was still delicious. Loved the lobster ravioli though! I would have finished the entire dish if I hadn't had to share.

Extra brownie points:
-The server was extremely attentive, making sure we had clean plates, utensils, and our water was always full
-The table next to us had ordered a salad which came out twice, and our server decided to let us have it rather than having it go to waste. The dressing was yum!

I always question restaurants that are located on the big streets but Mona Lisa was delicious!

author: Tara H.
text: I have never written a yelp review before, but this was the worst service I can ever remember having. Bad food and wine didn't help. I don't want anyone else to waste their time here. Being in the industry, my expectations were  already really low for this place but they weren't as low as what I experienced. I thought I'd at least get a decent pizza and glass of prosecco - not the case.

author: Elisha B.
text: Great service. Kind environment! I always enjoy going in and feeling like I am in someone's home. One of my favorite places in SF.

author: Chad M.
text: I've been eating here for years when I come to San Francisco. Mauricio the owner is always so hospitable and the food is absolutely amazing. Being married into an Italian family, I'm picky about Italian food and this is one restaurant I can't wait to get to. Personally, my favorites are the bruschetta and cheeses as an appetizer, I'm a chicken parmigiana fan and this is hands down amazing with the substituted penne instead of the roasted potatoes and spinach, although those are great too! The desserts won't disappoint. I'm baffled that the star level isn't at least 4 stars here. You won't be disappointed. Buon appetit

author: Julian G.
text: Great restaurant. The food is well blended with the mixture of sauces and seafood. Delicate taste. Beautifully prepared and served. The staff is formal and well organized. Very polite. Not too easy on the wallet but its worth it. Seated and served within 15 mins

author: Christina Bella P.
text: We ate at this place a few years ago which was our time in SF.. the food was awesome .. the staff was amazing ... loved all the decorations !! You won't be disappointed !!!!!

author: Chow W.
text: Moricio the manager is awesome our waiter was Roberto awesome absolutely the best Italian restaurant me and my  wife have eaten at . She is a vegetarian and they had about 25 things to choose from. They all speak Italian to each other that was cool . No canoli but that is my only thumb down

author: Taylor H.
text: We chose this restaurant because they had plenty of gluten free options for my friend I was with. The restaurant has a very authentic feel with all of the workers greeting you in Italian and the ambiance of the place. Great bread to start off with, they even gave us a free (huge) appetizer on the house! The margherita pizza was so good, but I could only finish half. My friend devoured her gluten free pasta. Lovely staff, delicious food!

author: Veronica C.
text:
Came to Mona Lisa on Saturday to meet up with my friends.  Unlike other Italian restaurants in and around the block, this place had very little wait.  The decor was really nice but the seating was very cramped.

Had the spaghetti carbonara - pancetta, eggs and cheese for $13.95.  The portion size was acceptable; not large, not small either...but this dish was just unappetizing.  The pancetta bits tasted so salty and the pasta itself lacked any flavor.  My whole plate of pasta was sauceless and yet was really greasy.  I felt gross eating it after a few bites :(

Extremely slow service and not the most friendly either.  Our food came out 1.5 hrs after ordering, so we filled ourselves up with complimentary bread as we waited.  If you are in a hurry, this might not be the best place to go (we spent over 3 hours total for dinner!).

author: michael b.
text: Anytime I'm in SF (Go Giants!) I must stop here! By far the best Italian food I have EVER had! Authentic food, quality ingredients, great staff that is friendly. I have known the owner for many years and he always makes us feel like home! This is southern Italian food which means the flavors are bolder, more red sauces etc. the bruschetta is amazing! Fresh and great favors! I love my chicken parm even though it's not really Italian but it's awesome! I have been coming here since the late 90's and never had a bad meal! I always tell my friends to come here and they always thanks me for the great food suggestion! Keep up the great work! Yum!!!

author: Michael D.
text: Great food! We ate in the car! We were famous for a night. Lots of tourists took our picture. An experience of a lifetime.

author: Angelina S.
text:
My first time here - highly recommended by my local foodie freinds. Homemade pasta was soooo good. Sicilian candy aka over roasted garlic cloves - delicious. Suggest the Italian sampler : bruschetta - caprese - Sicilian candy.
Will be back.

author: Akrem A.
text:
This place is really awesome. 
I came here with a girlfriend and everybody was very welcoming. We got a nice table and the server was pleasant and professional.
Great food and awesome service. I have been to Italy several times and am usually disappointed by Italian restaurants in SF. Mona Lisa was worth my time and money. I will definitely come back.

author: Alexis I.
text:
I came here with my boyfriend for our first Valentine's Dinner because my old roommate recommended it. We made reservations 3 months in advance because we were worried about the Vday rush. Luckily they seated us immediately next to the window even though we were an hour early. The seating was pretty cramped and the tables were so tiny that there was hardly any room for the bread and our two entrees. I think the decor was too cluttered so it was kind of distracting.

Other than that, this place is a definite must if you're a risotto-fiend like me, because they have at least 20 different selections to choose from on the menu. I gotta give them props on their menu because it was kind of hard to decide what you want cause the menu they show on yelp does not compare to the lengthy amount they actually offer at the restaurant.

I ended up getting the crab and asparagus risotto and boy was that plate larger than I was expecting. Still had enough to take home for leftovers! When it was served the food was still steaming hot, freshly cooked from the kitchen and was absolutely scrumptious. The risotto was mouthwatering and as soon as you take a bite, it's just heavenly because it had such a creamy consistency. Finished the night off with a cappuccino tartufo, which was a perfect end to the meal.

I highly recommend this place, because of the intimate ambiance, friendly staff, and the food is just too delicious to pass up!

author: Wasef B.
text: That's probably one of the best Italian restaurant i ever been to. The owner is very funny the service is great but the best part is the food. I ate in different Italian restaurants in San Francisco but this one is special. I started with a typical Italian antipasti very fresh and tasty, as main course i had lasagna it was plenty of meat and cheeses i can still taste it in my mouth. The best meal i had in San Francisco. Thank you Mauricio.

author: T S.
text: Seven of us, 4 adults and 3 kids. went there for the first time for an early dinner after a day of being tourists.  Everyone really enjoyed their food. The service was impeccable, 5 stars. We never felt rushed. Our waiter made us feel like guests in his home. Three of us couldn't decide what to order and asked the Waiter for his opinion. Wow, were we glad we listened to his recommendations! Everything tasted fresh and authentic. I had the spaghetti and meat balls delicious, my wife had the bolognese which she thought was good but not as good as the meatballs. Overall great experience! 2 appetizers 2 bottles of wine 6 entrees $225, an excellent value and 3 of us couldn't even finish our meals, so we get leftovers too!

author: Mando R.
text:
We live across the Golden Gate so do not come into San Francisco often as with traffic it is 1 1/2 hours or so but when we do and we want authentic southern Italian Food as the paternal side of my family is from Calabria, we come to this ristorante. Mauricio treats us, and all customers, as family.  The photo with the Spaghetti allo Scoglio and also sometimes I have pasta only with Calamari with double the tentacles and I usually joke that there is more seafood than pasta. These dishes are better than many times I have had in Italia. Mauricio is  very generous as he sometimes and we are only 2 people, gives us on the house a of tower of antipasti, salmon(lox), fried calamari, mortadella, capicola, prosciutto, formaggi, olive, bruschetta etc. I tell him joking that we are so full to " take home the entrees" !!! So now I tell him he does not need give us anything but as he is a "Capa Tosta"---I can get away with saying this as I am half Calabrese/half Pugliese--instead of the Torre Calabrese only una Barchetta like the small boat in the Neapolitan song 'Santa Lucia".

When I am here I can close my eyes, Italian music in the background, Italian being spoken by waiters & the beautiful different plates of delicious Italian food being taken to the tables of customers make me feel like I am in Italia. The smiles on their faces indicates they love the food.

=============================================================
Per i turisti italiani nostalgici per l'Italia, all'interno con Mauricio, camerieri italiani, il cibo e l'ambiente, vi sentirete come se foste in Italia

Viviamo attraverso il Golden Gate, così non veniamo in San Francisco spesso come con traffico è 1 1/2 ore o giù di lì, ma quando lo facciamo e vogliamo autentico cibo italiano del sud come il lato paterno della mia famiglia dalla Calabria, arriviamo a questo ristorante. Mauricio tratta noi e tutti i clienti, come famiglia. La foto con Spaghetti allo Scoglio e anche a volte ho pasta solo con Calamari con doppia i tentacoli e ho solito scherzo che c'è più pesce che pasta. Questi piatti sono meglio di molte volte quanto ho avuto in Italia.   Mauricio è molto generoso come lui a volte e siamo solo 2 persone, ci dà sulla casa una torre di antipasti, salmon(lox), calamari fritti, mortadella, capicola, prosciutto, formaggi, olive, bruschette ecc. Li dico scherzando che siamo così pieni di " dar portare a casa l'entrées"!!! Così ora io gli dico che non ha bisogno darci nulla, ma come lui è una "Capa Tosta"----posso farla franca con questo dicendo come io sono metà Calabrese/mezza Pugliese -- anziché il Torre Calabrese solo una Barchetta come la piccola barca nella canzone napoletana ' Santa Lucia ".

Quando sono qui posso chiudere mio occhi, sottofondo musicale italiana, italiano, essendo parlata da camerieri & belle diverse tavole di delizioso cibo italiano prese ai tavoli di clienti mi fanno sentire come se fossi in Italia. Il sorriso sui loro volti indica che amano il cibo.

author: Polly X.
text: Love this restaurant, its in my neighborhood North Beach, and always have a great time there, with the great food, ambience and Mauricio the owner, is just the best and he  goes out of his way to make sure we have a really nice time there.  I originally come from New Zealand and when I have out of town guests from New Zealand come I take them there as  they love it so much too.  Cheers/Grazie Mauricio!

author: Diana Y.
text: What a friendly staff and a generous pour of chianti wine by the glass!  and the outdoor dining on the sidewalk is perfect for eating/drinking/people watching/relaxing while taking in the sites of this wonderful section of San Fran.  I will definitely go back.

author: Aaron G.
text: Stopped in for dessert. The tiramisu was excellent. It was moist and creamy. The staff was nice. The ambiance was nice, too.

author: Alex A.
text: Probably this is my favorite Italian food restaurant in San Francisco I just love their seafood pasta with white wine sauce , I been here so many times and is always a good experience, give it a try .

author: Benjamin P.
text: Best Italian cousine I had so far in San Francisco. I was actually walking for an early dinner in another restaurant, but saw the beautiful vintage car the restraint had set as additional table on the street and decided to stay. Risotto porcini wad excellent and highly recommended. The choice of lambrusco they suggest was at the right temperature and refreshing for hot afternoon.

author: Daniela O.
text: Amazing service!! Best Italian place in San Francisco! Food was great, owner is very kind and willing to serve, the price was average.

author: Megan K.
text: Excellent service, warm inviting Italian decor and the best vegetarian lasagna I have ever had.  All meals come with complimentary fresh bread and the night we came they threw in toasted bread with olives and tomatoes.  Great place and cute too!

author: Catherine N.
text:
We hesitated on coming here with the bad reviews. But we took a chance since our two other choices had 1+ hour wait. Are we glad we did. Not sure why the bad the reviews on the wait. We didn't have to wait long at all. 

The cioppino is to die for!  The caprese, pizza, aglio e olio, and lasagna were all good too. The Alfredo was just meh. We are definitely coming back here again.

author: Ashley D.
text:
Decent food, TERRIBLE service. 
PROS: The atmosphere was nice (decor, music, etc.). My husband loved his prosciutto calzone, and my friend liked his gnocchi pomodoro. You get complimentary bread, balsamic vinegar, and olive oil. 

CONS: The service! 
1. We went today around 1:30. It was not busy at all...one other group of 4 was there at that time. It got busier about 30 minutes after we had sat down. First, the restaurant was open for business, but the door was locked. We knocked, looked confused, and no one came to open the door for us. We finally got in because a customer came out of the restaurant. No one greeted us, and we were standing there for a few minutes before being seated. He told us from across the restaurant to sit anywhere. He could have at least come to the door where we were standing. Then during our meal, we saw the same "lock out" incident happen to a woman and her 2 children. They were locked out of the restaurant and her husband and friends were already at the table (I saw him flag her through the window to let her know where they were seated. The woman was knocking and waving through the glass window door, while the server was looking at her and made eye contact with her and blatantly IGNORED her! My husband got up and opened the door for her. 

2. It took about 30 minutes before we got our order taken. Additionally whenever we thanked the server for anything he brought us, we were ignored. My linguini tierra was just okay....not bad, but not great. I wouldn't order it again. I'd rather try something else.  

OVERALL, the food was not bad, but based on the service I would not come back here for a long time. I will try other restaurants in the area first. Too bad, because they have a large menu and their pizzas actually look quite good. I am curious to try one.....but the service was unwelcoming, and we felt uncomfortable (as if we were a burden to the server).

author: Fabian G.
text: Horrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrible Sevice!!!!!!!!! We had to get up and try to purchase our beverages. We left after 55 minutes waiting, it was a surprise birthday dinner and unfortunate that we had leave ..  I'll take my business Lee where!!!! FoeHunnid

author: Emily T.
text:
Never ever ever going back ! 

If I could I would give this place zero stars. It was the most disgusting meal I have ever tried. The sauce was so salty. My mouth hurt just after a few bites. On top of the nasty food the service was just pitiful. We waited 30 minutes for the waiter to take our order. And when I complained about their horrific excuse for Italian food they refused to take my plate off the bill. They did however offer to get me a new plate but you couldn't pay me to try another dish from there. So I left the restaurant hungry, pissed off and $19.95 +tax poorer.

author: Lauren B.
text: This establishment is THEE reason we come to San Francisco. The family that owns this fills the restaurant with love. The waiters are sweethearts, and care beyond all needs. PLEASE try out the Mona Lisa. We are always treated like family. Love them all so much! OH and the food, is INCREDIBLE!!!

author: Belle B.
text:
I have recently discovered this fabulous place from a friend who goes here often. You can recognize the restaurant by the wooden vehicle out front (you can also enjoy your meal streetside if you want to by sitting in this car). There's a great ambiance to this place. The people are also extremely friendly and helpful. You are always greeted with great smiles and an uplifting vibe.

Now onto the good stuff....FOOD! Yes it is absolutely delicious! And for me to say that means a lot since I am a little picky when it comes to what I eat. You can tell everything is fresh. We have had the apps (they have a sampler of all the apps...it is 3 tiers of different appetizers if you can't decide) and I have had the veal...yum! I have also just gone for a glass of wine and am still welcomed as I'm enjoying a full course meal with am entire party. Some places rush you out if you aren't having a full meal and spending money, but not this place. Come in for a meal, snack or just a glass of wine. If it is nice out definitely try and sit outside. People watching is great in North Beach. Each experience I have had here supercedes the last. I'm sure I will be back here soon and often.

author: Tina L.
text: The customer service of the place awesome, but the food itself....it wasn't bad yet it wasn't 5 star either. It is a bit on the pricey end for me. Came here today Sunday Feb 12th, 2017 with my sisters in law and my kids. The staff was attentive and sweet they gave us a free appetizer to start. One of my sister in law ordered a seafood risotto, and the other sister in law ordered lasagna, my eldest one ordered kid sized fettuccine alfredo, and my little one and I shared spaghetti with meatballs. The portion for the adult meal in comparison to the kid sized plate was the same. Had I known it was the same portion I would've ordered two kid sized plates. I didn't even finish my spaghetti because it was over flavored and as for the fettuccine alfredo it lacked flavor and was a bit oily for my personal taste. Would I come back maybe, had I ever had better Italian food...yes. Sorry I really really love the friendly staff, but the food as for today just didn't do for my family and I. I was hoping for a 5 star Italian cuisine especially for the prices listed on the menu.

author: N G.
text: Had another great dinner. Anytime we have the opportunity to come to the City we always make it a point to stop in at Mona Lisa. As always the food never disappoints. Had one of my all time favorites, the eggplant parmesan with ham and mozzarella, truly amazing.  The food is always presented beautifully and definitely generous portions. The staff is great, and the owner Mauricio is very personable and ensures everything is running smoothly. This is great Italian comfort food and will always be our #1 North Beach Spot!!

author: Kristin S.
text: I am a happy first timer ! If you love Italian food and happen to be in SF please stop by here and don't waste your time trying anything else! There are very delicious entrees and a variety of selections ! Yes it is like little Italy in there and they have a cute vintage car outside that you can dine in & sight see if that's what your into ! I had the chicken parmigiana which was flavored just right. Many wines to choose from and a small selection of beers ( if wines not your thing ). Can't wait to come back & try more dishes !

author: Chloe A.
text:
First and last time coming here. 

My friend and I came here on Saturday afternoon around 4 pm. There were only 4 other occupied tables in the restaurant. I had questions about the menu and also about tuna tomato sauce. When I asked our server about it he laughed at me, rude much? So I chose the salmone ravioli. Huge mistake! It was almost too fishy and salty to be edible. I was starving so I ate it trying not to gag with each bite. My friend ordered a fettichini style dish with asparagas and shrimp. Her dish was much better than mine. 

When we were finally done, I tried making eye contact and to flag down our waiter for our bill as it was never delivered to us. He never even acknowledged us. I put my card down on the table and still nothing. Finally after waiting over 15 minutes with our plates piled up on the table we were fed up and dropped cash on the table and walked out. 

On our way out the man at the door thanked us for coming in and I told him we would never be back. He acted shocked but at the same time like he didnt even care. 

If you get the server who looks like a horse (look at his teeth) BEWARE!

author: Caroline R.
text: We have come here twice in a week. Both times were amazing. The food, ambiance and service by Josh was terrific. We will definitely be back!

author: Annette O.
text: Just perfect! Mona Lisa was the first Italian restaurant I visited back in September 2015 when I was just arriving to SF. It was also the place I had my first date with my boyfriend and our first choice for spontaneous week day dinner dates. Since day one, the service has been amazing each and every time. The food is to die for! We recommend the Penne al Forno alla Calabrese for the main course and the Bruschettas for appetizer. The owner makes everyone feel like family and all the waiters are attentive and welcoming. Totally deserves a 5 star review and your visit!

author: Catherine R.
text: It was a great place to sit outside with great company. Kitchen is immaculate, restaurant is cute and warm. Staff is great and sweet. Pure Italian language in little Italy in north beach! Awesome trip

author: Lindsay H.
text:
The plan was to walk through North Beach and find a neat little Italian restaurant for dinner. With a mini wooden Italian car parked outside and every inch of wall space inside covered in Italian paraphernalia, this place is definitely quirky and what we were looking for.

Despite the cramped seating, the service was great. The temp inside was insanely hot; halfway through the meal they finally turned the AC on. 

Although the bread came out cold and bland, the rest of the food was delicious. And the portions were just perfect, so four out of five cleaned their plates. Three types of ravioli were ordered; I thought it was cool that they were all different shapes. My chef friend was disappointed that the ravioli was not fresh made and was instead from the freezer (detectable by a tough freezer-burned piece). Interestingly, the menu only listed "homemade" next to a couple of the ravioli dishes (including mine). The sauces were tasty and I especially liked my "Ravioli ai Quattro Formaggi": creamy and rich. I added Italian sausage, which probably would have worked better in a red sauce, but I needed my meat.

Prices were pretty high, especially if some of the dishes are actually defrosted and served. Pasta is cheap and easy to make, so I don't really think the high prices are warranted.

author: Miguel V.
text: I have been here multiple times. The waiters are often busy but friendly. The food itself never disappoints. I would suggest the lobster ravioli or the salmon with esparagus.

author: Ashish N.
text:
I was raised in Italy and I know Italian food very well: my father is a chef and i myself like to cook. 

I went to this restaurant for Christmas eve with my friend because of the good reviews . The environment was very nice and warm but the food was really bad. We both ordered risotto with Porcini.  The rice was overcooked, there was no salt, and no taste at all. Porcini mushrooms were not good either and they tasted strange.

The service was really bad too. The waiters didn't listen to any customers. One of then poured the water all over the table while he was aiming to the glass and didn't do anything about it.

The owner come nearby me and poked me and told me to eat fast. I was horrified by the service. Normally, I do not like to make big deal out of anything at the restaurant so i left without saying anything.


Bottom line: I will never go back to this restaurant and i would not advice anyone to go there.

author: Alison F.
text:
I am a total foodie and I absolutely loved Mona Lisa! The service is impeccable from the moment you walk up and you're greeted by the owner, whom attempted to speak to us in Italian (which I absolutely loved) to the server that was extremely prompt and courteous. I also enjoyed the intimate atmosphere with eccentric decor and open kitchen to be able to watch the cooks prepare your food. They don't have food warmers, which is a refreshing change so your food will come as soon as it's prepared, hot and fresh!
I ordered the lobster ravioli and you could tell by the texture that the pasta is homemade and the lobster is fresh! The sauce was creamy and just the right amount of herbs. My husband had the Napoletana pizza and it was one of the best pizzas we've ever had. The crust was buttery and flaky. 
We enjoyed it so much that we went back another night before we left San Francisco and the owner actually recognized us as we walked up! He had an appetizer sent over to thank us for coming back again. The experience was even better the second time, if that was even possible! This restaurant feels like you're eating dinner with your family in Italy!

author: Carla J.
text:
Mauricio saw us walking past the Mona Lisa and invited us in!  That was a nice way to start dinner - feeling like "FAMILIA!"

It was nice to see olive oil and balsamic vinegar on our table to go with the bread, none of which is in short supply at Mona Lisa Restaurant.  We all drank water with our dinner, and it tasted good (filtered? Although I know SF gets Hetch Hetchy water, so it just might be great tasting anyway).

There are definitely enough choices on the menu to make anyone and everyone happy!  We had two adults, two teens, and two kids in our party.  Everyone was super pleased with their meals.  

We had spaghetti alla pescatore, fettuccini Alfredo, fettuccini with crab, two orders of spaghetti with meatballs, and finally an order of fettuccini Nero with calamari (squid ink in a white wine sauce).  That last one was for me and I was thrilled to see so many tentacles in my dish, not just the rings.  I mentioned loving the tentacles, and so our waiter hooked me up!  His name was Mario F., and he was simply an excellent waiter.  My daughter commented about how impeccably clean his long sleeves were!

The ambiance was fun, and there was definitely a lot to look at on the walls... Even a Mona Lisa that, um, forgot to cover her top half!

author: J. M.
text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  I've been coming here since 2006 and the food is amazing and consistent. This being because Mauricio (owner) takes pride in his business, cuisine, and his employees. His Chef has been here since I have been coming. It's my birthday today and Mauicio hooked us up with appetizers on the house and on top of that let my fiance park in front of the restaurant where the wooden car is so she didn't have to look for parking on Columbus!!! Love the food, the homely feel and the service! I would give them 10 stars if I could. It never is is a problem to have a big party with all my kids and nieces an nephews there. I'm Sicilian and this is home in North Beach for me. Go eat, laugh, be loud, bring your kids and be merry!!! Bon appetito

author: Margery M.
text:
Our party of 6 had the best time at the Mona Lisa last night! This is a great place for a group of friends to meet for excellent food and service, in a fun, inviting atmosphere. Mario our waiter was so patient, accommodating & fun! Because we got there early (6pm) the owner allowed us to park right in front of the restaurant! (Call ahead).
My gnocchi with shrimp in a tomato sauce was delicious and hot with plenty of shrimp. Everyone had a fantastic time. Some people sat outside at little tables sipping wine. They have a neat little vintage Fiat convertible parked outside.

author: Carlo B.
text: I had lunch there with my family and the waiter, who was angry for some reason I couldn't understand, kept cursing in Italian. Most of the customer  there do not speak Italian so cannot understand but if you understand it's not a very pleasant experience. Furthermore the food is average quality and very expensive.

author: Cindy C.
text:
1. LOVED eating in the Mona Lisa Car! But, you'll get A LOT of attention from people walking on street. 
2. Food was alright, pricey tho. 
3. Service was alright.

author: Michaela S.
text: So great!! My family went for lunch and were extremely impressed by the authentic Italian feel with decorations, opera music in the background, and staff from Italy itself. The menu is incredibly long with tons of great choices and the food did not disappoint. The servers were so friendly and even chased me down the street when I forgot my purse! I highly recommend Mona Lisa.

author: Stephanie W.
text: Everything here, from the service, to the food, to the ambiance is amazing. The owner greeted us at door on a Friday night and got us in ASAP. They have a great wine selection- I love the Pinot Grigio. I had the arugula salad with chicken and I'm just so bummed I didn't have more room in my stomach (thanks a lot delicious bread) My two friends also really enjoyed their meals. We all love here in San Francisco and are willing to fight the throngs of tourists to get to this gem. If you want authentic Italian, Mona Lisa is it.

author: Patty D.
text: Overly salty and burnt lasagna. We came here because the restaurant next door had a wait and we were starving. I ordered a lasagna becaise it's just something you can't go wrong with. But at Mona Lisa, apparently you can. I had two layers of pasta and the lasagna was topped with chunks of meaty sauce and burnt chunks of sauce and pasta. Out of hunger, I peeled all the burnt bits and ate it, and when I brought up the burnt lasagna chunks to the waiter, he simply said it's supposed to be that way because it was in the oven. Disappointing.

author: Bennett E.
text: The owner was hilarious and accommodating--very friendly. Our server Josh was one of the best servers I've ever had.  I'm a server myself and was legitimately impressed by him. He was kind, funny, and informative.  The food was equally as good as the service. This is absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in North Beach, I 100% recommend this place.

author: Luna S.
text:
The decorations are tacky and overwhelming.
The meat in my lasagne tasted like $1 Walmart meat.
The waiter was acting like he was better than everyone else.

author: Rick C.
text: Oh God,  that was good!  The spaghetti with sausage tastes like grandma is in the back making the sausage fresh.  Every bite is an explosion in your mouth!  You have to try the mix antipasto...  Yum!

author: Cheryl L.
text: Service was suberb.  Enjoyed the fresh food.

author: Adrian P.
text:
My wife and I went here for dinner one day thinking it would be like a place we visited in New Orleans called Mona Lisa, that we loved. Unfortunately it was not. 

My wife ordered the chicken parmigiana dinner with penne pasta - the chicken was cooked perfect but the pasta was undercooked. I ordered the spaghetti bolognaise and I don't remember how it tasted... 

The host was very friendly, but our server was very pompous. Would probably never go back.

There are better places to eat if you're in North Beach.

author: Angelica R.
text: For the better part of a decade, whenever I would visit my best friend living in San Francisco, I would pass this restaurant and remind myself that I had to "pop in there some day." Well that day was yesterday. My fiance and I had an impromptu dinner there last night after holding a fundraiser. Granted, I was hungry, but I ordered spaghetti with meat sauce and it was delicious! They introduced me to the wondrous world of calabrese peppers and you can feel the love and family camaraderie of the staff, customers, and owners. If there's anything you can get from this review, ask for calabrese peppers - which I happen to think are on the milder side of hot. Your tastebuds will thank you.

author: Michael O.
text: Just finishing a late lunch. Hit it during happy hour so they served a complimentary appetizer that was splendid. Wine by the glass was fantastic. Then the lasagna arrived. Wonderful, very authentic. The staff and owner were funny and welcoming. I'm sad I live 500 miles away!!

author: Susan M.
text:
We went to Mona Lisa on a recent trip to San Francisco. My husband and I had been once before and it had been very good. This time, however, it was quite marginal for me. I think the rest of my family liked it better than I did.

I ordered the Spaghetti Bolognese and it was WAY TOO SALTY!!! I could not eat it, so I asked the kitchen to add some cream sauce. They looked at me strangely, but did so and it was much better. I still did not enjoy it that much. I think I should have stayed with what I had previously, which was either the veal or chicken piccata.

The bread that came to the table was very good and so was my glass of wine, a Lambrusco. My mother in law enjoyed her food and my husband thought his chicken parmigiana was decent, although it had the same salty meat sauce.

author: Fi M.
text: After over a year we're yet to find a decent Italian restaurant in SF. This definitely isn't it, but we never really thought it was going to be. It's a busy, quirky place in the middle of tourist-ville with a "stack em high, sell it cheap" approach. The pizza was a bit weird & doughy. Should've gone for pasta maybe? My mum was visiting from England & she enjoyed it I think (more the decor/atmosphere than the food though). It is what it is. Probably won't rush back.

author: Diana M.
text:
We went here for my brothers birthday and had the best dinner here. I dont eat italian often because I have never been impressed, but this place turned me into a huge fan. The food was absolutley amazing, everything. The apppetizers, full course meals, and the wine was great. 

The service was out of this world. Greeted at the door and the waier made us feel like we were family. Finally gor the traditional italian experience to the best of my knowledge. I love this place and cant wait to come back. The food is awesome.

author: Gabrielle W.
text: I lived in San Francisco for 15 years from 1989-2004.  I even worked across the street from Mona Lisa for awhile, and I never got the opportunity to try the dining experience here.  Today, visiting on vacation with my family, that all changed, and I'm so grateful.  Having been here a week, we've had many interesting dining experiences.  On the last night of our vacation, I wanted to take our family (visiting from out of state) and local San Francisco guest to a place that would make our time here mean something.  Tonight, Mona Lisa delivered.  When I called for a reservation early in the day, I was greeted with kindness and positivity.  We walked in at 6:30 and we were greeted again with the same upbeat kindness as I experienced on the phone.  We were led to a beautiful and comfortable table and promptly offered drink and menu choices.  They then brought a complimentary antipasti platter, which was delightful.  I have to say, the experience was seamless.  From drinks to apps, to salad, to main course, I was so impressed with how well everything flowed.  I waited tables in this town for years, and I was touched to be in an establishment where pride in service and quality of food still mean something.
