If we were just adults dining here, it would be easy.  But in addition to impressing us, they managed to delight and impress my two small children as well.  I had the gnocchi.  I'm so glad I saved half of it.  It was so good, I look forward to eating the other half for breakfast.  My family raved about how delicious everything was.  Even though we were totally full, we had to order a Tiramisu to share.  I'm so glad we did.  It was perfect like everything else.  As we were leaving, the owner was so kind, inviting us to visit again.  I was looking for the right place to completely make our last night in SF memorable, and from beginning to end, Mona Lisa delivered.  They are humble, elegant, fun, and delicious.  It will be a destination stop on every visit from now on.  Thanks Mona Lisa!  You keep my faith in the heart and soul of a city I truly love.  Great job.

author: Janine R.
text: My son and I were visiting from Yokosuka Japan, when stumbled this quaint little restaurant. Maurizio treated us like we were a member of his family-- we were overwhelmed by the hospitality and personalized attention. The food was awesome and the best I had in a very long time. It was the last meal before our departure the next morning-- so the highlight of our week long trip. Will definitely recommend this place for great service and awesomely delicious food!!

author: Beat K.
text:
Last Thursday was my first time at your fine Ristorante . From the greeting , the carbonara to the service providet by Maria all was very good.
Grazie e Ciao

author: Paul F.
text: We walked down the Italian district in San Fransisco  we were looking for real Italian food as we walked down the street a restaurant owner walked out the front door saw us looking at the menu and put his arms around us and said I have a table left. We went in the place was packed and we were only looking for a drink but decided to have an appetizer we ordered the beef carpaccio  which was fantastic and the fact that it was a family owned place that had real Italian hospitality made the experience. 1st class place i will be back.

author: Courtney D.
text: Amazing service. Amazing people. Amazing food. If you come to San Francisco, come here.

author: Gianna N.
text: Hands down my absolute FAVORITE place in little Italy!! The food is to die for and the service is amazing, they literally treated us like royalty. If you are in the area DO NOT SKIP this memorable gem!!! Also don't forget to take pictures with the antique car!!

author: Jenai C.
text:
This was my first time here at the Mona Lisa. I went to dinner with a friend and she recommended we go here to eat so I was cool with it. My friend speaks Italian and was speaking Italian to one of the guys when we walked so I think the other waiters thought I could speak it too because they started speaking only Italian to us (but English to the other tables) so I felt a little lost and left out, BUT our waiter was very nice, he helped me pick something out from the menu to eat since I couldn't decide on anything. It took the food a little longer to come than the usual waiting time I thought, but I was busy catching up with a friend so I did not mind or really notice it much and I was starving so that helped. 

The overall experience was nice, it was warm and toasty inside, the food was good, and the service was good as well.

author: Jackie E.
text: Better than Italy! I've traveled all over Italy, and my first bite of Fettichini ai gamberoni (fettichini alfredo with shrimp) and almost went to Italian heaven! The owner Maurizio made our party of 12 feel like we were in his home. The food all around was phenomenal and the service spectacular! Come here! Do not pass up this restaurant!

author: Greg M.
text: Camille's in Providence RI is five stars, so these guys get four. The spaghetti and meatballs were great, some nice Italian wines and good service. The food won't blow your mind, but it will fill you up, and the nifty decor and ambiance will make you happy. Can't ask for much more than that. We had some melon-wrapped-in-ham appetizers that were excellent.

author: Alex P.
text:
After trying many Italian restaurants, I keep coming back to Mona Lisa. Been here for the 4th time yesterday evening and can now officially announce Mona Lisa as THE BEST Italian restaurant in SF!

Not cheap, but justified by the food tastiness and quality.

Pasta - real al dente
Sauce - melts in mouth
Meats, poultry, seafood - perfect

Not sure about all unpleasant comments below... I never had (and hopefully never will) a bad experience at this place. Especially pay no attention to some indian dude, who wrote "the pasta was undercooked". That's what a real "al dente" pasta taste like - you idiot! 

Any ass can cook regular pasta at home...

author: Kat D.
text: Great restaurant and people watching. Sit outside if you can, or even in their Fiat 600 if available!

author: Miranda W.
text: Went here yesterday for the first time. Pretty awesome pesto tortellini. Can't really pronounce anything on the menu, so I ordered something that I could pronounce. Real good authentic Italian food though. Would definitely come back and recommend this place for anyone who likes pizza and pasta. There's so many different types of pasta vegetarian, seafood, meaty. Give it a shot, you won't be disappointed.

author: Liz G.
text:
After exploring North Beach with the bf, we had a hankering for Italian and were drawn to the cute outdoor tables at Mona Lisa. 

The service really was impeccable, and exceeded our expectations. The host seated us immediately and water and bread was served shortly thereafter. We were just enjoying mulling over the extensive menu when our host walks by and apologizes for the wait. We hadn't even thought that we had waited a long time and were just enjoying the sunny day. Our waiter came a couple minutes later and again apologized for making us wait, even though we weren't inconvenienced and comped our appetizer for us, which was exceptional given the (lack of) circumstances.

The bruschetta was truly delicious. Tomatoes usually aren't very ripe in January but the tomato topping tasted fresh and flavorful. Our Diavola pizza had a nice, crispy/chewy crust and was scrumptious as well. Our glasses of wine were well-priced and impressive for "house wine". 

Again, the staff literally went above and beyond the call of duty during our meal. We hadn't noticed anything lacking, but they still made our experience memorable. We will be back the next time we want Italian in this neighborhood.

author: Brandon M.
text: Great fresh food. Went around 3 pm just me and my gf, waiter was nice and we had a great experience! Food was a little pricey, but it is SF.

author: Robin F.
text:
I came to Mona Lisa with a friend on my first night in San Francisco. We were seated outside at a cozy table for two (it would've almost been romantic if circumstances were different). Anyway, he ordered a salad and I ordered the prosciutto and melon and we shared a pizza. He enjoyed his salad. i enjoyed my prosciutto and melon and the pizza was eh. A little on the dry side but the prosciutto on top was yummy (can you tell I love the stuff?) 

Overall, dinner was ok, company was better (and better looking). Maybe next time I can try something else and my review might change.

author: Dixon F.
text: In one word, exceptional. I've never had a better meal. Absolutely the best Italian restaurant in the Bay Area, hands down. This place should be on your "need to go" list when you visit San Fransisco.

author: Jesse G.
text: Great service, great food and friendly/fun atmosphere in heart of San Francisco Little Italy.  I will definitely go back!

author: Kevin L.
text: Long list of menu, so be prepared for that. The calamari wasn't hot, big in portion and was "meh". My fork was dirty. Overcooked pasta. Decent flavors though...

author: Joie M.
text: The service was excellent and the staff was even more so. Bravo to my new favorite Italian restaurant!

author: Erika N.
text: Such a great find! The decor was quirky and fun and the service was personal and so welcoming! We had pizza and calzones all around, but all the other food coming out looked fantastic and authentic.

author: Cherie H.
text: Every time we visit San Francisco we eat dinner at Mona Lisa. We're usually in the Bay Area to celebrate a birthday and we include a lovely meal at Mona Lisa. Maurazao, the owner, and the staff take great care of us. The food is delicious!! We love the entire experience!! Grazi

author: Salpi P.
text: Very good Italian food. Portion of salmon could be bigger. Truly enjoyed the atmosphere and the owner/Chef is very warm and hospitable. Delicious Cesar dressing paired with crisp fresh romaine and grated parmigiano cheese. I would definitely go back the next time I visit San Francisco!!!

author: Pearl M.
text: My boyfriend and I came in for lunch yesterday. As we walked by, the Italian waiter and I'm assuming the owner/manager greeted us with smiles and lovely Italian accents (we are Jewish and Israeli so we are as warm and loving as Italians and appreciate the familia hospitality). We conversed back and forth for a minute before deciding to sit and eat. I wanted to order something that wasn't on the menu (gnocchi in fettuccini sauce with shaved truffle... I have a crazy truffle addiction lol) and they gladly accommodated which is always appreciated! My boyfriend got fettuccini pasta with fettuccini sauce, salmon, peas, and mushrooms. My boyfriend also ordered a glass of their house wine (not sure if it was Pinot Noir, Cab, or Merlot lol). The owner/manager also treated us with a plate of delicious assorted appetizers. Everything was exceptional...Including the service! We will DEFINITELY be coming back on our next San Fran trip :)

author: Alana M.
text: All food was delicious!! My husbands chicken dish was bomb!  Tiramisu too die for and risotto with prawns almost too much to finish.  My dad's gnocchi were good but buried under the thick sauce.   Only reason for 3 stars was too crowded, perhaps a few less tables so patrons could move more freely and it would be a much more enjoyable experience

author: William B.
text: From The Olive Garden to Bucca and now I finally got a chance to eat at the Mona Lisa  Restaurant... Which was my very very first time eating at a Italian Restaurant in the Columbus Street area... I had a really good tasting Veal Parmigiana w/ Spinach and Potatoes which came out of the kitchen really nice and hot!!! Not only did, I have the Veal Parmigiana w/ spinach and potatoes... I also liked the sourdough bread as the appetizer...

author: Josh R.
text: da best italian food in da bay, hands down. gnocchi gorgonzola is to die for. I love the decor. The sicilian candy is a must order for appys. great for groups on weekends. my girls favorite spot in north beach

author: Peter K.
text: Great Italian restaurant in the heart of North Beach San Francisco. I love all the decorations on the walls and the history. A bit pricey, but still worth it. There are a lot of Italian restaurants to compete with in North Beach, but they hold their own.

author: Tony L.
text:
I love Mona Lisa. Every trip I have made to San Francisco has included at least one trip to Mona Lisa. 

There is not one thing on the menu that disappointed me. The feel of the whole place is very relaxed and homey. I felt like I could have been at my family dinner table. The place is coated in art and fabric and flags and maps...as if someone just got back from a tour of Italy and had to stash all of their knickknacks somewhere. I love it. 

The food, the wine, the service, the atmosphere...it's all wonderful. You won't leave either hungry or upset that you chose Mona Lisa #3.

Mangia!

author: Melissa R.
text:
We had a wonderful experience at the Mona Lisa!!  We had a party of 18 people and they were more than happy to accommodate us!!  We had a family style dinner with appetizers and it seemed like the food kept coming.  The food was so yummy but my favorite was the eggplant parmigian.

The entire staff was so helpful and really took care of us.  Giovanni was especially attentive and was always making sure everything was good!  We were celebrating 4 birthdays in our family and he sang for each of us.  Mauricio was also especially helpful.

Thank you so much for a wonderful experience, excellent food and excellent service!!  Next time I'm in San Francisco, I will definitely come back!

author: Kristina M.
text:
I was having the most horrible birthday ever when my sister took me to North Beach. I stumbled on the Mona Lisa and decided to eat because of the friendly owner singing Italian out front. I loved it !!! I had a dish that was not on the menu of spaghetti noodles with prawns in a sauca rosa sauce. Which is a creamy version of red sauce. It was wonderful. 
I go back whenever I am there. I love Mona Lisa !!! 
K

author: Cindy K.
text: Totally recommend the coppino (seafood stew ). Service was excellent. Penne San Fran was a solid choice. Seafood mixed grill was mixed reviews, swordfish a little dry. So. Get a bottle of wine, sit back and pick from massive menu.

author: Teddy P.
text: I can't begin to say enough good things about this restaurant. This past Saturday I had made a reservation and we got there a few minutes early, but our table was 5-10 minutes delayed in turning over. As always, Mauricio, the restaurant owner came over greeted us and apologized for the delay. Upon sitting down, Mauricio provided our group with a complimentary appetizer sampler. The food and ambiance here are always on point and their waiters and waitresses are very friendly and knowledgeable. The food here is outta this world, healthy portions and easy to share with friends and family. This is my go to spot in Little Italy - above all else make sure to ask for the tiramisu for dessert. Mauricio - always a pleasure dining in one of my favorite restaurants in SF.

author: Thomas D.
text:
I finally had a chance to visit Mona Lisa Restaurant for lunch.  I enjoyed the service and the ambiance very much.

  The food was so-so.  There was nothing that really stood out as an original inspiration--I had the  Rigatoni Alla Borrelli - 15.95
(baked rigatoni with sausage and eggplant in tomato meat sauce)
This was a bit tasteless even though it included sausage.  It was also oily.  The rigatoni did not taste homemade.  It was overcooked and looked like it could have been leftover from the day before.

The beef carpaccio that we started things off with was good--very true to its Italian roots with arugula, capers, lemon wedges and pecorino cheese.

Dining companions enjoyed the Gnocchi ai Quattro Formaggi - 14.95
(four cheese-cream sauce) and the pizza Calabrese - 13.95
(Garlic, tomatoes, oregano, sausage, cheese)

author: Elisa R.
text: Yummy yummy yummy!  This place is amazing.  We are only in town for 3 days but we will be back! There food is amazing and the owner is too!

author: H S.
text: Great food and great service!! Lovely group of guys! The atmosphere is as authentic at it comes. A must stop if you are in San Francisco.

author: Erika S.
text: Let's start off with saying the food isn't the problem. It's not terrible pizza but it took 40+ min for food. Then they totally forgot about us during the 40 min. After finishing our meal, I asked the owner for a check and his response was "who is your server?" How am I supposed to know that, and then he proceeded to do nothing so I had to track down a waiter to get me a check. As the owner, with all the photos you have around the restaurant showing yourself off, maybe work on your customer service.

author: Kay Y.
text: The fried calamari was on point! The margarita pizza in my opinion was a little too doughy. I was looking for something a little more thin crust but it was good nonetheless. But the crab pasta was the highlight of my meal. It was just perfect.

author: Jonathan G.
text:
My favorite Italian restaurant in the world.

Owner was extremely nice and I felt very comfortable sitting down and eating.  Walked down Columbus ave and was personally invited in Italian to sit down and eat.

Wonderful cozy little spot.  San Fran has a leg up on the rest of the country with getting freshest food.  Great time here and I will visit again when I go back.

author: Julia F.
text: Decent food, but terrible service. Our waitress brought us an expensive dish we didn't order, and the manager refused to take it off our bill. We ended up giving it to the waitress since we didn't want it, but we were still charged for it! Don't come here-- we won't be coming back.

author: Jennifer J.
text:
Been trying to contact the manager via email as well as at the restaurant. My father called and was told "the manager is never at the restaurant." 

If you need more reasons not to eat here - they are missing a toilet seat in the bathroom. 

Your choice.

author: E.J. M.
text:
No joke, THE best Italian food I have ever had and I'm not even in Europe =) I came here with my boyfriend and our friend accidentally. We were originally trying to eat lunch at the restaurant next to this one, but that was closed. I was sucked in here because I love Mona Lisa and the Italian guy at the door greeting people. It was actually kind of embarrassing because we passed the guy at first then decided to eat there. Hah!

We walked in and the greeter asked us where we wanted to eat. As he was leading us towards our table, he said he liked me so he's going to give us free appetizers--- the freshest bruschetta bread!

I ordered the pasta with salmon, my boyfriend ordered alfredo, and our friend ordered chicken with potatoes and other delicious sides. We tried each other's entrees and they were all equally delicious! Like I said from the beginning....THE BEST Italian and pasta I have ever had so far.

Besides the food being amazing, the service was bad ass as well. Everyone there was helpful, friendly, and I loved when they would say "Grazi." The way they said it was so sincere and respectful =)

Basically, every time I visit San Francisco I will definitely make my way over to Little Italy!!!

author: Kristopher K.
text:
Best Italian dinner I've ever eaten outside of Italy- paired with the best atmosphere in all of San Francisco!!

We asked for outdoor seating and were served outside in a convertible Fiat 500!!! Had a wonderful time, GREAT service, amazing views of down town and a lovely night.

Thank you Ristorante Monalisa!

author: Greg S.
text:
North Beach...with a throng of Italian restaurants to choose from, how do you know what's good?

On this particular evening, I let my eyes do the walking. I passed Mona Lisa Restaurant and looked through the open windows to see beautiful chandeliers and ornately painted ceilings. That was enough to pique my interest!

The menu looked to have the standard fare and the wait was only 10 min, so it was decided. When we were seated, the positioning of the table was not ideal; I was sitting in a high traffic area for the wait staff. But I pulled close to the table and made the best of it.

The wait staff were courteous and as attentive as they could be on a busy Saturday night. The kitchen really seemed slow and it took a while for us to get our food. I'm not sure if they were unorganized or if they were just slammed, but for a pasta dish the wait was longer than expected.

I ordered the Penne al Forno alla Calabrese, a baked penne with meat sauce, ham and mozzarella. It was piping hot when it arrived at the table, much to my pleasure. It was overall enjoyable, but nothing spectacular.

Overall, I think Mona Lisa is pretty standard Italian food. It was good, but didn't knock my socks off.

Perhaps next time I'll follow my nose!

author: Ashley P.
text:
OUTSTANDING service, ambiance, and flavors. 

My husband had spaghetti with meatballs, I had the Gorgonzola tortellini with a glass of white zin. The spaghetti was the best we've ever had, and hubby *always* gets spaghetti & meatballs when we eat Italian so we had a lot to compare to. My tortellini was amazing but it was my bad for adding Parmesan cheese to my cheese tortellini which was covered in cheese sauce--a bit too salty for my taste. Next time I'll skip the Parm but we can't wait to go back and re-live the perfection. Bellissimo.

author: Colleen L.
text:
We searched for gluten free restaurants and this one came up. Once we got there, our waiter said we could order any pizza with gluten free crust and we could get any pasta with gluten free fusilli. I decided on the arugula salad and a side of sausage. One friend had the antipasto (lots of meat - great deal for the price) and another had the spinach salad (lots of walnuts) with a side of meatballs. The sausage and meatballs were both great! 

The inside of the restaurant is very neat. The ceilings are painted with murals and it is very colorful. It's in a great area of the city as well. Lots of places to walk around and see

author: Alyssa T.
text: A group of us went here for a friend's birthday. Our waiter was very friendly. After winning him over a bit he even surprised us with a complimentary appetizer! The food was all delicious and the atmosphere was great. Definitely recommend

author: Tony R.
text:
Of all the Italian restaurants in North Beach I chose to come to Mona lisa on an early friday evening, prior to going to the Giants game. The restaurant itself is kinda small and very intimate, the main kitchen is in the front of the restaurant, so you can see and hear as the chefs make your food.

The menu is a little intense, there is a very large selection of pastas, pizza, seafood, chicken, and beef, I felt like I was reading an Almanac. I had a hard time deciding what I wanted but settled on the Ravioli al Quattro Formaggio (homemade ravioli in four cheese sauce) , Mona Lisa Pizza (Pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, peppers, cheese), and the Spaghetti and Meatballs (spaghetti and meatballs lol). 

The food didn't take too long to arrive, when it did at first my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach, my plate had only 6 raviolis and was sure it was not gonna fill me up. The raviolis were really delicious, the However as I continued to eat them I became both full and unable to handle the taste. As delicious as they are, they are very rich and cheesy, It'd be good to get this if you were sharing with someone. The pizza was thin crust, crispy, tasty sauce and full of flavor from the veggies and meat, One of the pizzas is a good portion size, good for 2 people. The spaghetti and meatballs were okay, I mean the dish itself is pretty standard, a good spaghetti isn't gonna wow me that much. Overall I was very pleased with the food here, definitely will be a place I come back to again.

author: Bella B.
text: I was brought here by a friend who is a regular at this spot and I can totally see why! The service is good, food is great and lots of options. I had the mixed seafood grill (the swordfish could have been a tad thicker as it was too dry once I got to it from the hot plate) and my friend had the penne with gorgonzola sauce and chicken. Passed on the wine and desserts as I am not a huge fan of alcohol or mid day sweets but aside from it having very small tables (for two) it was an amazing 1st experience. I would happily return.

author: Gabi T.
text: My husband and I went to Mona Lisa the last weekend and it was awesome! Food was incredible and service was great! We ended up having our meal in the little car they have in front and it was so much fun!

author: Karen W.
text: Great dinner and customer sevice. We thought we were in italy. We will definitely dine @Mona lisa again

author: Adnan O.
text:
It is an interesting story and overall it does deserve 3.5 stars for our experience.
but i see the restaurant manager's effort to make things better this place deserve another chance but god knows when we can find it and i am not even sure that i will give another chance rather than trying new places since we live in midwest :)
But hope fully they will get consistency with the service and food at the same time..

Here is the story:
2 couple + 1 baby.
Late dinner (close to 10pm)
not much customers around. 
------------------
1st of all decor would be really impressing if they did not try to make the restaurant look like a touristic place. All the flags takes away from the beauty and authenticity from the restaurant.  
2-Food was good quality... Not saying amazing but good... 
I love the idea of open kitchen which was partially open so i can see the cooks on duty... 
We've got veggie lasagna, margherita pizza and four cheese ravioli, all of them was really good... 
3-The catch on this place is. at least for us.. waiter did not see us as a spending customer. We did not order any wine or any other expensive things. I do not wanna say he was rude but he was definitely on the edge of it.. He was not disrespectful but sometimes you feel it he can go to that direction really easy and quick. 
Since the service is the most important thing for me for a restaurant i would lean to give 3 stars according to my experience...

end of the story 
food was 3.75
atmosphere (could be 5 but 3.5)
service 3.25

author: Erika M.
text: A group of 4 of us ate here on a Saturday night. We made reservations, so did not have to wait for a table. The atmosphere was great-- Very cozy. The food was delicious!! The wine was awesome. Although our server was very busy, he did his best to not to keep us waiting long and checked in on us frequently. Will definitely be returning next time that we are in San Francisco!

author: Leisa M.
text: Visiting in San Francisco - looking for some authentic Italian! found it at Mona Lisa's! Food was wonderful- we couldn't decide so we took the waiters recommendations- and he was spot on! Very attentive but not annoying- will definitely be back! I don't comment on places but this place was absolutely worth the effort!

author: Brian N.
text:
Went to go to franchino next door but they were closed. Glad we came though! Their pasta fagoli was fantastic and we all had gnocchi which they have about 7 different kinds. Server was straight Italian but very nice and polite.

Recommend for some solid Italian!

author: Daniel P.
text: Hey Grace! I'm definitely willing to give the Mona Lisa another shot! I believe that I'd have a great experience as every business has it's down days. I heard about you guys through Yelp actually a group of my friends and I just decided to stop by and check out the Mona Lisa. Honestly I greatly appreciate that you took the time to yield to my response Grace, it really speaks volumes for you as a manager and your establishment! Hope to hear back from soon.

author: Ellen B.
text:
5 years ago, my husband and I are in town for a marathon event.  We're wandering around North Beach trying to find a lunch spot, and wandered into Mona Lisa.  I knew it was a great place then because all the other tables were occupied by SF finest police officers.  

Fast forward to a few weeks ago, and we wandered in again. Service is over-the-top hand-kissing wonderful!  The menu has options for every palate, including mine, which leans vegetarian.

Okay, so back we go on Saturday after farmer's markets, errands, and other events and experience the same great service, delicious food, options for everyone, and a cappucino to finish the day.

It doesn't hurt that the servers are fantasy-worthy.   Yes.  I said it.

author: Laurie T.
text:
We brought our family of 8 here after the 5:00 Beach Blanket Babylon show on a Sunday. (Note: if you are going to BBB, make your reservation for 2 hours after the show start time). They were extremely crowded, yet did their best to seat all comers, and were very accommodating to us, even though we were 35 min early for our reservation. 

Once we were seated, the server was gracious and prompt, nothing like some of the reviews here. The owner also came over a couple of times - once while we were waiting, and once while we were eating, and also while we were waiting. Everyone who worked there was calm and hospitable. The first thing the server said when we sat down, after asking us if we had to wait a bit, was "I will do my best to make it up to you now". 

The food was delicious and plentiful - probably the best and most important part of the review!  We started with Calamari and Bruschetta, and then we each had either salads or pasta for our entrees. Everyone left happy and felt like it was a great North Beach experience- not easy to achieve on a cold, rainy, crowded holiday evening!

author: Ron S.
text: After visiting Super Bowl city we took a cab to N.B. we were hungry and decided to stop into this place.  Mario was our waiter good service, we started off with some garlic bread, lots of garlic.  I had the chicken Parmigian and friend had the spaghetti both dishes were great

author: A M.
text: By for the best Italian restaurant I ever been too. Food outstanding . The owner Mauricio know his food and customer service . I highly recommend.

author: Addy Z.
text: They sat up pretty fast but 10 minutes later we still didn't have menus.... Finally our waiter came & took our order & 58 minutes later our food was still not ready... I asked our server about our food & after all this time he still had the nerve to tell me "oh is coming, please be patient"...... Definitely not patient at all when you have children with you..,,,needless to say our food was never served & I asked the server to please just pack our order to go. After waiting 1 hour & 15 minutes my children were hungry & tired........not acceptable at all..... they tried to accommodate us but obviously the kitchen wasn't able to keep up with the orders....., way, way too long of a wait when you have kids with you.

author: Vinny V.
text: Where else in SF can you be served in a convertible Fiat on Columbus St?! As a birthday surprise I reserved the Fiat Car, and the girl loved it. The food was great, and so was the staff. The owner Maurizio was great to meet, and he even stepped in as photographer so we could have pics of the great night. I'll be back here soon, because I can honestly say that for the complete experience, it was the best date money I've ever spent in SF.

author: Ron L.
text: Wow! Ambience, authenticity, menu selections was off the charts! I had the gnocchi with prawns a basil. Really delicious. Be careful when the waiter asks if you'd like Parmesan cheese on top. He added a little too much which made the pasta just a bit salty.

author: Emily K.
text: I can't say enough about this place... just come. Speak to Mauricio and you will have a smile on your face from the great conversation. Eat the food and your stomach will also be smiling. E stato una Bellissa serata :)

author: Kara R.
text: This place is amazing!!! The food and the atmosphere were fantastic! I love how all the staff spoke Italian, it made me feel like I was back in Italy. Definitely would recommend this place!

author: Denise V.
text: Recommended by a local, the minute we walked in we were treated like family. The food was so good, yummy and homemade. Highly recommend this place for genuine Italian food.

author: D H.
text: This place is delicious and has a warm friendly atmosphere.  A definite favorite SF restaurant of ours.  Can't wait to go back.  Maurizio, the chef / owner, is a pleasure to talk with.   There's so many tasty options, I ordered the Chicken San Marino, YUMMY!  We don't usually order appetizers, but we got the bruschetta - amazing and the best I've ever had.  FYI - I don't like tomatoes, lol.  As for the dessert, we ordered one of each and my favorite was the Panna Cotta

author: Mike M.
text:
Food was decent, service (management) was terrible, was a tourist and felt treated like one.  

The roasted garlic was good as was the pasta.  Waiter was pretty attentive and polite but...

The waiter spilled cream sauce and oil all over the patron, her clothes and bag (unintentionally) and when the matter was addressed with the restaurant manager, he told us to "take it up with the waiter".  No gesture was made to make things right by the restaurant...just to try to pry it out of the poor waiter...pathetic.

Can't go back to any restaurant that treats its customers like that.

author: C.Michael T.
text: Had an early dinner there on Sunday.  The food was just great and the wait staff was so nice to do separate checks, smiled, and chatted with us and made us all have a good time.  Shout outs to Marie and Jasper who were our food servers.  Will certainly go back any time I can.  Good place to eat after seeing BEACH BLANKET.

author: Joe G.
text:
This is YOUR kinda place ~ if you like a heckling foul mouthed and rude owner who insults pedestrians and possible clients all in italian, along with his entourage of  jerk waiters. 

Food, as appealing as the food is, i ABSOLUTELY don't deal with rude.  Nothing is more unappetiziing.

So heres the scenario, I was really in the mood for some italian and seafood right off San Fran. I pulled up on the patio outside, unknowing of my company - ordered the spinach salad and the risotto and mussels. 

I patiently awaited, the waiter forgot my beer. Then, after not being prompt for bringing it... criticized the busboy for forgetting. This is just the beggining...

As I got my salad, a few pedestrians walk by - and I hear this table of four making a mockery of anyone walking by -  I thought to myself - (jerks) and blew it off.

Then my main plate was served (or better stated Shoved!) , not giving me time to finish, and was rudely shoved the main plate in front of me, as if to hurry  things along(??) - 

 while I was only mildly disappointed, I then noticed a lady ask if they could also join on the patio with a dog they had. They owner feigned not understanding English well - then - as they walked away exclaimed ( Che catzo! che mangiamo caca?? - WTF? Do we eat shit here? How about we eat dog shit soup?? - at that point - I lost it, and yelled at him "Ya Basta! Che sto mangiando!" and his pathetic response - "Scusi? Scusi" and I had to repeat myself to him. Only to hear back -  "Ooooooh! Parla italiano!?" (he speaks italian) -

 the remainder of th meal, he turned his coward back to me with his real cool mullet and wanna be mafiosos and inwardly heckled. 

As I left, I gave him a hard stare, of which he couldn't bring himself to look me in the eye.

Sorry Guido, but...  next time, even though I may not look italian, I studied romance languages - douche bag!

author: Ashley M.
text: This place has a really interesting atmosphere. I had the pesto tortellini. It was delicious. They have a huge selection of risottos and a great selection of vegetarian pasta. I had a hard time deciding what to get, because I had so many options. The service is a bit on the slow side, but it was also 8pm on a Saturday night.

author: Klint N.
text: Best Italian spot in North beach!!! Risotto is always perfect and the service is always charming.

author: Natalie T.
text: I've always liked Mona Lisa's and come every so often. But today they seemed to have a cockroach problem. The first one at my table, I was willing to let go. Food in a city, I'm sure things happen. But ten minutes later, one on the table next to me. In the daytime. I think I'll wait a while before coming back. Hopefully, they'll fix this problem soon.

author: Nicole B.
text: The BEST gnocchi hands down. My family goes every year before Christmas and Mauricio always welcomes us. Great food, great service, great atmosphere. If you're looking for authentic Italian food, this is the place.

author: Kirk S.
text: OK guys just got to say took the family here for our annual Christmas gift to the family for lunch and a play it was our first time at the restaurant close friend of mine Dominic used to hang there a lot I got to say the food was outstanding the service was great fun restaurant excellent food we will definitely be back thank you very much for accommodating the nine of us we will see you guys soon thank you .again food was excellent. My daughter Jessica is a big foodie, like all of us.  she works in the industry and she couldn't say enough about the food and the restaurant so guys will be back soon look for us thank you again.

author: Angela T.
text: Such a wonderful restaurant! Everyone was so accommodating and friendly. First trip to San Fran and we were treated to one amazing night. Seated and served our wine and delicious cheesecake in the fiat out front. A truly unforgettable evening!!!

author: Tracy W.
text: Took our daughters here for dinner during a great trip to San Francisco!  It was my oldest daughters 15th birthday and she certainly got some attention sitting in the Fiat out front for dinner! Was so fun for all of us. Great people and great food! Thank you!

author: Shirley R.
text: One of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to! Took my out-of-town friends there and everyone was happy with the choice. Great service, great food, and awesome atmosphere. I'll definitely come back here again.

author: Vicki L.
text:
Fun Italian vibe and service! Very large Italian menus - all of the basics and more.

Order the meatballs to start!

author: Misha A.
text:
After a gorgeous day traipsing around the city,  a friend and I decided to stay in town for dinner and satisfy an Italian craving.  Wow did Mona Lisa deliver!  From the food, to the wine and the waiters, everything was authentically Italian.  

Although the dining room is small it's intimate and cozy.  I'm always about the food, and the menu was so extensive it was hard to choose just one entree.  I ordered  the gnocchi and it was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  I've never had better.  

The bottle of wine we ordered wasn't in stock but the bottle they recommended was even better.  Our waiter was absolutely adorable and we all got a good laugh when he couldn't understand a joke we told because his English "wasn't so good."

Of all the choices in North Beach, this one is definitely worth the visit.

author: Emily Y.
text: First time here & it was AMAZING!! The meatball appetizer was good! Best meatballs ever & the sauce is so fresh! The pescatore risotto was amazing and so was the porcini one!! Definitely coming back!

author: Jen S.
text: Very very good place to have authentic Italian food in north beach! I had the appetizer with roasted garlic. Then for my entree I had chicken piccata with pesto. Very delicious.  Our server Maria was fantastic!

author: Kara T.
text:
Such a disappointing North Beach restaurant.  The area has become so toursity (and seedy with all the nearby strip clubs).  I liked the decor so came inside and was dismayed to see "$12 per person minimum" on the menu.  I nearly left but we decided to stay. The cheese pizza was odd , with a liquidy pool of milky cheese on top making the crust soggy. Having just returned from Italy I can assure you it was NOT authentic nor was it really recognizabe.

The arugala salad was excellent (with capers and lemon) although a little light on the fresh shaved parm.

For a small pizza, arguala salad, cup of tea, and 2 milks for the kids I felt like we paid WAY too much.  Mona Lisa is a tourist trap I'd recommend you avoid.

Next time I'm in the area I'll be sure my YELP app is working (sadly, it wasn't loaded right on my phone) and if in doubt, I'll try for a side street over the main drag.

author: Kristina L.
text: While the host was fantastic (and the reason for the 3 stars), the food was mediocre at best. The house salad's "creamy italian dressing" tasted like it was made from Miracle Whip. The cannelloni was okay but the sauce was oily. The bread was very good and the olive and oil dip was good. Overall a bit over priced for the quality.

author: Fred M.
text:
Scary bad! I have to rate it one star because zero is not an option! Caesar salad: Made with mayonnaise as a base, or a REALLY cheap store bought dressing. Chicken San Francisco: Chicken drenched in salt topped with canned artichoke hearts. Gnocchi Fondenti: Think mashed potatoes and cheese. Also they are so proud of the wine by the glass that they don't list the brand and the won't let you taste it, is it still 1965?

Unfortunately we wasted a dinner in a wonderful food town like San Francisco. Please learn from our experience.

author: James L.
text:
My friend and I must have looked like tourists when we went here for lunch.  

We are given menus and wound up ordering a Caesar salad to share along with individual pizzas.  As we were finishing up our lunch, I found out that we had been given dinner menus instead of the lunch menus.  On the lunch menu, the salad was $2 cheaper and some of the pizzas were also a few dollars less expensive.

When the bill came and I saw that I had been charged the dinner price for the Caesar salad, I complained.  The waiter argued that the dinner Caesar salad was bigger, which is why we were being charged more.  However, he eventually agreed to lower the price.  

After he walked away, I talked to the people at a neighboring table.  They had ordered the same sized Caesar salad but said that they had ordered it off of the lunch menu.  In other words, the waiter had been, in the language of diplomacy, disappointingly inaccurate.
 
The food itself was O.K. but nothing special.

author: Margo J.
text: A group of us, 9 to be exact, spent a day at the treasure island flea market and decided to take a drive to North Beach.  We didn't have reservations anywhere and being such a large group I didn't think we would get in anywhere.  We happened upon the Mona Lisa and Marcello, was kind enough to move all of the outside tables to accommodation our group.  When we shared that one of our grandparents was from Calabria they hooked us up with 2 appetizer platters at no charge.  The platter had prosciutto bruschetta and cheese an olives...a perfect antipasto plate.  We also had the candy (roasted garlic) very tasty.  The service was very attentive and the food was good.  We had many different dishes and the seafood risotto was one of the favs.  It was interesting to see all of the negative comments around service.  We actually had 5 star service.

author: Darcel T.
text: Great service, large portions, good food. Will be back for sure. The owner is very friendly!

author: Anthony P.
text: Amazing food, fast service, was seated and had food in our table within 15 minutes. Would recommend for anyone wanting real authentic Italian food!

author: Massimo C.
text: I go to Mona Lisa every time I want to have the best possible Italian experience in SF. It all starts with Maurizio greeting you at the door with some of his jokes, then if you sit outside you have a beautiful view on the heart of North Beach and if you're inside you're surrounded by all sorts of colorful decorations and pictures of the many international celebrities who have been there. The menu is great, you'll always find what you're craving for in there, and the food is fresh, tasty and authentic. My favorite dish is the risotto allo scoglio, a beautiful looking dish, perfectly cooked with amazing seafood. Maurizio will likely surprise you with complimentary appetizers and those are just amazing! Portions are abundant and you'll feel full but you have to try the tiramisu as well, probably the best I've ever had!

author: Namit R.
text: We booked the car parked out side the restaurant for my Wife's Bday and it was an awesome experience. Even the food was really good and staff was very friendly

author: Han J.
text: Mona Lisa love. Every time we come here we have an amazing time! The food is delicious and keeps us coming back. The love throughout the restaurant makes you feel a part of the family. We would give you a million stars if we could!

author: Lisa D.
text:
I don't know where to start...like a kid in a candy store? Ate here for lunch Sunday afternoon. The menu is very extensive and portions are large, with each plate approx. $17. There were only 3 or 4 tables so we had excellent service. Our server and busser were both very friendly and attentive. Our drinks and basket of hot bread arrived quickly, and our appetizer came out fairly quickly as well.

The dessert menu was fabulous, and all desserts are $8. I purposely didn't touch any bread, and took it easy with the calamari and my pizza so I could indulge.  

 They offered to box up our leftovers, which we declined as we had a flight to catch. Wasn't expecting that, but was very impressed. Heated seating outside. Here's our notes:

Caesar salad - homemade croutons, lots of dressing if you like that. 

Calamari Fritti- Light crispy coating, these were delectable.

Pizza Napoletana- crispy crust, but pales in comparison to Tony's, which I had the day before. Cheese, garlic and tomato blend was perfect but will not order this again. Next time I'll try the Margherita.

Gnocchi Fondenti- If you can't get enough cheese, then this one's for you as it was dripping with cheese! This is a light fluffy gnocchi, not as doughy as we had a few days earlier at Fior. It was softly tender and melted in my mouth!

Chicken Parmigiana- small portion with no pasta, accompanied with decent potatoes and spinach. Lightly breaded and very tasty. 

Tiramisu- Lovely, light and  heaven in your mouth. Always the perfect end to a wonderful Italian meal.

Chocolate Protiferoles - these little cream puffs were smothered in chocolate - OMG I thought I was going to have to buy an extra plane ticket for my ever expanding fat arse!

Chianti - how do you screw this up? Large wine glasses - gotta love that! After the Chianti, we had another red, Valpolicella Cesari which was excellent. 

Loved this place! I would highly recommend it for a romantic dinner.

author: Vuyelwa W.
text:
Went on saturday night cause had friends in town and had an amazing night. First of all the menu is very extensive. We shared the calamari and prawn appetizer and that was crispy and done just right. We then ordered the crab linguini and the chicken cacciotore for our entree meals. The food was super delicious especially the chicken. We ended the meal with their Tiramisu dessert...Was super delicious..Cant even explain how delicious it was...

So overall a great experience- the waiter was super great as well...

We will definitely be back!:)!

Parking is atrocious so make sure you take a cab or something...thats the downside!!

author: Reese A.
text: Don't be fooled by those pasta plates! They look small in portion but they're pretty deep. I was happy about that. I ordered fettucini w/ my boyfriend - nothing special but not bad either. Just add some salt to bring out the flavor. My favorites were the calamari and pizza - delicious!!! Ambience is nice but kinda dark so don't expect to take good photos. LOL. Service was good. I would go back again. :]

author: Richard O.
text: Good pasta, fair service, and fair prices. We stopped by because it looked interesting and very busy. Great dinner!

author: Neil S.
text: When I think about the Mona Lisa Restaurant, I think of only great attributes. From the moment Maurizio, the owner, welcomed us with his thick Italian accent to his fare well, the service we received was impeccable. Our server, Joshua, was fantastic, engaging us in fun and interesting conversation, whilst keeping our stomachs happy. This authentic Italian restaurant is a must if you happen to be in San Francisco. It is one of the best I've ever had. I personally had the opportunity to try the gnocchi (delicious) and the meatballs (fantastic). All I can say is MANGIA! I will surely be returning the next time I am in San Francisco!

author: Mike J.
text: First time here and  came with some friends for a late lunch.   Had a wonderful appetizer,  of bruschetta,  calamari,  and meat and cheese sampler - all of which were fantastic!  I ordered the pesto lasagna,  and  my  fiance had the chicken capranese.  I would recommend either.  Service was great there - all around a wonderful experience.

author: Ken W.
text:
Mona Lisa is one of our "go to" restaurants in North Beach.  I would say that many (most) places on Columbus are over priced tourist traps that serve mediocre food at elevated prices. Mona Lisa is not cheap... but the quality and service are always very good. 

I highly recommend the veal dishes and the pastas are very fresh and never disappoint. Caesar salad is very good. Service is always good. Decor as you might guess is Mona Lisa / Italian style. 

Side note: I took my wife here a couple years back on her birthday and we had to wait about 30 min for a table even though we had a reservation. The owner (or manager) was very sorry about the wait and brought out some champagne and sang to her while we waited. It was a class move and it made the night very special for her. 

This is one of the few places in North Beach that we do not hesitate to recomend to people.

author: Rigoberto C.
text: all i have to say is the aldon smith is the best i like the spice it comes with. the owner of the place is a cool guy very funny. he even made us a special sauce for our bread which was good. small place with great food im not italian but i bet this is what italian food is suppose to taste like. 5 stars from me because everything was great the night i went.

author: Daniel R.
text: My first time to SF I went to this classy Italian style restaurant. And my gosh did I love their seafood. A bit pricy, but I was prepared to spend. By the looks of it, a very popular place with celebrities. I recommend if you are visiting SF as a couple, this ougt to be on your list.

author: Ninotchka A.
text: Worst take out by far. Do not order to go. They just slop everything in a box. Over cooked salmon. No utensils. Completely wrong order. When asking for a manager. They were on vacation. Asked for a supervisor. None at the restaurant. Are you serious?! Walked over to the restaurant. Oh wait. There they are! Do not expect service here.

author: Ava M.
text: I recently had my birthday dinner here with  25 of my friends in this tiny romantic restaurant. It wasn't the best spot to have such a large group but they definitely made sure that we were happy and satisfied. The food was amazing, I had the Gorgonzola gnocchi which was perfect. I think Mona Lisa would be a wonderful spot for a date night in Little Italy :)

author: Kt S.
text: I brought a friend visiting from Calabria, Italy because another resturant recommended as a bona fide Calabrian Cucina. Mona Lisa's is fantastico! The owner and staff are gracious and generous (true Italian hospitality) and the food and wines are amazing! The Cioppino is the best I have ever had- anywhere. highly recommended to anyone seeking geniune Calabrese/Italian Cuisine in Little Italy. We have been back again and will recoomend to everyone we know! Grazie Mona Lisa!

author: Brent S.
text: Since moving to North Beach, I've been attempting to try all the Italian restaurants in the area. Some negative reviews deterred me from trying Mona Lisa, but after a positive recommendation from my girlfriend I decided to give it to a shot. I'm happy to say that I was pleasantly surprised. Great service and good food made for a positive experience and a happy customer. The Macara homemade was delicious as was the minestrone. Surprisingly good coffee as well. Will definitely be back.

author: Stephanie C.
text: I have stopped at this restaurant a couple times while in the city. I can say I have yet to have an issue with the food or service, everything that we have ordered has surpassed expectations! The gnocchi is phenomenal and made daily. The best Italian food I have had outside of Italy.

author: Kenny C.
text: Was really looking forward to trying a new Italian spot in the city -as Bucca di Beppo is my usual go to place; however I am really disappointed from my experience the the Mona Lisa. Firstly, the wait was ridiculous; second; our waiter was terrible; and third: the food was disgusting. I got the Diabola Pizza and I'm not even kidding you -this stuff tastes like the kind of pizza you will find at a gas station. Couldn't tell if I was eating a cardboard box or a pizza. Definitely won't be back.

author: Karen O.
text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would. The food is outstanding ( lasagna and risotto are my fav), but you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu. Aside from the delicious food, the ambiance is better than any other establishment in the city. The service is great and Mauricio the owner is so sweet and always warmly greets folks at the door. Absolutely love it! Stop reading this review and go right now :)

author: Colin D.
text: Most delicious food ever. Calamari was superb . Service was excellent. A bit pricy but it's all worth it!

author: Annie P.
text:
If your looking for authentic and tasty italian....come to Mona Lisa. My friend and I were on the prowl for Italian and came across this place. It looks small from the inside but its quite roomy once you walk in. We were seated promptly and the customer service was on point. The man who seated us stands out in front and greets guest....luckily for me he also helped scare away the meter maid! Thank you! Who puts 30 minute MAX meters on streets w/tons of restaurants?! Ridiculous! I had to go out to my car every 30 mins to ante up on the meter! YIKES! Almost didn't enjoy my lunch BUT I still did!!!! Muahahaha. Here's what we ordered:

-Fried calamari $13.95
-Risotto Pescatore $16.95
-Linguini alla silana $13.95
-1 coke
-1 sprite

Keep the bread, butter and vinegar & EVOO cominnnn'!!!!! :)

-Fried calamari was pretty tasty and the portion was HUGE. My friend and I added a ton of crushed red pepper to the marinara sauce. Spicier is always better! 
-The Risotto was sooooo bomb! Best Risotto I've ever had! My friend who is in love w/Risotto absolutely fell in love with it. It was very creamy and cooked to perfection. Some places cook the Risotto way too long and it loses the Risotto rice texture but Mona Lisa did it perfectly. No wonder it took awhile for the main dishes to come out. It was worth the wait!
-The linguini alla silana was very good also. It definitely tasted home made for some reason! Hahahaha. The mushrooms and eggplant went so wonderfully w/the sauce. It was delectable! Momomomom.

One complaint...
#1. The restaurant obviously is pretty famous because there were photos of celebs up everywhere who have eaten at Mona Lisa! Which was fun to look at. However, I felt very clustered and bunched in. Too many tables crammed into one restaurant....half the time I was trying to zone out other tables conversations and listen to my friend talk. It felt intimate but invasive at the same time. BUT it also ment that Mona Lisa probably gets very very busy! Personally, for me...the tables were put too close together

All in all definitely go try Mona Lisa. The service is very good and the food is so tasty and authentic! I'm definitely going back!

author: Shawn J.
text: Outstanding food and service! The veal parmesan was terrific as well as the four cheese tortellini. A must try :)

author: Kevin B.
text: Great service, great food. Ordered the Mona Lisa fettuccine and it was by far the best I've ever had. I will be coming back.

author: Serena T.
text: One of the best Italian Restaurants I have experienced in a long time. I had the pleasure of meeting the owner, Mauricio, he is the BEST, treated us like family. Our server, CIRO was very nice and attentive. Our glasses were never empty!!  For appetizers we started off with an antipasto plater, delicioso!!! I'm not a fan of clams, but for my birthday my order was a special request with prawns, salmon and clams on top of linguini noodles with a creamy white wine sauce!! Worth the visit!!! Best birthday and dinner spent at this restaurant. Good food, great atmosphere and friendliest staff.  Must visit!!!

author: Johnson H.
text: Love Mona Lisa. A great place to enjoy a meal. And if you look at the walls, you'll see the younger version of the host.

author: Katie D.
text: If I could give this place 6 stars, I would.  They made my 30th bday so special!  You will know the place by the 1960s Fiat out front, which you can even sit in!  Service and food were both fabulous, not to mention the champagne.  Very reasonably priced.

author: Mario S.
text: My favorite restaurant in San Fran!  Since being here on business with colleagues for the past month we have eaten at many restaurants in the city. Mona Lisa never disappoints.  Great food, excellent service and VIP hospitality always from Mauricio!!  Been there 3 times already and will be back!

author: safoura h.
text:
The worst seafood pasta I've had in my life. If I made spaghetti with only ketchup, it would be more tasty. We were 7 people and ordered all different kinds dishes and the only decent one was the Pizza which was too salty for my taste and I do like salty. 

Don't get fooled by the music and the ambiance, once we got seated it was the most depressive music which killed our mood to go out after. The service was also really bad, we had to wait a really long time for everything even though it was only 2 other tables. They include 20% tip in the bill because they know no one would leave a good tip.

author: Brandon K.
text: Great food and best service in San Francisco. I Highly recommend a waiter named Josh, he was quick with our drinks and orders, and was always checking in for more. By far the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco, if your ever nearby I highly recommend a visit.

author: Meghann V.
text: We chose this place because of the very nice gentleman out front (owner? host? we're not sure).  He made a very positive impression on us and we became immediately interested.  We were absolutely delighted with our choice.  The setting is great (my kids love to play I-spy and this place is great for that, there are tons of things to look at.). Our waiter was perfection.  I wish I could remember his name, sorry, but it looked like every one working there was equally great.  Our food was pretty good, (the calamari was awesome and the olive paste/dip for your bread you get is straight yummy) although I did dock one star because my husbands spaghetti and meat balls was just ok and my linguine with shrimp and asparagus was good but not great.  Dessert though- delicious!  I would absolutely go back in a heart beat.

author: Sarah B.
text: Great food, wonderful atmosphere. Great service. Excellent experience. Parking in Little Italy can be a challenge sometimes but completely worth it.

author: Kacie C.
text: Absolutely amazing! After living in Italy, this is as close to authentic Italian food as I've found in the states. I had the Arrabbiata and my momma has tortellini ticolli. Both were to die for!

author: Rita K.
text:
This was one of the few restaurants opened around 10pm in North Beach so we decided to give this a try. I think we came at the wrong time because the restaurant only had 3 other customers and us, yet our waiter forgot about us. Quite sad actually, we were just sitting there starving and tired. We ordered a dish of risotto and I ordered a simple tomato basil pasta... terrible! The foods tasted like it was in the fridge then heated up on high heat. The pasta tasted like it was either undercooked or overcooked, we couldn't tell, but it was doughy and weird tasting. I saw the cooks taking the tomato sauce out of a container and heating it up on top of the pasta. I'm sure this is a great restaurant, or maybe my tastebuds are wrong, but we def didn't enjoy our meal. I think the owner came up to us and saw my place still full, and said in a cute Italian accent "please finish, for me, please eat" *hand gesture for eating*. =]. I ended up not finishing my pasta... I think we paid way too much for these foods, and they gave us Italian portions...

The interior is very nice, loved the various paintings on the wall. Some say its cheesy but its nice having something Italian-like in the bay.

author: Liz M.
text:
My friend was craving pasta so we decided to try Mona Lisa. We were quickly greeted and seated outside. It was a little cramped for parties larger than 2 on the front patio, but a nice atmosphere and view of the neighborhood. 

The menu is large, so there is something for everyone here. To drink I ordered the house wine, which wasn't bad, but a bit pricey at $7.50 a glass. 

For lunch I ordered the Ravioli ai Quattro Formaggi. The four cheese sauce was so good, but very rich. I ate half the dish and most of the four cheese sauce to dip the bread they bring the table (which was dry).

Overall good food, but a little pricey for a casual lunch.

author: Kathy M.
text: We ate dinner here Saturday night. The food was excellent, the service was fast, the owner Mauricio was very nice and entertaining. He even comped us delicious tiramisu. Sit outside to enjoy people watching too.

author: Richard H.
text: Arrived early for my Valentines day reservation they took us in right away with no hassle. Great calamari gritty nice and salty. Wife enjoyed baked ravioli w/ mozzarella while my spaghetti bolognese was delightful. Pizza napolatena was light and tasty. A great new dining experience for us and a wonderful valentine's day

author: Maria R.
text: Dinner last night was really fun and service was outstanding. Food was also great! Can taste fresh pasta and ingredients. Will definitely be back again.

author: Jayme G.
text: I was frantically trying to find a restaurant on a Friday night for our group. This place had a large menu so everyone found something they could enjoy. They have gluten free pizza and pasta! We got right in at 6:45 pm. Great service, great food.

author: Mike C.
text:
I love this place. I don't have a bad thing to say about it. Every time I walk by, something pulls me in. I feel like I'm walking into a scene from A Bronx Tale if Lorenzo Anello took Rosina out for a nice summer evening dinner. 

Something about the older Italian dudes, sitting out front at their usual table discussing todays events with vigorous hand motions interests me to no end. And this is all before walking into the place. 

Once inside it's a very romantic atmosphere with low lighting and a very nice decor. I am always treated very nicely, if I'm dressed up for an evening out or sun burned and sweating in my Dodgers jersey after watching my boys smash on the Giants at AT&T Park. The service is always great and quick. I also like the way you can watch the cooks work their magic as the kitchen is right up front. 

The food is delicious! I usually go for the ravioli or chicken parm. Never had an issue of any sort here. By far, my fave restaurant in Northern California. My first all time being Miceli's in L.A. Mona Lisa is a close second. 

All this and really good prices too. Don't sleep on this place.

The saddest thing in life is wasted talent.

author: Eric B.
text: Took our daughter here for her 18th bd. Had butternut squash ravioli in sage butter, eggplant parm, and salmon in garlic and all three dishes exceeded our expectations. One of the top 2 eggplant Parma I've ever had, including in NYC. Fantastic food.

author: Steven C.
text: I love arrabiata sauce. Anywhere I go that has it, I try it. This place has hands down the best arrabiata sauce. It's got a great atmosphere. I will be back for sure.

author: Jonathan C.
text: Outstanding experience. Authentic Italian hospitality. The wine was delicious, the food was amazing and the service was top-notch definitely recommend this place. Be sure to  hi shake hands with Mauricio's (the owner), he's a good man!

author: Food C.
text: Don't go there. Extremely rude manager/owner. We made the mistake of looking at reviews at another reservation site and reserving the place. But one quick chat with the guy at the front who essentially said "I don't care if you have a reservation or not. We are busy, just wait" was enough to walk away.

author: John L.
text: Are you kidding this is by far the best, I come all the way from the east bay on bart and on foot to have dinner here. We have tried all the other " Italian " places up and down Columbus but I have a problem I am full blooded Italian and you can always tell the difference with not only the food but the service, ambience and even the bear hugs at the door to great you. I have friends that insist I take them there for the lasagna which is a feast. I love the veal Palermo, you haven't lived unless you have tried the pasta de mar. Dang just made my self hungry.

author: Justin S.
text:
Nothing to write home about but I will be back. In a city with a million great restaurants it's extremely hard to stand out but this well established North Beach favorite has been around because the food is good and the service is above average. When we arrived at 8:05 on a Tuesday evening with no reservation we were promptly seated at the second to last table. Within five minutes all the tables were full.

The huge menu was a little overwhelming but after much discussion I ordered the Mona Lisa Fettucini and she had the ravioli. She mentioned the raviolis were a little "saucie" and I have to agree but it was still good. The Fetichini was good not only because the pasta was extremely fresh but the sauce was was full of flavor although not in the top ten for this city but still darn good.

The ambiance is a bit cluttered but even with every table full the restaurant is no too loud. I give it a low four stars but will be back in the future.

author: Tom H.
text: Food great Service even better a taste of Italia in North Beach!!!! From the appetizer plate to the veal marsala!!! Buon Giorno!!!

author: Alex P.
text: Went a few years ago and had a GREAT experience with the antipasto and fettuccine alfredo a few years ago, but this time wasn't so great. I had crab linguini which was just bleh and the staff didn't seem as friendly as before. Still a great restaurant.

author: Alison M.
text: Had dinner in the car this past Friday night: cozy, romantic, and very attentive service. Great bruschetta and the salmon with garlic and herbs was spot on. The wine list was Italian focused and certainly matched the food well. Highly recommend to anyone looking for great food and a fun experience not to be forgotten. Thanks for a great evening!!

author: Mari G.
text: Very poor customer service, my husband and I walked in last nite and there was hardly anyone there eating and a couple of  workers walking around. After standing there for a couple of minutes waiting to be seated, we got the feeling we weren't welcome. Im guessing our casual  clothes that we were wearing wasn't  good enough. To bad they were never told to Never judge a book but it's cover. Cause this book had more than enough to spend. I will let my family and friends and co - workers know about this incident.

author: Elisabetta M.
text:
If you want to understand Italian cooking, book a table for dinner at the Monalisa Restaurant and order arancini siciliani, Risotto alla pescatora e Salmone Pisciaiulo .... and enjoy you dinner with a good  wine too ;)

I am Italian, and I leave in USA since 2007. It is not easy find a place where you can really test good italian food, but here in Monalisa i had a wonderful experience. It was like be back at home!!!!!
Everybody is so friendly and charming, just like italy and the food it is simply delicius.

You must try also the amazing PIZZA they make, OMG never had a pizza so good in USA!!!!!
Can't wait to go back again in this restaurant.... i Leave in San diego but everytime i go to San Francisco i never miss the opportunity to enjoy the magic atmosphear and the Delicius italian food in Monalisa.

So really thanks to Monalisa and I hope you guys will enjoy soon this "temple of gastronomy"

author: John A.
text: Horrible service. I walked in around 4:50. 25 minutes later, I hadn't received the glass of wine I ordered or any food. I got up and walked out. There was one waiter and about 7 tables. Totally unacceptable service.

author: Sharon M.
text: Homemade and savory! From appetizers to dessert, a nice change of pace from the tourist restaurants. A perfect glass of Prosecco kept the atmosphere in check.

author: Gail W.
text: Food is fantastic!!  Service was ok. Our sever was very nice but once once our food came he never came back to refill out drinks or check on us until we had finished our meal.  The came back to all the other tables around us but we felt ignored.

author: Robin G.
text: The manager & waiter made my friends & I feel so welcome! We ended up getting a free appetizer & desserts. The calamari was good & crispy how I like it. The desserts were pure bliss, one was a pistachio ice cream & another was a cappuccino ball. My lobster ravioli was fresh. Everything was yummy & made the dining experience truly enjoyable. Whenever I'm in SF again, I'll definitely return!

author: Wynton F.
text: Another wonderful family owned restaurant. The food is all made classic Italian style, which makes for a great sauce. The atomosphere of the restaurant is very romantic. You can even share a bite to eat with your date in a restored Fiat that sits out front of the restaurant. I was very impressed by how interacting the manager was on a busy Saturday night. Taking the time to walk around and interact with every table. Really changes the customers experience from good to great.

author: Mandy D.
text:
3.5 Stars

When you step into this place, it looks quite dark. No worries though, your eyes will adjust to it. The decor is quite nice, but it can get a bit crowded. I had the Chicken San Francisco, which I originally thought it had some pasta, but it was chicken, potatoes, spinach, and other veggies. I thought it was pretty good. However, the potatoes were quite salty.  

The waiter seemed like he was in a rush. He came and took our dishes without really gesturing whether we were ALL finished with our dishes. My friend still had food on her plate, but she was pretty much done.

When it came time for the bill, the waiter jotted down the wrong prices on both of my friends orders. Their dishes were a few dollars less than what he initially wrote. When we asked him about it and showed him the menu price, he told us that it was busy and they calculated them by hand. Fine, but he only corrected one of the dishes and not the other. He was so in a rush that he did not correct the entire bill to what it was suppose to be. So we took the time to calculate it ourselves. 

Despite of the ending, I would maybe consider coming back because there is such a huge selection of dishes here and the dish I had was good.

author: Keriyana C.
text: Omgoshhh hands down best Italian food I've had.  I had some strange calamari pasta in black sauce no idea what it was,  looked funky but lordy lordy it was incredible.  The flavors were pure simple yet I could not taste the ingredients.  The chicken marsala is superb I loved the spinach.  I was also able to enjoy their beaded calamari, I loved the fact it wasn't heavy breading.. Light & flavorful.  I wish this place was closer but I'll Def make the 6 hr drive just to try more on their menu.

author: Deborah S.
text:
This should be only a tourist spot, but it is not!! A couple of local SF friends joined us for a wonderful evening, starting with one of the best sampler platters, enough to enjoy and good variety. We shared the gnocchi, three cheese, a bit of heaven in each mouth ful.
We than shared the carpaccio, do not get this, it had been plated many hours(days) before, and the thin slices of meat stuck to the plate and had gotten hard and crusty.
Wonderful deserts, all four of them!
Big downfall is no hard liquor, I really craved a drink before dinner.
There are many great Italian resurants in SF, this one has atmosphere, great food, and most of all a family of Italians meet you at the door, and you feel like you have been going there forever, I value this aspect.

We will be back.

author: Jamie B.
text:
Three of went there for dinner and we all loved our meal. We had to wait about 20 minutes, but it was well worth it. They have an open kitchen so it is great to see the talented kitchen staff cook. They do a great job and are very fast.
One suggestion, if asked if you wan to sit outside, don't do it.

author: Alisa S.
text: The food is delicious and the service is fast. They have the biggest menu I've ever seen with amazing food. There's no bad dish here. Highly recommend.

author: Charles Z.
text: This place was recommended by friend and I decided to check it out.  My first impression was wow this place is crowded. We were seated in the back of the restaurant where the tables were so  close that waiters and customers walking by would bump our elbows if we stuck them out too much.  It was also too warm, so much so that I broke a sweat when the food finally came. Btw, it only took 1 hour to serve our food. Once they did, they got one of our orders wrong. When we asked our waitress, she reassured us it was the right plate. By that time we were fed up and took a couple bites of our meals and asked for the check. Needless to say, we will not be returning to this establishment.

author: Noni M.
text: I loved this place.  I've been coming for years.  They treat you like family and make great recommendations.  Everything I've eaten here is delicious.

author: Jess M.
text: Excellent restaurant and excellent service. We had a large party and our waiter, Mario went above and beyond to ensure that our entire family was happy. Food was delicious!  We would definitely recommend this place!

author: Benjamin K.
text:
I honestly meant to go to Franchino and didn't realize my mistake until I paid the bill.  HAH!

No worries though, the food and service here was excellent.  My friend had a seafood risotto and I ordered the mushroom ravioli, washed it down with a glass of Chianti.

The lighting is dim and the tables are intimate.  Good for a date.  The atmosphere is classic, traditional.  Go on a quiet weeknight and avoid the crowds of tourists on the weekends.

author: Tom L.
text:
Cheesy Italian decor instantly makes me uneasy. Thankfully the food was decent, not the disaster I expected after looking up at the faux Sistine Chapel ceiling. 

The white wine seafood risotto lacked the bold flavors I've grown to love and expect. The spaghetti carbonara was just ok, mainly because the sauce didn't have the  rich cream base that the salty ham is supposed to balance out. 

Overall a decent Italian restaurant in North Beach, but not the type of place that gives me flashbacks of living in Rome. If you are looking for a good North Beach date spot, look elsewhere.

author: April S.
text:
The food here isn't great, but isn't bad either. 

I'm definitely not a fan of their cramped seating.

They have a  little "Mona Lisa" car in front of the restaurant where they can seat people to eat. It's a little cute but I find it awkward... Especially when tourists walking by stop to strike pose for a picture...right next to you having dinner.. but whatever floats your boat.

author: Carolen M.
text:
Why do I not have good experiences in North Beach?  *Sigh*  Perhaps it's just Italian food and me don't mix.  So last night a group of us went to dinner here before we were going to dance the night away at Dragon Bar (look at my review there).  Let's break it down.

~ Neighborhood ~
Situated in the heart of North Beach, it's one of your busier restauarants.  It's right across from Steps of Rome on the corner of Columbus and Vallejo.

~ Parking ~
There are a few parking places.  The China Town Parking Garage charges $2 for every 30 min.  NOT WORTH IT.  Go a few more blocks north to the Vallejo Garages where it's $3 every hour (first hour is $1, past that from 1-2 hours it's $3, 2-3 hours $6, etc).

~ Restaurant Atmosphere ~
The restaurant has, as my friend stated, a European feel.  Many tables are set up, close to each other, and it feels like you're in an alleyway in Italy.  Also all the Italian being spoken was great.

~ Food ~
They give you lots of bread which my friends devoured as we were waiting for our food to come out.  I got the Grilled Mixed Seafood Entree.  It came on a sizzling plate with potatoes, spinach, salmon, 2 shrimps, and tuna steak.  Nothing special actually.  I felt it was overpriced grilled seafood.

~ Service ~
Slow...but I think that's to be expected.  It was prime time dinner and it's in North Beach.  It took maybe half an hour to get our food.  We were so hungry.  

I just feel like I can get the same quality food, better service and at cheaper prices...but again this is North Beach.

author: Darren J.
text: My wife and I had dinner here on a Saturday night. The food was great and very reasonably priced. Great ambiance in the restaurant. Great service! We will definitely come back!

author: Devin R.
text: We celebrated our 20th anniversary on 9-7-16 at Mona Lisa.  We have eaten there many times and it is always an excellent experience.  This was no exception.  Incredible food and amazing staff!  We travel over 50 miles (Sebastopol) to eat there and have never been disappointed.  They always accommodate special request and actually made me a dish not listed on the menu.  That is something I would never request at any restaurant but they are not like any other restaurant I've been to.  We have had family meals (2 young children) and romantic candle lit dinners for two at The Mona Lisa.  Perfect for any occasion.  We can't wait to go back!   Thanks Mona Lisa!!

author: Aron H.
text: As far as Italian goes they are okay. I ended up ordering pizza here and it was decent. If you want a sit down restaurant with a large selection this is definitely a great place to go. They do serve great cappuccinos  and that is always awesome.

author: Gayle S.
text: The best meal, wine and service. Went for a birthday celebration and the staff took special care and made the night memorable.  We will be back.

author: Louise E.
text: I was in San Francisco for work recently. I hate traveling without my husband and kids--I missed them terribly--so I took along walk. I was hungry but not sure for what... probably just company? Well, I stumbled upon the Mona Lisa by way of the waiter Casper talking to me on the sidewalk outside. Hooray!  A friendly face! Of course I ventured in. I felt like I was walking into someone's house; it was that personable and inviting. The food was amazing--I can't stop thinking about the meatballs, the bruschetta, the cream puffs, the olives... The ambiance is wonderful and was just what I needed. I travel to SF several times a year and I will stop there every time. Such a great place.

author: Brittany G.
text:
What a great evening! We went to Mona Lisa for the first time and had the best evening.

Turns out my husband and the owner are from the same town in Calabria, and we ended up having so much fun talking with everyone at the restaurant the entire evening. 

If you appreciate/love the experience of dining in Italy -- this place makes you feel like you're there! The music, the atmosphere, the people -- so fun!

If you eat seafood we definitely recommend La Voce del Mare - we cleaned the plate and made sure every ounce of the sauce was gone by using the bread to soak it up!

author: Delphine R.
text:
So living in San Diego, on our way down to the wharf, we walked through Little Italy and through Yelp was told this place was very good.
Hmmmm it was ok, the pizza was kinda small and i think the prices a little bit pricey . I think our Little Italy in San Diego is way better

author: Diane C.
text: I love and love this restaurant! I have eaten at Mona Lisa's for years and the great food and service is consistently GREAT!!!! Mauricio has from the start made me feel as one of the family.
